Our mortal form for mortal's sake!

For us baptized, for us He bore
His holy fast and hungered sore;
For us temptation sharp He knew;
For us the tempter over threw.

For us by wickedness betrayed,
For us, in crown of thorns arrayed,
He bore the shameful cross and death;
For us He gave His dying breath.

For us He rose from death again,
For us He went on high to reign;
For us He sent His Spirit here
To guide, to strengthen, and to cheer.

All glory to our Lord and God
For love so deep, so high, so broad;
The Trinity whom we adore
Forever and forevermore.

title:
B're Bi Dawid Ahenk'ro Nom
Once in Royal David's City
songEN:
B're bi Dawid ahenk'ro nom,
Wx mmoa adididan mu,
Nea qna bi dedaa ne Ba,
De sare yqq Ne mpa no,
Maria ne xbaatan no;
Yesu Kristo, ne Ba no.

Ofii s'ro baa asase so,
Nea Xyq ade ny'naa W'ra;
Ne dan yq mmoa 'didi daka,
Ne mpa nso yq sare nko;
Yqn Agyenkwa kronkron no
Ne 'hiafo traa wiase ha.

N'anwanwa mmofraa b'rem ny'naa no,
Xmaa 'nidi, yqq setie;
Xde dx hwqq Ne na wiqmfo
A Xda ne nsa so no;
Kristofo mmofra nyinaa,
Monyq setie sq Xno.

Daakye yqn ani behu No,
N'ankasa dx nkwagye mu;
Fisq saa 'Bofra dxfo yi,
Yq yqn Aw'rade wx s'ro;
Na Odi Ne mmofrá anim
Akx nea Xwx hx no.
songTWI:
Once in royal David's city
Stood a lowly cattle shed,
Where a mother laid her Baby
In a manger for His bed;
Mary was that mother mild,
Jesus Christ her little Child.

He came down to earth from heaven,
Who is God and Lord of all,
And His shelter was a stable,
And His cradle was a stall;
With the poor, and mean, and lowly,
Lived on earth our Savior holy.

And through all His wondrous childhood
He would honor and obey,
Love and watch the lowly mother
In whose gentle arms He lay.
Christian children all must be
Mild, obedient, good as He.

And our eyes at last shall see Him,
Through His own redeeming love;
For that Child so dear and gentle
Is our Lord in heaven above;
And He leads His children on
To the place where He is gone.

title:
Hena n'Xda Mmoa Dan Mų a
Who Is He in Yonder Stall?
songEN:
Hena n'Xda mmoa dan mų a
Nguanhwqfo koto No yi?

Nnyeso
Aw'radč a, O anwanwasqm,
Aw'radč a, anuonyam Hen' no!
Yqkoto No 'hobrqasem'
Yqhyq No ahen' mu Hen';
Yqkoto No 'hobrqasem' - ahen' mu
Hen'; Yqhyq No hen',
Yqhyq Yesu no ahen' mu Hen'.

Hena na 'haw hyq No sō a
Odi mmuada sar' so yi?

Hena na nnipa mpempem
To 'h'rusi dwom ma No yi?

Hena na xdasum yi
Xbx mpae Getsemane?

Hena n'Xsqn dua bi so
Rewu 'nimguase wu yi?

Hena na Wanyan 'fi 'wum'
Rebqgye nnipa nkwa yi?

Hena n'Ofi N'agua so
Di wiase ny'naa so Hen' yi?
songTWI:
Who is He in yonder stall,
At whose feet the shepherds fall?

Refrain
'Tis the Lord, O wondrous story,
'Tis the Lord, the King of glory!
At His feet we humbly fall,
Crown Him, crown Him Lord of all.
At His feet we humbly fall- the Lord of all.
Crown Him, crown Him, Jesus, Jesus,
Crown Him Lord of all.

Who is He in deep distress,
Fasting in the wilderness?

Who is He, the gathering throng
Greet with loud triumphant song?

Lo, at midnight, who is He
Prays in dark Gethsemane?

Who is He on yonder tree
Dies in shame and agony?

Who is He that from the grave
Comes to heal and help and save?

Who is He that from His throne
Rules through all the world alone?

title:
Yesu Nantee Saa Bonhwa Yim'
Jesus Walked This Lonesome Valley
songEN:
Yesu nantee saa bonhwa yim';
N'ankasa na Xnantew mu.
Na obi ntumi nnante mu mma No.
N'ankasa na Xnantee mu.

'Sq sq migyina me sxhwqm',
M'ankasa na megyina mu.
Obiara ntumi nnyina mu mma me.
M'ankasa na megyina mu.

Yesu nantee saa bonhawa yim';
N'ankasa na Xnantew mu.
Na obi ntumi nnante mu mma No.
N'ankasa na Xnantee mu.
songTWI:
Jesus walked this lonesome valley;
He had to walk it by Himself.
O nobody else could walk it for Him.
He had to walk it by Himself.

I must go and stand my trial.
I have to stand it by myself.
O nobody else could stand it for me.
I have to stand it by myself.

Jesus walked this lonesome valley;
He had to walk it by Himself.
O nobody else could walk it for Him.
He had to walk it by Himself.

title:
Ka Yesu Ho Nsqm Kyerq Me
Tell Me the Story of Jesus
songEN:
Ka Yesu ho nsqm kyerq me,
Ky'rqw 'sqm biara me komam';
Ka nsqm a qsom bo ky'rq me,
Nsqm dqdq a wxntee pqn;
Ka sqnea abxfo bom too
Dwom ma N'awo akwaaba;
Anuonyam wx s'ro ma Nyame,
Asomdwoe wx 'sase so.

Nnyeso
Ka Yesu ho nsqm kyerq me
Ky'rqw 'sqm biara me komam'
Ka nsqm a qsom bo ky'rq me
Nsqm dqdq a wxntee pqn.

Ne nkpo dii mmuada sare so,
Ka nna no ho nsqm ky'rq me;
Sqnea yqn bxn' nti wxsxxN' hwqe,
Nso awie'I no Odii nim;
Ka N'adwumayq mm're ho nsqm
Ne aw'rqhow a Xsoae,
Wobuu No 'nimtia hyqq No yaw,
Wxpow No na Odii hia.

Ka N'asqnnua no ho nsqm ky'rq,
N'amanehun' ne yaw no;
Damoá a wxde No toom' ho nsqm.
Ka sqnea Xtč ase bio;
Xdx bxkxx wx nsqm no mu,
Qtew sen nea mahu pqn,
Ma minsu b'rč a woka brqoo sq
Xdx tuaa ka no maa me.
songTWI:
Tell me the story of Jesus,
Write on my heart every word,
Tell me the story most precious
Sweetest that ever was heard;
Tell how the angels, in chorus,
Sang as they welcomed His birth,
Glory to God in the highest,
Peace and good tidings to earth.

Refrain
Tell me the story of Jesus,
Write on my heart every word,
Tell me the story most precious,
Sweetest that ever was heard.

Fasting, alone in the desert,
Tell of the days that He passed,
How for our sins He was tempted,
Yet was triumphant at last;
Tell of the years of His labor,
Tell of the sorrow He bore,
He was despised and afflicted,
Indexless, rejected, and poor.

Tell of the cross where they nailed Him,
Writhing in anguish and pain;
Tell of the grave where they laid Him,
Tell how He liveth again;
Love in that story so tender,
Clearer than ever I see;
Stay, let me weep while you whisper,
Love paid the ransom for me.

title:
Somdwoe Hen', Di Me Pq So
Prince of Peace, Control My Will
songEN:
'Somdwoe Hen', di me pq so,
Ma koma brqfo nyq komm;
Ma 'kyinnye ne suro nnyae,
Na ma me honhom 'somdwoe.

Wode Wo mogya txx me,
Buee Nyame nkyqn kwan maa me;
Mesrq 'somdwoe, 'somdwoe a
Qma me Wo yq k'ro.

Wo pq nyq hx, 'nyq me pq,
Ma Wo pq ne me mmom;
Yi 'kyinnye fi me komam,
Ma me W'asomdwoe pa no.
songTWI:
Prince of Peace, control my will,
Bid this struggling heart be still;
Bid my fears and doubtings cease,
Hush my spirit into peace.

Thou hast bought me with Thy blood,
Opened wide the gate to God;
Peace, I ask, but peace must be,
Lord, in being one with Thee.

May Thy will, not mine, be done,
May Thy will and mine be one;
Chase these doubtings from my heart,
Now Thy perfect peace impart.

title:
Sq Mehwq Asqnnua Nwanwá a
When I Survey the Wondrous Cross
songEN:
Sq mehwq asqnnua nwanwá a
Anuonyam Hene wuu ho nō a,
M'ahode no mimmu no hwee
Meto m'ahantan nyinaa gu.

Qmpare sq mqhoa me ho,
Gye Kristo me Nyame wu ho;
Ahuhudč a egyigye me
Migyaa mu, Ne mogya no nti.

Hwq Ne ti, Ne nsa ne N'anan,
Yaw ne xdx abom rehwie;
Saa dx ne yaw yi nhyiae pqn,
N'abot'ri no yq nsxe nko de.

Sq wiase nyinaa wx me mpō a
Qyq m' ade ketewaa bi;
Anwanwa dx, Onyame dx,
Regye me kra, me nkwa, nyinaa.
songTWI:
When I survey the wondrous cross
on which the Prince of Glory died;
my richest gain I count but loss,
and pour contempt on all my pride.

Forbid it, Lord, that I should boast,
save in the death of Christ, my God;
all the vain things that charm me most,
I sacrifice them to his blood.

See, from his head, his hands, his feet,
sorrow and love flow mingled down.
Did e'er such love and sorrow meet,
or thorns compose so rich a crown.

Were the whole realm of nature mine,
that were an offering far too small;
love so amazing, so divine,
demands my soul, my life, my all.

title:
Sq Mehwq Asqnnua Nwanwá a
When I Survey the Wondrous Cross
songEN:
Sq mehwq asqnnua nwanwá a
Anuonyam Hene wuu ho nō a,
M'ahode no mimmu no hwee
Meto m'ahantan nyinaa gu.

Hwq Ne ti, Ne nsa ne N'anan,
Yaw ne xdx abom rehwie;
Saa dx ne yaw yi nhyiae pqn,
N'abot'ri no yq nsxe nko de.

Sq me a anka may'ra no
Anya faf'ri Ne din mu a;
Qmpare sq mqhoa me ho:
Gye Kristo m'Aw'rade wu ho.

Sq wiase nyinaa wx me mpō a
Qyq m' ade ketewaa bi;
Anwanwa dx, Onyame dx,
Regye me kra, me nkwa, nyinaa.
songTWI:
When I survey the wondrous cross
On which the Prince of glory died,
My richest gain I count but loss,
And pour contempt on all my pride.

See, from His head, His feet,
Sorrow and love flow mingled down;
Did e'er such love and sorrow meet?
Or thorns compose so rich a crown?

Since I, who was undone and lost,
Have pardon through His name and word;
Forbid it, then, that I should boast,
Save in the cross of Christ my Lord.

Were the whole realm of nature mine,
That were a tribute far too small;
Love so amazing, so divine,
Demands my life, my soul, my all.

title:
Nea Wop'raa Ne Ti Kronn No
O Sacred Head
songEN:
Nea wop'raa Ne ti kronn no,
'W'rqhow ne yaw hyqqN' so;
Na fqwdifo no de nsxe
Yqq abt'ri maa No;
O ti kronkron, dqn 'nuonyam
Ne nhy'ra na qnyqW' de!
Ewom sq wxapo Wo de,
Mede 'nigye gye Wo.

'W'ra, 'manne a Wuhui no,
Wuhu maa bxn'yqfo;
Mm'rato yi ny'naa yq me de,
Nanso Wuhuu yaw no;
'Gyenkwa, mehweW' nan ase;
Me na yaw yi sq me;
Fa W'ahummxb'rx hwq me,
Na fa Wo dom ma me.

Xkasa bqn na memfa
Nna W'ase, me Dxfo,
Wx W'awerqhow wu yi,
Ne yaw a ennė awiei?
O fa me yq Wo de daa,
Na sq metx bahá a;
Aw'rade, mma me w'rq mmfi
Sq mqdx wo daa daa.
songTWI:
O sacred Head, now wounded,
with grief and shame weighed down,
now scornfully surounded
with thorns, thine only crown:
how pale thou art with anguish,
with sore abuse and scorn!
How does that visage languish
which once was bright as morn!

What thou, my Lord, has suffered
was all for sinners' gain;
mine, mine was the transgression,
but thine the deadly pain.
Lo, here I fall, my Savior!
'Tis I deserve thy place;
look on me with thy favor,
vouchsafe to me thy grace.

What language shall I borrow
to thank thee, dearest friend,
for this thy dying sorrow,
thy pity without end?
O make me thine forever;
and should I fainting be,
Lord, let me never, never
outlive my love for thee

title:
Kx Getsemane Sum Mu
Go To Dark Gethsemane
songEN:
Kx Getsemane sum mu,
Mo a tamfo hyq mo so;
Monhwq mo Gyefo no ko,
Mo ne No nwqn dxnhw're k'ro,
Mommfi Ne yawdi no ho.
Munsua Yesu nkyqn mpaebx.

Monhwq No asennii hx,
Wx xhwe ne fqwdi mu;
Xsoaa ne ny'naa xdwo mu;
'Dx na qhyqq Ne kra den;
Munguan yaw ne 'nimguase,
Munsua Ne nkyqn 'sqnnua soa.

Momfa Kalbre yaw bepx,
Monsom wx Ne nan ase.
Mohwq b're nwanwa no yie
Nyame afxrebx pa no.
Tie Ne nteam no sq: 'Wxawie!'
Munsua sqnea Yesu wui.

title:
Wowx Hx B'rč a Wxbxx Me W'ra
Were You There?
songEN:
Wowx hx b'rč a wxbxx me W'ra 'sqnnuam'?
Wowx hx b'rč a wxbxx me W'ra 'sqnnuam'?
O! Qtx b're bi a qma me ho popopopo.
Wowx hx, b'rč a wxbxx me W'ra 'sqnnuam'?

Wowx hx b'rč a wxde No fam dua ho?
Wowx hx b'rč a wxde No fam dua ho?
O! Qtx b're bi a qma me ho popopopo.
Wowx hx b'rč a wxde No fam dua ho?

Wowx hx b'rč a wxbxx Ne mfe mu no?
Wowx hx b'rč a wxbxx Ne mfe mu no?
O! Qtx b're bi a qma me ho popopopo.
Wowx hx b'rč a wxbxx Ne mfe mu no?

Wowx hx b'rč a owia gyaee ne hy'rqn no?
Wowx hx b'rč a owia gyaee ne hy'rqn no?
O! Qtx b're bi a qma me ho popopopo.
Wowx hx b'rč a owia gyaee ne hy'rqn no?

Wowx hx b'rč a wxde No too damoa m'?
Wowx hx b'rč a wxde No too damoa m'?
O! Qtx b're bi a qma me ho popopopo.
Wowx hx b'rč a wxde No too damoa m'?
songTWI:
Were you there when they crucified my Lord?
Were you there when they crucified my Lord?
O! Sometimes it causes me to tremble, tremble, tremble.
Were you there when they crucified my Lord?

Were you there when they nailed Him to the tree?
Were you there when they nailed Him to the tree?
O! Sometimes it causes me to tremble, tremble, tremble.
Were you there when they nailed Him to the tree?

Were you there when they pierced Him in the side?
Were you there when they pierced Him in the side?
O! Sometimes it causes me to tremble, tremble, tremble.
Were you there when they pierced Him in the side?

Were you there when the sun refused to shine?
Were you there when the sun refused to shine?
O! Sometimes it causes me to tremble, tremble, tremble.
Were you there when the sun refused to shine?

Were you there when they laid Him in the tomb?
Were you there when they laid Him in the tomb?
O! Sometimes it causes me to tremble, tremble, tremble.
Were you there when they laid Him in the tomb?

title:
Bepx Bi So Na Asqnnua
On a Hill Far Away
songEN:
Bepx bi so na asqnnua dedaw bi si,
Yaw ne fqre ho sqnky'rqnne.
Medx asqnnua dedaw yi a qso na
Wiase nti wokum' me dxfo.

Nnyeso
Na mqyq asqnnua no atuu,
Kosi sq mewie me ko no ko:
Mqtwere asqnnua dedaw no,
Na adan me ahenkyqw da bi.

Asqnnua a wiase buu no animtia no
Twetwe m'adwen sq biribi.
Efisq Nyame 'Guammaa gyaw N'anuonyam s'ro,
Bqsoa kxx Kalbre sum mu hx.

Medi asqnnua gow yi nokware daa daa,
Mqsoa N'aniwu ne fqre;
Na daakye Xbqfrq me de me kx fie a,
Manya N'anuonyam no bi daa.
songTWI:
On a hill far away stood an old rugged cross,
the emblem of suffering and shame;
and I love that old cross where the dearest and best
for a world of lost sinners was slain.

Refrain
So I'll cherish the old rugged cross,
till my trophies at last I lay down;
I will cling to the old rugged cross,
and exchange it some day for a crown.

O that old rugged cross, so despised by the world,
has a wondrous attraction for me;
for the dear Lamb of God left his glory above
to bear it to dark Calvary.

To that old rugged cross I will ever be true,
its shame and reproach gladly bear;
then he'll call me some day to my Index far away,
where his glory forever I'll share.

title:
Kx W'anim Sq Xberempxn
Ride On in Majesty
songEN:
Kx W'anim sq Xberempxn,
'Man nyinaa to Hosiana;
Agyenkwa b'rqfo, tu Wo kwan,
Berqw ne ntama di ahim.

Kx W'anim sq Xberempxn,
Kx odwo 'nuonyam mu kowu;
Kristo, fiW' nkonimdi ase
Wx awufo ne bxne so.

Kx W'anim sq Xberempxn,
Akofo a wotu nam wim;
De ahodw'ri ne aw'rqhow
Hwq afxr' a qrebqn no.

Kx W'anim sq Xberempxn.
Kx xdwo 'nuonyam mu kowu,
Bx Wo ti ase ma xyaw,
Na gye Wo tumi di hene.
songTWI:
Ride on! ride on in majesty!
Hark, all the tribes hosanna cry;
O Savior meek, pursue Thy road
With palms and scattered garments strowed.

Ride on! ride on in majesty!
In lowly pomp ride on to die;
O Christ, Thy triumphs now begin
O'er captive death and conquered sin.

Ride on! ride on in majesty!
The winged squadrons of the sky
Look down with sad and wondering eyes
To see the approaching sacrifice.

Ride on! ride on in majesty!
In lowly pomp ride on to die;
Bow Thy meek head to mortal pain,
Then take, O God, Thy power and reign.

title:
Wudi Hen' Dua Nwanwa So
Throned Upon the Awful Tree
songEN:
Wudi hen' dua nwanwa so,
Nyame 'Guammaa, yehuW'yaw;
Sum kata W'aw'rqhow so,
Obi ntum' nhu Wo yaw no;
Obi ntum nhu xhaw a
Wo nko Wuhyiaa no kommyqm'.

Nnxnhw're mmiqnsa mu kommyqm;
Wo ne sum mu 'tumfo koe,
Wiase bxn' nti, wxpoo Wo
Sum kabii twaa Wo ho hyiae,
Kosii b're a wxahyq no.
B're a Nyame 'Guammaan' wui.

Tie nteam a egyigye pii
Kx s'ro mununkum kqsem'!
Wo, Agya no Ba k'ro no,
Nyame Ba a wxasra Wo,
Wubisa-so ebetum'?
Sq 'dqn nti na Woagya Me?'

'W'ra, sq 'hu ne apini
Hyq yqn kra bxn'yqfo sō a,
Wo a Wuhyiaa saa yaw yi,
Sqnea Wo de renny'ra no,
Ma yenhu wx xyaw nteam
Wx sum no mu sq Wobqn.
songTWI:
Throned upon the awful tree,
Lamb of God, Your grief we see.
Darkness veils Your anguished face;
None its lines of woe can trace.
None can tell what pangs unknown
Hold You silent and alone.

Silent through those three dread hours,
Wrestling with the evil powers,
Left alone with human sin,
Gloom around You and within,
Till th'appointed time is nigh,
Till the Lamb of God may die.

Hark, that cry that peals aloud
Upward through the whelming cloud!
You, the Father's only Son,
You, His own anointed one,
You are asking- can it be?
Why have You forsaken Me?

Lord, should fear and anguish roll
Darkly o'er our sinful soul,
You, who once were thus bereft
That Your own might ne'er be left,
Teach us by that bitter cry
In the gloom to know You nigh.

title:
Anwanwa Dx Bqn Ni
Wondrous Love
songEN:
Anwanwa dx bqn ni,
O me kra, O me kra?
Anwanwa dx bqn ni, O me kra?
Anwanwa dx bqn na Qmaa nnepa Wura
Soaa mmusų a qyq d'ru
Maa me kra, maa me kra?
Soaa mmusų a qyq d'ru Maa me kra?

Nyame ne 'Guammaa no,
Mqto dwom, ama Mo.
Nyame ne 'Guammaa no, Mqto dwom.
Nyame ne 'Guammaa no,
Nea Xyq Meara no;
B'rč a mpempem ka bom yi,
Mqto dwom ama Mo.
B'rč a mpempem ka bom yi, Mqto dwom.

Mifi 'wu mu fi a,
Mqto dwom, mqto dwom;
Mifi 'wu mu fi a, Mqto dwom
Mifi 'wu mu fi a, Mqto dwom adi dqw;
Na mm'resanten nyinaam'
Mqto dwom, mqto dwom.
Na mm'resanten nyinaam' Mqto dwom.
songTWI:
What wondrous love is this,
O my soul, O my soul?
What wondrous love is this,
O my soul? What wondrous love is this
That caused the Lord of bliss
To bear the dreadful
curse for my soul, for my soul;
To bear the dreadful curse for my soul

To God and to the Lamb I will sing,
I will sing; To God and to the Lamb,
I will sing; To God and to the Lamb
Who is the great I am,
While millions join the theme,
I will sing, I will sing;
While millions join the theme, I will sing.

And when from death I'm free,
I'll sing on, I'll sing on;
And when from death I'm free,
I'll sing on;
And when from death I'm free,
I'll sing and joyful be,
And through eternity
I'll sing on, I'll sing on!
And through eternity, I'll sing on

title:
Dua No Ho
At The Cross
songEN:
So wohwiee m'Agyenkwa mogya?
Na me Hene no wui?
So Xde Ne ti kronkron no
Ba bqgyee me sqq yi?

Nnyeso
Dua no ho, dua no ho,
'Hx na mihuu hann no,
Na me komam adesoa no te hwee;
Hx na menam gyidi so huu ade,
Na qnnq m'ani gye daa nyinaa.

So me bxne nti na Xhuu
Amane dua no so?
Mmxb'rxhun' bqn ni! 'dom nwanwa,
'Dx a enni kabea!

'W'rqhow biara rentumi ntua
'Dx ka a mede no;
'W'ra, mede me ho ny'naa ma Wo,
Nea metum' ayq ni!
songTWI:
Alas! and did my Savior bleed,
and did my Sovereign die?
Would he devote that sacred head
for sinners such as I?

Refrain
At the cross, at the cross,
where I first saw the light,
and the burden of my heart rolled away;
it was there by faith I received my sight,
and now I am happy all the day.

Was it for crimes that I have done,
he groaned upon the tree?
Amazing pity! Grace unknown!
And love beyond degree!

But drops of tears can ne'er repay
the debt of love I owe.
Here, Lord, I give myself away;
'tis all that I can do.

title:
Koko Bi Wx Aky'ri Nohoa
There Is a Green Hill Far Away
songEN:
Koko bi wx aky'ri nohoa,
Kųro bi 'fasu akyi;
'Hx na wxsqn W'ra dxfo a
Owu gyee yqn nkwa no.

Yqrentumi nhu ntumi nky'rq
Yaw a Ohui wx hx;
Nanso yqgye di sq yqn nti
Na Ohuu amane.

Owui sq yebenya faf'ri;
Owui de siesiee yqn,
Na awiei no yqakx soro;
Ne mogya agye yqn.

Ade pa biara nni hx a
Ebetua bxne ka;
Xno nko na Otumi bue
S'ro pon' ma yqhyqn mu.

Xde dx kqse adx yqn,
'Sq sq yqdx No bi,
Na yqtwer' Ne gye mogya no,
Na yqyq N'adwuma.
songTWI:
There is a green hill far away,
Without a city wall,
Where the dear Lord was crucified,
Who died to save us all.

We may not know, we cannot tell,
What pains He had to bear,
But we believe it was for us
He hung and suffered there.

He died that we might be forgiven,
He died to make us good,
That we might go at last to heaven,
Saved by His precious blood.

There was no other good enough
To pay the price of sin;
He only could unlock the gate
Of heaven, and let us in.

O dearly, dearly has He loved!
And we must love Him too,
And trust in His redeeming blood,
And try His works to do.

title:
Hotefo, Monhwq Anuonyam
Look, You Saints! the Sight Is Glorious
songEN:
Hotefo, monhwq anuonyam!
Mmmqhwq yaw Nipa no;
Wadi nkonim xko no mu,
Nkotodwe ny'naa bqsom No;
Monhyq N' 'henkyqw! MonhyqN' 'henkyqw!
Monhyq N' 'henkyqw!
Nkonim 'henkyqw fata No.
Nkonim 'henkyqw fata No.

'Bxfo, monhyq 'Gyenkwa 'henkyqw,
Yesu de 'sade pii ba;
Momma No ntra tum' agua so,
B'rč a s'ro gyigye dennen no;
Monhyq N' 'henkyqw! MonhyqN' 'henkyqw!
Monhyq N' 'henkyqw!
Monhyq 'Gyenkwa hen' mu Hen'.
Monhyq 'Gyenkwa hen' mu Hen'.

Bxn'yqfo de atwetwesi
Bxx 'Gyenkwa no abot'ri;
'Hotefo ne 'bxfo montwa
Ne ho nhyia nkamfo Ne din;
Monhyq N' 'henkyqw! MonhyqN' 'henkyqw!
Monhyq N' 'henkyqw!
Nka Ne nkonimdi no nky'rq.
Nka Ne nkonimdi no nky'rq.

Muntie osebx dennen no,
Muntie nkonimdi nnwom no;
Yesu anya 'nuonyam dibea,
'Dqw a enni kabea ni!
Monhyq N' 'henkyqw! MonhyqN' 'henkyqw!
Monhyq N' 'henkyqw!
'Hen' mu Hen', W'ra mu 'W'rade.
'Hen' mu Hen', W'ra mu 'W'rade.
songTWI:
Look, you saints, the sight is glorious,
See the Man of sorrows now;
From the fight returned victorious,
Every knee to Him shall bow.
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
Crowns become the victor's brow.
Crowns become the victor's brow.

Crown the Savior! angels crown Him!
Rich the trophies Jesus brings;
On the seat of power enthrone Him
While the vault of heaven rings.
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
Crown the Savior, King of Kings.
Crown the Savior, King of Kings.

Sinners in derision crowned Him,
Mocking thus the Savior's claim;
Saints and angels crowd around Him,
Own His title, praise His name.
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
Spread abroad the victor's fame!
Spread abroad the victor's fame!

Hark! those bursts of acclamation!
Hark! those loud triumphant chords!
Jesus takes the highest station;
Oh, what joy the sight affords!
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
King of kings and Lord of lords!
King of kings and Lord of lords!

title:
W'ra Kristo Asxre Nnq
Christ the Lord Is Risen Today
songEN:
W'ra Kristo asxre nnq, Haleluya!
Nnipa ne abxfo nka: Haleluya!
Momma mō anigye nkx s'ro, Haleluya!
S'ro nto 'sase nnye so, Haleluya!

Yqn 'nuonyam Hen tč ase bio, Haleluya!
Owu, wo nwowxe wx he? Haleluya!
Owui de gyee yqn kra nkwa, Haleluya!
Asaman nkonim wx he? Haleluya!

Wawie dx nkwagye 'dwuma, Haleluya!
Wako xko adi nim, Haleluya!
Owu dii nkogu N'anim, Haleluya!
Kristo abue s'ro apon', Haleluya!

Yenam Kristo 'nammxn so, Haleluya!
Yedi yqn Sahen' akyi, Haleluya!
Yqasxre te sq Xno, Haleluya!
'Sqnnua ne s'ro yq yqn de, Haleluya!
songTWI:
Christ the Lord is risen today, Alleluia!
Sons of men and angels say, Alleluia!
Raise your joys and triumphs high, Alleluia!
Sing, ye heavens, and earth reply, Alleluia!

Lives again our glorious King, Alleluia!
Where, O death, is now thy sting? Alleluia!
Once He died, our souls to save, Alleluia!
Where's thy victory, boasting grave? Alleluia!

Love's redeeming work is done, Alleluia!
Fought the fight, the battle won, Alleluia!
Death in vain forbids Him rise, Alleluia!
Christ hath opened Paradise, Alleluia!

Soar we then where Christ has led, Alleluia!
Following our exalted Head, Alleluia!
Made like Him, like Him we rise, Alleluia!
Ours the cross, the grave, the skies, Alleluia!

title:
Haleluya! To Ma Yesu!
Alleluia! Sing to Jesus
songEN:
Haleluya! to ma Yesu!
Tumi ne 'henni wx No;
Haleluya! Nkonim wx No,
Nkonimdi yq Ne nko de:
Tie Sion asomdwoe dwom no,
Egyigye sq aprannaa;
Yesu de Ne mogya agye
Yqn afi aman ny'naa mu.

Haleluya! Yqnyq nyisiaa,
Onnyaw yqn aw'rqhow mu,
Haleluya! Xbqn yqn daa;
Yqwx gyidi, yqnnyq kyim.
Ewom munumkum gyee No kxe,
B're a 'daduanan twaam no;
So yqn w'rq befi Ne bxhyq:
'Me ne mo wx hx daa' no?

Haleluya! Soro aduan'
Wone yqn aduan fam ha;
Haleluya! Nnebxn'yqfo
Guan ba Wo nkyqn da biara;
'Dimafo, bxn'yqfo Yxnko,
Wiase Gyefo, di ma me
Wx nea ahotefo to dwom -
Ahwehwq po no so hx.
songTWI:
Alleluia! sing to Jesus!
His the scepter, His the throne;
Alleluia! His the triumph,
His the victory alone;
Hark! the songs of peaceful Sion
Thunder like a mighty flood;
Jesus out of every nation
Hath redeemed us by His blood.

Alleluia! not as orphans
Are we left in sorrow now;
Alleluia! He is near us,
Faith believes, nor questions how:
Though the cloud from sight received Him,
When the forty days were o'er,
Shall our hearts forget His promise,
I am with you evermore?

Alleluia! Bread of heaven,
Thou on earth our food, our stay!
Alleluia! here the sinful
Flee to Thee from day to day:
Intercessor, Friend of sinners,
Earth's Redeemer plead for me,
Where the songs of all the sinless
Sweep across the crystal sea.

title:
So Xsoro Nkanea agye
And Have the Bright Immensities
songEN:
So xsoro nkanea agye
Yqn W'ra a Wasxre,
Faako a ns'romma akuakuw
'Boaboa wxn ano no?
So owia a qhy'rqn tumi
Ky'rq N'anammxn wx 'wim,
Nea Xyq abxde ny'naa W'ra
Ne b're sodifo no?

Xsoro a qde No sie,
Nnim 'ky'riky'ri nnim mmqnee;
Kanea ketewa to ne hann
Sq 'wim nsoromma bi.
Na nea Ne nk'rxfo dxfo hyia
Ky'rq s'ro akyqde no,
Na Ogyina wxn ntam wx hx,
Na s'ro hann hyerqn hx.
songTWI:
And have the bright immensities
Received our risen Lord,
Where light years frame the Pleiades
And point Orion's sword?
Do flaming suns His footsteps trace
Thro'corridors sublime,
The Lord of inter stellar space
And conqueror of time?

The heav'n that hides Him from our sight
Knows neither near nor far;
A little candle sheds its light
As surely as a star.
And where His loving people meet
To share the gift divine,
There stands He with unhurrying feet;
There heav'nly splendors shine.

title:
Mommra, 'Gyidifo, Monto
Come, You Faithful
songEN:
Mommra, 'gyidifo, monto
Nkonim anigye dwom.
Nyame de Ne mma afi
W'rqhowm' aba dqw mu;
Monni dqw, Yerusalem,
Momfa nokware dx
Nto dwom a egyigye fa
Yesu wusxre ho.

Akra 'h'rusi da ne nnq,
Kristo apue afi
Owu sum afiase mu.
Hann ne n-kwa apue,
Yqn bxne horow nyinaa
Mu tumi retu y'ra
Ne hann anim, Nea Xsq
Nnaase ne nkamfo daa.

'Haleluya!' yqteam ky'rq
Yqn Hen' a Onwu da.
Nea nkonim mu Obubuu
Asaman apon' no:
'Haleluya!' yqkamfo
Agya ne Xba no;
'Haleluya!' yqto bio
Ma Honhom Kronkron no.
songTWI:
Come, you faithful, raise the strain
Of triumphant gladness;
God has brought His people
Now rejoice, Jerusalem,
And with true affection
Welcome in unwearied strains
Jesus'resurrection.

'Tis the spring of souls today;
Christ has burst His prison
From the frost and gloom of death
light and life have risen
All the winter of our sins,
Long and dark, is flying
From His ligth, to whom we give
Thanks and praise undying.

Alleluia! now we cry
to our King immortal,
Who, triumphant, burst the
bars of the tomb's dark portal
Alleluia! with the Son,
God the Father praising;
Alleluia! yet again to
the Spirit raising.

title:
Mommra, 'Gyidifo, Monto
Come, You Faithful
songEN:
Mommra, 'gyidifo, monto
Nkonim anigye dwom,
Nyame de Israel afi
W'rqhowm' aba dqw mu;
Yakob mma afi Farao
Kxndua d'rud'ru n'ase
Afa 'sase kesee so,
Qpo Kxkxx no mu.

Akra 'h'rusi da ne nnq,
Kristo apue afi
Nnansa wu mu asxre
Sqnea owia repue.
Yqn bxne horow nyinaa
Mu tumi retu y'ra
Ne hann anim,
Nea Xsq Nnaase ne nkamfo daa.

Mmere mu b're kunini
De anuonyam da hann
Ne afahyq mu 'fahyq,
Ba bqky'rq n'anigye,
De dqw brq agyidifo
A wxde nokwar' dx
To dwom a egyigye yie
Yesu wusxre ho.

Qnnq asuafo no mu,
Kristo puei b'rč a Xde
N'asomdwoe pa a qtra
Nimdeq ny'naa so no mae.
Owu apono anaa
Damoa mu sum kabii,
Awqmfo anaa xbx
Antum' ankora No.

'Haleluya!' yqteam ky'rq
Yqn Hen' a Onwu da;
Nea nkonim mu
Obubuu Asaman apon' no.
'Haleluya!' yqkamfo Agya ne Xba no,
'Haleluya!' yqto bio
Ma Honhom Kronkron no.
songTWI:
Come, you faithful, raise the strain
Of triumphant gladness;
God has brought His Israel
Into joy from sadness;
Loosed from Pharoah's bitter yoke
Jacob's sons and daughters;
Led them with unmoistened foot
Through the Red Sea waters.

'Tis the spring of souls today;
Christ has burst His prison,
And from three days'sleep in death
As a sun has risen;
All the winter of our sins,
Long and dark, is flying
From His light, to whom is giv'n
Laud and praise undying.

Now the queen of seasons, bright
With the day of splendor,
With the royal feast of feasts,
Comes its joy to render;
Comes to gladden faithful hearts
Which with true affection
Welcome in unwearied strain
Jesus'resurrection.

For today among the twelve
Christ appeared, be stowing
His deep peace, which evermore
Passes human knowing.
Neither could the gates of death,
Nor the tomb's dark portal,
Nor the watchers, nor the seal,
Hold Him as a mortal.

'"Alleluia!" now we cry
To our King immortal,
Who, triumphant, burst the bars
Of the tomb's dark portal;
"Alleluia" with the Son,
God the Father praising;
"Alleluia!" yet again
To the Spirit raising.

title:
'Nuonyam Yq Wo De
Thine Is the Glory
songTWI:
Thine is the glory, Risen, conquering Son;
Endless is the victory thou o'er death hast won.
Angels in bright raiment rolled the stone away,
Kept the folded grave-clothes where Thy body lay.

Refrain
Thine is the glory, Risen, conquering Son;
Endless is the victory thou o'er death hast won.

Lo! Jesus meets us. Risen from the tomb,
Lovingly He greets us, Scatters fear and gloom;
Let His Church with gladness hymns of triumph sing,
For her Lord now liveth; Death has lost its sting.

No more we doubt Thee, Glorious Prince of life!
Life is nought without Thee; Aid us in our strife;
Make us more than conquerors through Thy deathless love
Bring us safe through Jordan to Thy Index above.

title:
Xko Kqse N' Aba Awiei
The Strife is O'er
songEN:
Haleluya, haleluya, haleluya!
Xko kqse n' aba awiei,
Xsahen no adi nkonim,
Monhyq ayeyi dwom ase; Haleluya!

Owu tumi ayq bi de,
Nanso Kristo adi ne so;
Momfa 'nigye kronkron mmx 'se,
Haleluya!

Aw'rqhow nnansa atwam kx,
Wanyan 'nuonyam mu afi 'wum';
'Nuonyam nka yqn Kannifo no,
Haleluya!

'Wura, fa Wo mmaa ntampe no,
Gye Wo nkoa fi 'wu nwowxe mu;
Na yqatrá ase ato dwom, Haleluya!
Haleluya, haleluya, haleluya!
songTWI:
Alleluia, alleluia, alleluia!
The strife is o'er, the battle done;
Now is the victor's triumph won!
Now be the song of praise begun. Alleluia!

The pow'rs of death have done their worst,
But Christ their legions has dispersed.
Let shouts of holy joy outburst. Alleluia!

The three sad days have quickly sped,
He rises glorious from the dead.
All glory to our risen head! Alleluia!

Lord, by the stripes which wounded You,
From death's sting free Your servants too,
That we may live and sing to You. Alleluia!

title:
Kristofo, Munni Dqw Nto Dwom!
Good Christian Friends, Rejoice
songEN:
Kristofo, munni dqw nto dwom!
Afei yqn Hen' adi nkonim!
Yqka 'nigyesqm wiase ny'naa;
Haleluya! Haleluya! Haleluya!

N-kwa Wura no asxre,
Momfa dwom mpete Ne kwan mu;
Ma amansan nni dqw nka sq:
Haleluya! Haleluya! Haleluya!

Yqto nkonim ho 'yeyi dwom,
Mo dx ne nkwa a enwu da;
Yqma yqn koma so to dwom:
Haleluya! Haleluya! Haleluya!

Yehy'ra Wo, 'W'ra a Woasxre,
Yqde 'nokoro to dwom nnq,
Wo wu ne Wo sxre no ho:
Haleluya! Haleluya! Haleluya!
songTWI:
Good Christian friends, rejoice and sing!
Now is the triumph of our King!
To all the world glad news we bring:
Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

The Lord of life is risen for aye;
Bring flowers of song to strew His way;
Let all mankind rejoice and say:
Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

Praise we in songs of victory
That love, that life which cannot die,
And sing with hearts uplifted high:
Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

Thy name we bless, O risen Lord,
And sing today with one accord
The life laid down, the life restored:
Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

title:
Yqn 'Nidaso Ns'romma Bepue!
Star of Our Hope
songEN:
Yqn 'nidaso Ns'romma bepue
T'robqnto nne team sq Wabqn;
'Hotefo ny'naa mommx No 'se,
Sqnea 'nokwafo gye No fa!

S'ro abxfo ma wxn nne so:
Wxhyq 'nuonyam W'ra no 'henkyqw;
Ofura xsoro tumi,
Xhy'rqn N'anuonyam kqse mu.

'Damoa so buebue ma akra
A wxadeda wx dxte mu,
Nyan wx nipadua fqfq mu
Kohyia Agyenkwa no wx wim.

Xde N'anuonyam agua sian
Bqfa 'henni no sq Ne de;
Ahotefo bx 'se to dwom,
Kamfo wxn Hen' nkonimdifo.
songTWI:
Star of our hope! He'll soon appear,
The last loud trumpet speaks Him near;
Hail Him, all saints, from pole to pole-
How welcome to the faithful soul!

From heaven angelic voices sound:
Behold the Lord of glory crowned,
Arrayed in majesty divine,
And in His highest glories shine.

The grave yields up its precious trust,
Which long has slumbered in the dust,
Resplendent forms ascending, fair,
Now meet the Savior in the air.

Descending with His azure throne,
He claims the kingdom for His own;
The saints rejoice, they shout, they sing,
And hail Him their triumphant King.

title:
'Duaba a Woduae Ayi 'Habammono
Now the Green Blade Rises
songEN:
'Duaba a woduae ayi 'habammono,
Nea ahyq asase mu nna pii no,
Xdx anyan bio, Nea Xfraa 'wufom'
Xdx apue sqnea 'duaba fifi no.

Wxde nitan kum No siee No damoa mu
Susuu sq Xrentumi nsxre bio.
Xhyqq dxtem' sq duaba a wonhu;
Xdx apue sqnea 'duaba fifi no.

Xsxree nkonim mu sq duaba repue,
Nea Odii nnansa wx damoa mu no;
Me W'ra teasefo no nyan fii 'wo mu;
Xdx apue sqnea 'duaba fifi no.

Sq yqn koma si apini di yaw a,
Wo nsa ka yqn de yqn ba nkwa mu bio,
Yqn komá a awu na ada mpan no,
Xdx apue sqnea 'duaba fifi no.
songTWI:
Star of our hope! He'll soon appear,
The last loud trumpet speaks Him near;
Hail Him, all saints, from pole to pole-
How welcome to the faithful soul!

From heaven angelic voices sound:
Behold the Lord of glory crowned,
Arrayed in majesty divine,
And in His highest glories shine.

The grave yields up its precious trust,
Which long has slumbered in the dust,
Resplendent forms ascending, fair,
Now meet the Savior in the air.

Descending with His azure throne,
He claims the kingdom for His own;
The saints rejoice, they shout, they sing,
And hail Him their triumphant King.

title:
Munhy'ra Dā a Wasxre No
Hail the Day That Sees Him Rise
songEN:
Munhy'ra dá a Wasxre no, Haleluya!
Xde 'nuonyam kx soro, Haleluya!
Kristō a Xyqq nipa no, Haleluya!
Wahyqne xs'ro mu s'ro, Haleluya!

'Nuonyam 'sebx retwqn hx, Haleluya!
Tete apon mommuebue, Haleluya!
Monna hann pa no adi, Haleluya!
Momma 'nuonyam Hen' nhyqn' mu, Haleluya!

Hwq Xma Ne nsa so s'ro, Haleluya!
Xde N'apiratwa ky'rq, Haleluya!
Tie, Xde dom bue N'ano, Haleluya!
De nhy'ra ma N'asafo ha, Haleluya!

'W'ra, nea nhu hx no, Haleluya!
Ma yqn koma nn'ru Wo nkyqn Haleluya!
'Hx na yebehu W'anim, Haleluya!
Na yqahu yqn s'ro Wo mu, Haleluya!
songTWI:
Hail the day that sees Him rise, Alleluia!
Glorious to His native skies; Alleluia!
Christ, awhile to mortals giv'n, Alleluia!
Enters now the highest heav'n! Alleluia!

There the glorious triumph waits; Alleluia!
Lift your heads, eternal gates! Alleluia!
Wide unfold the radiant scene; Alleluia!
Take the King of glory in! Alleluia!

See! He lifts His hands above; Alleluia!
See! He shows the prints of love: Alleluia!
Hark! His gracious lips bestow, Alleluia!
Blessings on His Church below. Alleluia!

Lord beyond our mortal sight, Alleluia!
Raise our hearts to reach Thy height, Alleluia!
There Thy face unclouded see, Alleluia!
Find our heav'n of heav'ns in Thee. Alleluia!

title:
Yesu, Wo Mogya Ne Trenee
Jesus, Your Blood and Righteousness
songEN:
Yesu, Wo mogya ne trenee,
Yq m'anuonyam ahyehyqde,
Wx wiasč a qredqr' yi mu;
Mqma m'ani so anigyem.

Megyina boxd'rum da kqsen'.
Nkwagye a 'katua biara nnim';
W'asqnnua no atew me ho,
Bxne, fxdi, hu nč aniwum'.

'Wura, megyeW' mogya dehyč a
Xdx nti Wuhwie gui no di;
Nea qredi ma nneduafo,
Nyame mmxb'rxhun 'gua anim.

Sq mifi owu amenam'
Na me nsa ka me s'ro fie nō a,
Na m'asqm k'ro ara ne sq
Yesu Kristo bewu maa me.
songTWI:
Jesus, Your blood and righteousness
My beauty are, my glorious dress;
Mid flaming worlds, in these arrayed,
With joy shall I lift up my head.

Bold shall I stand in that great day,
Cleansed and redeemed, no debt to pay;
For by Your cross, absolved I am
From sin and guilt, from fear and shame.

Lord, I believe Your precious blood,
Which at the mercy seat of God
Pleads for the captives'liberty,
Was also shed in love for me.

When from the dust of death I rise
To claim my mansion in the skies,
This then shall be my only plea:
Christ Jesus lived and died for me.

title:
Woyii Kristo a Wxahy'ra No
The Unveiled Christ
songEN:
Woyii Kristo a wxahy'ra No
Fii adasa aniso,
Xnam owu, yaw ne 'w'rqhowm'
Ate twamtam nom' mmienu.

Nnyeso
O monhwq, yaw Nipa no ni!
O monhwq, N'anim pxtee,
Hwq Nkonimdifo kqse no,
Wate twamtam nom' mmienu.

Yiw, Xne Agya Nyankopxn
Wx hx, Xredi ma wo;
Xne Nea wxdx No pa'ra,
Wate twamtam nom' mmienu.

Abxfo Kronkron koto No,
Adasamma tontom No;
'Fisq Xne nkonimdifo,
Wate twamtam nom' mmienu.
songTWI:
Once our blessed Christ of beauty
Was veiled off from human views;
But through suffering, death, and sorrow
He has rent the veil in two.

Refrain
O behold the Man of Sorrows!
O behold Him in plain view!
Lo! He is the mighty Conqueror
Since He rent the veil in two;
Lo! He is the mighty Conqueror
Since He rent the veil in two.

Yes, He is with God, the Father,
Interceding there for you;
For He is the Well beloved
Since He rent the veil in two.

Holy angels bow before Him,
Men of earth give praises due;
For He is the mighty Conqueror
Since He rent the veil in two.

title:
Nkwagye Dx Anwanwasqm No
The Wonders of Redeeming Love
songEN:
Nkwagye dx anwanwasqm no
B'ro yqn adwen ny'naa so;
Nyame Ba no fi s'ro behwiee
Ne mogya maa nnipa.

Xde Ne nkwa ne b'ribiara
Maa sq afxr' kronkron;
Xnom k'ruwa nwenwen ano,
Nnipa nti na Owui.

Xde Ne mogya di ma yqn
Wx N'Agya anim hx;
Ne dx da so di ma wxn a
Wxhwehwq dom aguan'.

Onim yqn mmerqwyq nyinaa
'Fisq Wasoa yqn haw;
Yqn Sxfo Panyin faa haw mu,
Obetum' agye yqn.

Ne dx ntumi nnya xpene,
Gye sq 'nuonyam mu no,
Ohu 'gyidifō a Obewu
Maa wonyaa nkwa no.
songTWI:
The wonders of redeeming love
Our highest thoughts exceed;
The Son of God comes from above
For sinful man to bleed.

He gives Himself, His life, His all,
A sinless sacrifice.
For man He drains the cup of gall,
For man the victim dies.

And now before His Father's face
His precious blood He pleads;
For those who seek the throne of grace
His lovee still intercedes.

He knows the frailties of our frame,
For He has borne our grief;
Our great High Priest once felt the same,
And He can send relief.

His love will not be satisfied,
Till He in glory sees
The faithful ones for whom He died
From sin forever free.

title:
O Muntie Yqn Anwanwasqm Yi
O Listen to Our Wondrous Story
songEN:
O muntie yqn anwanwasqm yi
Kan' no na anka yqay'ra;
Nso obi fi s'ro anuonyam mu
Bae bewu de gyee yqn nkwa!

Nnyeso
Hena gyee yqn fii daa y'ra mu?
Nyame Bá a Xsqn dua no so.
Dqn na Xyqe? Owu maa wo
Xwx he nnq? Xwx s'ro redi ma wo
(O gye di sq) Xwx s'ro redi ma wo!

'Bxfo rentumi nsi N'ananmu
Sq xk'rxn sq dqn mpo a;
'Dxfo a Xsqn dua no so ka
Nyame Baasak'ro no ho.

Wode wo ho bqma 'Gyenkwa yi
Akoto No 'hobrqasem'?
Wo nso wubenya Ne dom no bi,
Xbqgye wo nnq da yi.
songTWI:
O listen to our wondrous story,
Counted once among the lost;
Yet One came down from heaven's glory,
Saving us at awful cost!

Refrain
Who saved us from eternal loss?
Who but God's Son upon the cross?
What did He do? He died for you!
Where is He now? Believe it thou,
In heaven interceding! In heaven interceding!

No angel could His place have taken,
Highest of the high tho' he;
The loved One on the cross forsaken
Was One of the Godhead three!

Will you surrender to this Savior?
To His scepter humbly bow?
You, too, shall come to know His favor,
He will save you, save you now.

title:
So Yesu Fa Ho, B're a Koma
Does Jesus Cares?
songEN:
So Yesu fa ho, b're a koma
Bqyq d'ru wx aw'rqhow mu?
B're a nnesoa ne dadwen hyq me so,
Na kwan no ayq brq nko no?

Nnyeso
Yiw, Xfa ho, minim no saa;
M'aw'rqhow ka Ne koma;
Nna no yq xbrq na 'nadwo yi hu a,
Minim Xdwen me ho.

So Yesu fa ho, b're a sum ne
S'ro ne hu hyq me kwan ma no?
Sq adekyee hann dan 'nadwo sum a,
Qfa Ne ho sq Xbqn me?

So Yesu fa ho, b're a me ne
'Sase so adxfo di nkra,
Na me koma di awerqhow no?
So qfa Ne ho, na Ohu?
songTWI:
Does Jesus care when my heart is pained
Too deeply for mirth and song;
As the burdens press, and the cares distress,
And the way grows weary and long?

Refrain
O yes, He cares I know He cares!
His heart is touched with my grief;
When the days are weary,
The long nights dreary,
I know my Savior cares. (He cares.)

Does Jesus care when my way is dark
With a nameless dread and fear?
As the daylight fades into deep night shades,
Does He care enough to be near?

Does Jesus care when I've said goodbye
To the dearest on earth to me,
And my sad heart aches till it nearly breaks;
Is it aught to Him? Does He see?

title:
Kristo Tč Ase! Ma Wxnto Dwom
Christ Is Alive
songEN:
Kristo tč ase! ma wxnto dwom;
N'asqnnua no so ada mpan,
Momma nkamfo nwoso mmaa ny'naa,
Ne dx no to ntwa 'wu mu mpo.

Kristo tč ase! Qnyq fam ha;
Palestina asetra no,
Xba bqgye Ne de seesei,
Na Wadi b're ne beae so nim.

Nitan ne akodi biaram',
Nea mpaapaemu bi wx hx no;
Xte yaw nso Xkx so dx,
Ewom sq yqbx N'asqnnuam.

Kristo tč ase! Waf'ro kx s'ro,
Odi wiasč a N'Agya yqe so;
Na awiei no yqbqkamfo
Ne dx no aky'rq wiase ny'naa.
songTWI:
Christ is alive! Let Christians sing.
His cross stands empty to the sky.
Let streets and Indexs with praises ring.
His love in death shall never die.

Christ is alive! No longer bound
To distant years in Palestine,
He comes to claim the here and now
And conquer every place and time.

In every insult, rift, and war
Where color, scorn or wealth divide,
He suffers still, yet loves the more,
And lives, though ever crucified.

Christ is alive! Ascended Lord
He rules the world His Father made,
Till, in the end, His love adored
Shall be to all on earth displayed.

title:
Mqto Yesu Dx Ho Dwom
I Will Sing of Jesus Love
songEN:
Mqto Yesu dx ho dwom,
Nea Odii kan dxx me no;
Ogyaa 'man fqfq wx s'ro
Ba bewui wx Kalbre so.

Nnyeso
Mqto Yesu dx ho dwom,
Me kra bqto daa 'yeyi;
Owui sqnea menya nkwa,
Mqto Ne dx ho dwom daa.

S'ro dx a emu dx pii!
Fam ne s'ro ntumi nkyerq
Sq bxne te sq me de,
Bqhoa te sq suky'rqma.

Papa bi nni hx a mayq,
Qyqq dqn n'Xdxx me saa?
'W'ra, mede me koma maW',
Ma mentumi nky'rq me dx.
songTWI:
I Will sing of Jesus love,
Sing of Him,who first loved me;
for He left bright worlds above,
And died on Calvary.

Refrain
I will sing of Jesus love
Endless praise my heart shall give;
He has died that I might live
I will sing His love to me.

O the depths of love divine!
Earth or heaven can never know
How that sin as dark as mine
can be made as white as snow.

Nothing good for Him I've done;
How could He such love bestow?
Lord, I own my heart is won,
help me now my love to show.

title:
Yesu Tuaa Ne Ny'naa
Jesus Paid It All
songEN:
Metee Gyefo nne sq:
'W'ahoxden sua ampa;
Mmxb'rxni, wqn bx mpae,
Fa Me yq W'ade ny'naa'.

Nnyeso
Yesu tuaa ne ny'naa,
Ne ny'naa fi Ne nsam;
Bxne guu me ho fi yie,
Xhoh'roo no fitaa.

'W'ra, afei na mahu
Sq Wo tumi nkutoo
Na etum' sa kwata,
Na qnan' bo koma.

Papa bi nni me mų a
Mede bqgye Wo dom;
Mqh'ro me ntade ny'naa
Guammaa no mogya mu.

Midu 'henguan' anim,
Gyina N'anim hx a,
Mede m'akyqde ny'naa
Begu Ne nan ase.
songTWI:
I hear the Savior say,
Thy strength indeed is small;
Child of weakness, watch and pray,
Find in Me thine all in all.

Refrain
Jesus paid it all,
All to Him I owe;
Sin had left a crimson stain;
He washed it white as snow.

Lord, now indeed I find
Thy power, and Thine alone,
Can change the leper's spots,
And melt the heart of stone.

Since nothing good have I
Whereby Thy grace to claim,
I'll wash my garment white
In the blood of Calvary's Lamb.

And when before the throne
I stand in Him complete,
I'll lay my trophies down,
All down at Jesus' feet.

title:
Yesu Ne Me Wiase Nyinaa
Jesus Is All the World to Me
songTWI:
Jesus is all the world to me,
My life, my joy, my all;
He is my strength from day to day
Without him I would fall
When I am sad, to him I go,
No other one can cheer me so
when I am sad, he makes me glad, he's my friend.

Jesus is all the world to me,
My friend in trials sore;
I go to him for blessings,
And he gives them o'er and o'er
He sends the sunshine and the rain,
He sends the harvest's golden grain;
sunshine and rain, harvest of grain, he's my friend.

Jesus is all the world to me,
And true to him I'll be;
O how could I this friend deny,
When he's so true to me?
Following him I know I'm right,
He watches o'er me day and night;
Following him by day and night, he's my friend.

Jesus is all the world to me,
I want no better friend;
I trust him now, I'll trust him when
Life's fleeting days shall end.
Beautiful life with such a friend,
Beautiful life that has no end;
Eternal life, eternal joy, he's my friend.

title:
Mahu Yxnko
I've Found a Friend
songEN:
Mahu Yxnko, O Yxnko bi,
Odii kan dxx me ansa;
Xde xdx hama twee me,
De me kyekyeree No ho,
Wakyeky're me koma den a,
Qpxw no rentum' nsan da;
Meyq Ne de, n'Xyq me de,
Kosi daa ne afebxx.

Mahu Yxnko, O Yxnko bi,
Ohwiee mogya, wu gyee me;
Nyq nkwa ho akyqde no nko,
Xde Ne ho nso maa me;
Memfrq b'ribiara sq me de,
Na mmom Xdqqfo no de;
M'ahoxden, koma, ne me nkwa
Yq Ne de, Ne de daa daa.

Mahu Yxnko, O Yxnko bi,
Wxde tum' ny'naa ama No;
S'Xmfa nwqn me m'akwantu yim'
Mfa me nkodu s'ro dwoodwoo;
Daa 'nuonyam no hyerqn nohoa,
Hyq me mmxden mm'rqw no den;
Seesei merewqn! Mereko,
Na aky'ri mahome daa.

Mahu Yxnko, O Yxnko bi,
Xdqqfo ne nokwāfo,
Xfotufo pa Kwanky'rqfo,
Xgyefo, Tumfo kqse;
Dqn n'ebetumi atetew
Me ne me dxfo no ntam?
Nkwa? Owu? Asaman ana?
Dabi; meyq Ne de daa.
songTWI:
I've found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!
He loved me ere I knew Him;
He drew me with the cords of love,
And thus He bound me to Him.
And 'round my heart still closely twine
Those ties which nought can sever,
For I am His, and He is mine,
Forever and forever.

I've found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!
He bled, He died to save me;
And not alone the gift of life,
But His own self He gave me.
Nought that I have my own I call,
I hold it for the Giver;
My heart, my strength, my life my all,
Are His, and His forever.

I've found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!
All power to Him is given;
To guard me on my upward course,
And bring me safe to heaven.
The eternal glories gleam afar,
To nerve my faint endeavor;
So now to watch, to work, to war,
And then to rest forever.

I've found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!
So kind, and true, and tender,
So wise a counselor and guide,
So mighty a defender.
From Him, who loveth me so well,
What power my soul can sever?
Shall life or death, or earth, or hell?
No; I am His forever.

title:
Yesu, Nnebxn'yqfo Yxnko
Jesus, What a Friend for Sinners
songEN:
Yesu, nnebxn'yqfo Yxnko,
Yesu, me kra Dxfo pa;
Nnamfo pow na 'tamfo haw mč a
'Gyenkwa no ne me Gyefo.

Nnyeso
Haleluya! Xgyefo ni!
Haleluya! Yxnko ni!
Xgye me, boa me, dx me daa
Xka me ho kosė awiei.

Yesu, mm'rqwyq mu Ahoxden,
Ma mimmehinta Ne mu;
Mehwe ase sxhwq mu a,
Xne me nkonimdifo.

Yesu, aw'rqhow mu Boafo,
Sq asorxkye bx me,
Na me koma tx baha a,
Xkyekye me kra werq.

Yesu, mayq No me de nnq,
Nea mihia ny'naa wx Ne mu;
Xde me bxne akyq me,
Xwx me, na mewx No.
songTWI:
Jesus! what a Friend for sinners!
Jesus! Lover of my soul;
Friends may fail me, foes assail me,
He, my Savior, makes me whole.

Refrain
Hallelujah! what a Savior!
Hallelujah! what a Friend!
Saving, helping, keeping, loving,
He is with me to the end.

Jesus! what a Strength for weakness!
Let me hide myself in Him;
Tempted, tried, and sometimes failing,
He, my Strength, my vict'ry wins.

Jesus! what a Help in sorrow!
While the billows o'er me roll,
Even when my heart is breaking,
He, my Comfort, helps my soul.

Jesus! I do now receive Him,
More than all in Him I find,
He hath granted me forgiveness,
I am His, and He is mine.

title:
Me Dwom Yq Dx Nwanwa
My Song Is Love Unknown
songEN:
Me dwom yq dx nwanwa
Dx a 'Gyenkwa wx ma me,
Xma nea onni dx Nya bi sq xdxfo.
O hena ne me sq me nti
M'Aw'rade faa nipasu wui?

Ofii nhy'ra 'hengua so,
De nkwagye brqq nnipa,
Nanso nnipa ampq Sq wohu Kristo no;
Xno ne m'Adamfo ampa
Me nti Xde Ne nkwa too hx.

Nnipa tumi gye No,
To No ayeyi dwom;
Na da mu ny'naa wxto
Hosana ma wxn Hen',
Afei wxteam: 'Bx No 'sqnnuam'
De hwehwq sq wxbeku No.

Dqn na me W'ra ayq?
Dqn ne abufuw yi?
Xmaa mpakye sxree, Nif'raefo huu ade;
Yeinom ny'naa ansx wxn ani,
Qno nti wxsxre tiaa No.

Wxsxre bom ka sq:
Wxmfa m'Aw'rade nkx;
Wxgye 'wudifo nkwa,
Na wokum nkwa Hen' no;
Nanso Xde 'nigye kx wum'
Sqnea Xbqgye N'atamfo.

Ha na mqtra ato
S'ro Asqm no ho dwom;
Xhen' dxfo, xdx Ne yaw bi nsq Wo de;
Oyi ne m'Adamfo ampa;
Mqto Ne ho dwom no daa ny'naa.
songTWI:
My song is love unknown,
My Savior's love to me,
Love to the loveless shown,
That they might lovely be.
O who am I that for my sake
My Lord should take frail flesh and die?

He came from His blest throne,
Salvation to bestow,
But men made strange, and none
The longed for Christ would know.
But O my Friend, my Friend indeed
Who at my need His life did spend.

Sometimes they strew His way,
And His sweet praises sing,
Resounding all the day,
Hosannas to their King.
Then Crucify is all their breath,
And for His death they thirst and cry.

Why, what hath my Lord done?
What makes this rage and spite?
He made the lame to run,
He gave the blind their sight.
Sweet injuries! yet they at these
Themselves displease, and 'gainst Him rise.

They rise, and needs will have
My dear Lord made away;
A murderer they save,
The Prince of life they slay.
Yet cheerful He to suff'ring goes,
That He His foes from thence might free.

Here might I stay and sing,
No story so divine:
Never was love, dear King,
Never was grief like Thine!
This is my Friend, in whose sweet praise
I all my days could gladly spend.

title:
Hena N'xma Me Koma Dqw
All That Thrills My Soul
songEN:
Hena n'xma me koma dqw
Sq Yesu Kronkronni no?
Xnokwafo a Xsom bo,
Nhy'ra bqn ni sq Xwx me?

Nnyeso
Nea 'sqpq me kra ne Yesu,
Xsom me bo sen nkwa mpo;
M-pem du mu 'hoxfqfo no,
Mihu wx m'Aw'rade mu.

Kristo dx a Xde ma kwa,
Nyame dom a qkyqn so;
Mmxb'rxhun' a qk'rxn sen s'ro,
Emu dx sen 'po bun' ny'naa.

Xma me nea ehia me ny'naa,
Mihu nnepa ny'naa Ne mu;
Metwer' N'ahoxden kronkron no
Xno ne me b'ribiara.

N-kwa asubxnten no ho,
Me ne s'ro dxm bqto dwom;
Na mm'resanten mfesanten mu,
Mayi Xhen' no ayq.
songTWI:
Who can cheer the heart like Jesus,
By His presence all divine?
True and tender, pure and precious,
Oh, how blest to call Him mine!

Refrain
All that thrills my soul is Jesus;
He is more than life to me;
And the fairest of ten thousand,
In my blessed Lord I see.

Love of Christ so freely given,
Grace of God beyond degree,
Mercy higher than the heaven,
Deeper than the deepest sea.

Every need His hand supplying,
Every good in Him I see;
On His strength divine relying,
He is All in All to me.

By the crystal flowing river
With the ransomed I will sing,
And forever and forever
Praise and glorify the King

title:
Yesu Dx Me
Jesus Loves Me
songEN:
Minim sq Yesu dx me,
Ky'rqw Kronkron n'qky'rq me saa;
Mmotafowa yq Ne de,
Wxyq mm'rqw n'Xno yq den.

Nnyeso
Yiw, Yesu dx me,
Yiw, Yesu dx me,
Yiw, Yesu dx me;
Ky'rqw Kronkron ky'rq me saa.

Yesu dx me! Nea Owu'I
Ma xsoro pon no buei;
Xbqhoh'ro me bxne,
De N'abofra ahyqn mu.

Yesu fa me koma yi,
Ma qnyq Wo de koraa;
Wuwuu 'sqnnua so maa me,
Mqdx Wo asom Wo daa.
songTWI:
Jesus loves me! this I know,
For the Bible tells me so;
Little ones to Him belong,
They are weak, but He is strong.

Refrain
Yes, Jesus loves me!
Yes, Jesus loves me!
Yes, Jesus loves me!
The Bibles tells me so.

Jesus loves me! He who died
Heaven's gate to open wide:
He will wash away my sin,
Let His little child come in.

Jesus, take this heart of mine,
Make it pure and wholly Thine;
On the cross You died for me,
I will love and live for Thee.

title:
S'ro Dx a Qsen Dx Nyinaa
Love Divine
songEN:
S'ro dx a qsen dx nyinaa,
S'ro 'nigye, sian bra fam ha;
Bra bqtra yqn mu sq Wo fi,
Na ky'rq W'adxe wx yqn so;
Yesu, Woyq mmxb'rxhun'fo,
Woyq dx kronkron ampa;
Fa Wo nkwagye no bra yqn so,
Hyqn' koma brqfo biaram'.

Home Wo dx Honhom no gu
Koma a abrq biaram';
Ma yqn nyinaa nnya mfi Wo nkyqn,
Wo bxhyq home pa no;
Yi yqn bxne su nyinaa hx,
Wone Alfa, Omega;
Gyidi farebae ne wiefo,
Ma yqn koma faw'hodi.

Tweaduampxn, bra na bqgye yqn,
Na ma yqn nsa nka Wo dom;
Sian bra bqtra yqn mu na mfi
W'asxr'fie yi mu nkx da;
Yebehy'ra Wo din no daa daa,
Asom Wo sq s'ro dxm no;
Abx mpae akamfo Wo daa,
Adi Wo dx mu 'h'rusi.

Wie W'abxde foforo no,
Yq yqn kronn a nkekae nnim',
Ma Wo n-kwagye kqse no
Nna adi yie wx yqn mu,
Fi 'nuonyam mu kx 'nuonyam mu,
Kosi sq yebedu s'ro
De yqn ahenkyqw no agu
Wo nan asč akamfo Wo.

title:
O, S'ro Guanhwqfo
O Shepherd Divine
songEN:
O, s'ro Guanhwqfo, minim, Wowx me;
Me nti ne 'nadwo hwehwq no.
Wiase yq nwini, na Wo nkyqn yq hyew,
Me Hwqfo, medi W'akyi;
Wo kanea fqfq no hyerqn me kwan so,
Fi W'anuonyam hann mu kx
W'adekyee pam';
Didibea horow, ne sare bonhwam,
Me Hwqfo, medi W'akyi.

O, s'ro Guanhwqfo, minim, Wowx me;
Me nti na Wo koma bui no.
Mede suro hwq Wo dom ne Wo mm'rá a
Qda adi Kalbre no.
A, nkwa a wxde too hx de gyee me kra!
A, koma a ebu de gyee bxn'yqfo!
Wiase yq 'dehw're, W'asqnnua no nti,
Me Hwqfo, medi W'akyi.

O, s'ro Guanhwqfo, minim, Wowx me,
Metee Wo nne sq, 'Di M'akyi'.
Wo nkrasqm no hyerqn me kwan so nnq;
'Yi nč Adiyi Honhom no;
Wo nnwan ho dx no yq me nwanwa mm'roso.
Sqnea Wosi de wxn kx nsu dwoo ho no;
Poma ne abaa, nguankuw, Nyame k'ro,
Me Hwqfo, medi W'akyi.
songTWI:
O Shepherd divine, I know Thou art mine;
Thy search in the night was for me.
This bleak world is cold, but warm is Thy fold;
My Shepherd, I follow Thee.
Thy beautiful lamp shineth bright oér my way,
Thy glorious light unto Thy perfect day.
Thro' pastures serene, Thro'valleys of green,
My Shepherd, I follow Thee.

O Shepherd divine, I know Thou art mine;
Thy great heart was broken for me.
Thy grace and Thy law I picture in awe;
They kissed upon Calvary.
Ah! life that was given to ransom my soul,
Ah! heart that was broken to make sinners whole,
This world is but loss In view of Thy cross,
My Shepherd, I follow Thee.

O Shepherd divine, I know Thou art mine;
I hear Thee say, Follow thou Me.
Thy message today illumines my way;
The Spirit of Prophecy.
I thrill at Thy marvelous love to Thy sheep,
The way Thou dost lead to the still waters deep,
One staff and one rod, One fold and one God,
My Shepherd, I follow Thee.

title:
'Gyenkwa, Ky'rq Me Da Biara
Savoir, Teach Me
songEN:
'Gyenkwa, ky're me da biara,
Ma minni dx 'desua so;
Adesua bi nyq dq sq
Mqdx Neá Odii kan dxx me.

Ma memfa 'bofra koma,
Nyq nea Wohwehwq biara;
Mensom Wo, nni W'akyi daa,
Wo a Wudii kan dxx me.

Kyerq me ma minhu sq,
Menne m' ho, meyq Wo de;
Wo na Wohwq me, gye me
Fi bxne nkoasom ny'naa mu.

Ma menyq dx adwuma,
Mfa 'nigye nyq W'apqde;
Na me daa 'nigye nyq sq:
Mqdx Neá Odii kan dxx me.

Ma minni W'akyi ara,
Mfa 'hoxden nnye Wo dom no;
Ma minsua dx mfi Wo hx,
Wo a Wudii kan dxx me.
songTWI:
Savior, teach me day by day,
Love's sweet lesson to obey,
Sweeter lesson cannot be,
Loving Him who first loved me.

With a child's glad heart of love,
At Thy bidding may I move,
Prompt to serve and follow Thee,
Loving Him who first loved me.

Teach me I am not my own,
I am Thine, and Thine alone;
Thine to keep, to rule, to save
From all sin that would enslave.

Love in loving finds employ,
In obedience all her joy;
Ever new that joy will be,
Loving Him who first loved me.

Teach me thus Thy steps to trace,
Strong to follow in Thy grace.
Learning how to love from Thee,
Loving Him who first loved me.

title:
Yqto Kųrom Asetra Ho Dwom
Sing We of the Modern City
songEN:
Yqto kųrom asetra ho dwom,
Nea 'nigye ne 'dwennwen wx;
Yqto mu nnipadxm ho dwom,
Wxte qdxm mmxnten so,
'Fi santen a ennė ano mu,
Na wxbx wxn bra horow;
Abrabx a qda adi
Nnipa awo ne 'nyin mu.

Kųropxn a nnipa hyq mu ma,
Mm'rika ne xbrq wiase.
'Nigyede ne 'huhude a
Qredi ahim no mu.
Kristo wx hx, Xte yqn mu;
Yehu No nnipadxm nom'
Kųro mu akxneaba mu no,
Kristo ne 'nipa biara.

Onyame nni s'ro akyiri,
Xne yqn wx 'sase'i so,
Resesa yqn mu b'ribiara,
Ama yqanya din papa.
Kristo aky'rq kwan biara so,
Onipa nkwa mu anuonyam.
Xnam N'ahoyie so ky'rq sq
Nnipa ho hia, wxsom bo!
songTWI:
Sing we of the modern city,
Scene alike of joy and stress;
Sing we of its namelss people
In their urban wilderness.
Into endless rows of houses
Life is set a millionfold,
Life expressed in human beings
Daily born and growing old.

In the city full of people,
World of speed and hectic days,
In the everchanging setting
Of the latest trend and craze,
Christ is present, and among us;
In the crowd we see Him stand.
In the bustle of the city
Jesus Christ is every man.

God is not remote in heaven,
But on earth to share our shame,
Changing graph and mass and number
Into persons with a name.
Christ has shown, beyond statistics,
Human life with glory crowned,
By His timeless presence proving
People matter, people count!

title:
N-Hyira Bosu
Showers of Blessings
songEN:
Wxbqtx n-hyira bosu,
Eyi ne xdx bxhyq;
Ahoxden mmerq nso bqba,
Agyenkwa de fi soro.

Nnyeso
N-hyira bosu,
N-hyira bosu hia yqn;
Adom nsu retx yqn ho hyia,
Nanso yqsrq nsu n'ara.

Wxbqtx n-hyira bosu,
Qma y'ahoxden fof'ro;
Nkoko so ne abon mu,
Yqte n-su nnyigyei pii.

Wxbqtx n-hyira bosu,
'Wura, tx bi gu yqn so;
Ma yqn ahoxden fof'ro nnq,
Bqhyq W'asqm anomyam.

Wxbqtx n-hyira bosu,
O anka qretx nnq;
Nnq a yqreka yqn bxne yi,
Na yqrefrq Yesu yi!

Wxbqtx n-hyira bosu,
Sq yqyq setie nko a;
Ahoxden mmerq nso bqba
Sq yqma Nyame kwan a.

title:
Ka Tetesqm No Ky'rq Me
Tell Me the Old, Old Story
songEN:
Ka tetesqm no ky'rq me,
Soro nneqmā a wonhu,
Yesu ne N'anuoyam no,
Yesu ne Ne dx no,
Ka no tiatiatia sqnea
Wxka ky'rq abofra;
Efisq meyq mmerqw,
Na me ho agu fi.

Nnyeso
Ka tetesqm no ky'rq me,
Ka tetesqm no ky'rq me,
Ka tetesqm no ky'rq me,
Yesu ne Ne dx no.

Ka asqm no brqoo ky'rq me,
Nnč a ano yq nnam mu,;
Kae sq mene bxn'yqfō a
Yesu bqgyee me nkwa.
Ka tetesqm no daa daa
Sq qyq nokwar' sq,
Ahohia b're biara mu
Wone m'aw'rqkyekye.

Ka tetesqm no ky'rq me,
B're a wusuro sq,
Wiase anuonyam hunu'I
Bo yq den ma me no;
Yiw, sq wiase anuonyam
Refa me kra yi a,
Ka tetesqm no ky'rq me
Sq 'Kristo bqgye wo'.
songTWI:
Tell me the old, old story,
Of unseen things above,
Of Jesus and His glory,
Of Jesus and His love;
Tell me the story simply,
As to a little child,
For I am weak and weary,
And helpless and defiled.

Refrain
Tell me the old, old story,
Tell me the old, old story,
Tell me the old, old story,
Of Jesus and His love;

Tell me the story softly,
With earnest tones and grave;
Remember I'm the sinner
Whom Jesus came to save;
Tell me the story always,
If you would really be,
In any time of trouble,
A comforter to me.

Tell me the same old story,
When you have cause to fear
That this world's empty glory
Is costing me too dear;
Yes, and when that world's glory
Is dawning on my soul
Tell me the old, old story:
Christ Jesus makes thee whole.

title:
Me Guanhwqfo Ne Dx Hen' No
The King of Love My Shepher Is
songEN:
Me Guanhwqfo ne dx Hen' no
Ne papayq rensa da;
Mewx No a, b'ribi nhia me,
Na Xyq me de daa daa.

Nea nkwa asubxnten sen no
Ogya me kra á Wapon no,
Nea nhabammono fifi no,
De soro aduan yqn no.

Metaa meyq kwasea to kwan
Na Okyin pq me xdxm',
Xsoa me Ne mmat'ri so brqoo,
Xde me ba fie 'nigyem.

Me nkwa nna tenten yi nyinaam,
W'ayamye no mmx me da;
'Guanhwqfo pa, meyi W'ayq,
Wx Wo fi ha daa nyinaa.
songTWI:
The King of love my Shepherd is,
Whose goodness faileth never;
I nothing lack if I am His,
And He is mine forever.

Where streams of living water flow
My ransomed soul He leadeth,
And, where the verdant pastures grow,
With food celestial feedeth.

Perverse and foolish, oft I strayed,
But yet in love He sought me,
And on His shoulder gently laid,
And Index, rejoicing, brought me.

And so through all the length of days
Thy goodness faileth never;
Good Shepherd! I would sing Thy praise
Within Thy house forever.

title:
So Metumi Anya Mfaso
And Can It Be?
songEN:
So metumi anya mfaso
Wx Agyenkwa no mogya mu?
Owu maa mč a mehaw No no?
Mč a mepam No kxx 'wu mu no?
Anwanwa dx, qbqyq dqn
Na me Nyame bewų ama me?

Nnyeso
Anwanwa dx, qbqyq dqn
Na me Nyame bewų ama me?

Ogyaw N'Agya 'henni wx s'ro,
Xdom a enni kabea nti;
Ogyaw ade nyinaa de 'dx
Kyii mogya maa Adam 'sefo;
Qyq mmxb'rxhun' kqse kwa,
Sq me Nyame bqhwehwqq me.

Me kra daa afiase yie
Wx bxne ne wiase sum mu;
W'aniwa mu hann kanyan me;
Minyanee, afiase yqq hann,
Me mpoky'rq fi gui, midii dqw,
Mesxree ntqm bedii W'akyi.

Minsuro afobu bio nnq;
Yesu ne N'ade ny'naa wx me!
Mete Ne mu, me nkwa Nsuti.
Xde s'ro trenee ahyq me;
Mede nnam kx 'hengua n'anim,
Kxgye m'ahenkyqw Kristo mu.
songTWI:
And can it be that I should gain
An interest in the Savior's blood!
Died he for me? who caused his pain!
For me? who him to death pursued?
Amazing love! How can it be
That thou, my God, shouldst die for me?

Refrain
Amazing love! How can it be
That thou, my God, shouldst die for me?

He left his Father's throne above
So free, so infinite his grace!;
Emptied himself of all but love,
And bled for Adam's helpless race.
'Tis mercy all, immense and free,
For O my God, it found out me!

Long my imprisoned sprit lay,
Fast bound in sin and nature's night;
Thine eye diffused a quickening ray;
I woke, the dungeon flamed with light;
My chains fell off, my heart was free,
I rose, went forth, and followed thee.

No condemnation now I dread;
Jesus, and all in him, is mine;
Alive in him, my living Head,
And clothed in righteousnes divine,
Bold I approach th' eternal throne,
And claim the crown, through Christ my own.

title:
Ti a Wxhyqq No Nsxekyqw No
The Head That Once Was Crowned
songEN:
Ti a wxhyqq no nsxekyqw no,
Wxahyq No 'nuonyam kyqw
Wxde ahenkyqw ahyq Nea
Wadi nkonim kqse.

Nea qk'rxn kyqn so wx s'ro no,
Yq Xno ara de;
Ahen' mu Hen', aw'ra mu W'ra,
Xne xs'ro daa hann.

Wxn a wxte s'ro anigye,
Ne fam hafo nso de;
Wxn na Oyi Ne dx ky'rq wxn
Ma wohu Ne din no.

Xde 'sqnnua no ho 'niwu
Ne ho dom no ma wxn,
Ma wxn din a qtra hx daa
Ne xs'ro anigye.
songTWI:
The head that once was crowned with thorns
Is crowned with glory now;
A royal diadem adorns
The mighty victor's brow.

The highest place that heaven affords
Is His, is His by right;
The King of kings, and Lord of lords,
And heaven's eternal light.

The joy of all who dwell above,
The joy of all below,
To whom He manifests His love,
And grants His name to know.

To them the cross, with all its shame,
With all its grace is given;
Their name an everlasting name,
Their joy the joy of heaven.

title:
A W'rade Reba
The Lord Is Coming
songEN:
Aw'rade reba, ma 'yi nyq
Ne mmae no ho ah'rusi dwom;
Sq yehyia na yqtete mų a,
Ma 'yi nyq koma mu nkyea.

Nnyeso
Aw'rade reba, ma 'yi nyq
Ne mmae no ho ah'rusi dwom,
Ne mmae no ho ah'rusi dwom.

Aw'rade reba, pae mu ka,
Wx wiase afanan nyinaa;
Yq ntqm ka anigye no
Sqnea N'adxfo w'rq renhow.

Aw'rade reba no ntqm so,
N'atemmu nyinaa begyina;
Obi ntum' nguan mfi N'abufuwm',
Nea xnnante kwan teaa noso.

'Sase ne ne mfomso dodo
Bqdan ato anuonyam nnwom;
Yqne 'bxde nyinaa bebom
Ato 'h'rusi nnwom hann man nom'.
songTWI:
The Lord is coming, let this be
The herald note of jubilee;
And when we meet and when we part
The salutation from the heart.

Refrain
The Lord is coming, let this be
The herald note of jubilee,
The herald note of jubilee.

The Lord is coming! sound it forth
From east to west, from south to north;
Speed on! speed on the tidings glad,
That none who love Him may be sad.

The Lord is coming, swift and sure
And all His judgments shall endure,
And none can hope to escape
His wrath, Who walk not in the narrow path.

This earth, with her ten thousand wrongs
Will soon be tuned to nobler songs;
Our praise shall then, in realms of light,
With all His universe unite.

title:
Kristo Reba! Ma Abxde
Christ Is Coming
songTWI:
Christ is coming! let creation
Bid her groans and travail cease;
Let the glorious proclamation
Hope restore and faith increase;
Christ is coming! Christ is coming!
Come, Thou blessed Prince of Peace!
Come, Thou blessed Prince of Peace!

Earth can now but tell the story
Of Thy bitter cross and pain;
She shall yet behold Thy glory
When Thou comest back to reign;
Christ is coming! Christ is coming!
Let each heart repeat the strain.
Let each heart repeat the strain.

With that blessed hope before us,
Let no harp remain unstrung;
Let the mighty advent chorus
Onward roll from tongue to tongue:
Christ is coming! Christ is soling!
Come, Lord Jesus, quickly come!
Come, Lord Jesus, quickly come!

title:
Mohnyq No Anuonyam Hen'
Hail Him the King of Glory
songEN:
Ka ky'rq mmusuakuw ne aman nyinaa,
Ka no mmaa nyinaa;
'Sase sum kabii bqpa anxpa,
Yesu bqba seesei.

Nnyeso
Monhyq No anuonyam Hen',
'Guammaan' wu maa 'bxn'yqfo;
Monka anwanwasqm no:
Yesu bedi Hen'.

Asase so akosqm dodow yi
Rebx yqn kxkx;
Ewim nsqnkyerqnne ahorow no
Bx 'da no ho daw'ru.

Onyame mma, momfa 'nigye nhwq s'ro,
Monto N'ayeyi;
Nhyira ne wxn a wxretwqn rewqn
Hann a qrepue no.
songTWI:
Tell it to every kindred and nation,
Tell it far and near;
Earth's darkest night will fade with the dawning,
Jesus will soon appear.

Refrain
Hail Him the King of glory,
Once the Lamb for sinners slain;
Tell, tell the wondrous story,
Jesus comes to reign.

Nations again in strife and commotion,
Warnings by the way;
Signs in the heavens, unerring omens,
Herald the glorious day.

Children of God look up with rejoicing;
Shout and sing His praise;
Blessed are they who, waiting and watching,
Look for the dawning rays.

title:
Yi Ne Nokwar' Mmiqnsá a
This Is the Threefold Truth
songEN:
Yi ne nokwar' mmiqnsá a
Yqn gyidi gyina so;
Saa 'nigyesqm yi ne
Som mfiase ne awiei.

Nnyeso
Kristo wui!
Kristo sxree!
Kristo bqba bio!

'Yi na qma yqn so,
B're a w'rqhow woso
Yqn Kristom ahoxden,
Na aka xdom nko.

'Yi ne nokwar' mmiqnsá a
Sq yqsx mu den a,
Qbqsesa wiase,
De yqn akod'ru fie.
songTWI:
This is the threefold truth
On which our faith depends;
And with this joyful cry
Worship begins and ends.

Refrain
Christ had died! Christ has risen!
Christ will come again!

By this we are upheld
When doubt and grief assail
Our Christian fortitude
And only grace avails

This is the threefold truth
Which, if we hold it fast,
Changes the world and us
And brings us Index at last.

title:
Bra, Yesu a Yqatwqn Wō Abrq
Come, Thou Long Expected Jesus
songTWI:
Come, thou long expected Jesus,
born to set thy people free;
from our fears and sins release us,
let us find our rest in thee.
Israel's strength and consolation,
hope of all the earth thou art;
dear desire of every nation,
joy of every longing heart.

Born thy people to deliver,
born a child and yet a King,
born to reign in us forever,
now thy gracious kingdom bring.
By thine own eternal spirit
rule in all our hearts alone;
by thine all sufficient merit,
raise us to thy glorious throne.

title:
Anxpa Fqfq No Reba Ntqm So
Gleams of the Golden Morning
songEN:
Anxpa fqfq no reba ntqm so,
Yesu reba ntqm,
Abqfa Ne mma agyidifo no
Akx bxhyq fie.

Nnyeso
O yehu anxpa fqfq no hann sq
Qrepue 'nadwo sum mu;
O yehu anxpa fqfq no hann a
Qbqhy'rqn damoam'.

Wxbqbx asqmpa no ho daw'ru
Aman nyinaa mu;
Ayef'rokunu no rentwentwqn bio:
T'robqnto bebom.

Hann abxfo nyinaa bqka Ne ho
Apue wx wim hx;
Temmufon' bqba abefa Ne mma
Akx daa nkwa mu.

Adxfo awxn ntam atete no
Behyia bio da no;
Na wxn a wxn koma abubu no
Nusu ny'naa bqsa.
songTWI:
The golden morning is fast approaching;
Jesus soon will come
To take his faithful and happy children
to their promised Index

Refrain
O, we see the gleams of the golden morning
piercing thro' this night of gloom!
O, see the gleams of the golden morning
that will burst the tomb.

The gospel summons will soon be carried
to the nations round;
The Bridegroom then will cease to tarry
and the trumpet sound.

Attended by all the shining angels,
Down the flaming sky
the Judge will come, and will take his people
where they will not die.

The lov'd of earth who have long been parted
Meet in that glad day;
The tears of those who are broken hearted
shall be wiped away.

title:
Mehyia Kristo m'Agyenkwa No
Face to Face
songEN:
Mehyia Kristo m'Agyenkwa no,
Yebehu yqn ho ara;
Da a mehu No anigyem,
Yesu a Owu maa me.

Nnyeso
Mehu Xno ara anim,
Wx ewim akyi nohoa,
Mehu N'anim anuonyam mu,
Daakye bi mehu N'anim.

M-prempren de esum yi nti,
Mihu no ketewaa bi;
Nanso qda pa bi reba
A mehu N'anuonyam no.

B'rč a 'w'rqhow ne yaw bqpa no
N'anim bqyq 'nigye yie;
Sq wxtene 'tempxn no wie,
Na esum nso dan hann a.

Ahotx b're nom' mehu No!
Mehu No ahyq No nso,
Mehu me Dimafo anim
Kristo a Xde me no.
songTWI:
Face to face with Christ my Savior,
Face to face, what will it be,
When with rapture I behold Him,
Jesus Christ, who died for me?

Refrain
Face to face shall I behold Him,
Far beyond the starry sky;
Face to face in all His glory
I shall see Him by and by!

Only faintly now I see Him,
With the darkening veil between,
But a blessed day is coming,
When His glory shall be seen.

What rejoicing in His presence,
When are banished grief and pain;
When the crooked ways are straightened,
And the dark things shall be plain!

Face to face! oh, blissful moment!
Face to face to see and know;
Face to face with my Redeemer,
Jesus Christ, who loves me so.

title:
Ebia Qbqyq 'Nxpa a Ade Rekye
It May be at Morn
songEN:
Ebia qbqyq 'nxpa a ade rekye,
B're a owia hann repam anadwo sum no;
Na Yesu bqba wx N'anuonyam nyinaa mu
Abqgye Ne de wiasem'.

Nnyeso
'W'ra Yesu, enkosi da bqn?
Na yqato 'h'rusi dwom?
Kristo reba, Haleluya!
Haleluya! Amen, Haleluya! Amen.

Ebia qbqyq 'wigyinae anaa nhema,
Ebia anadwo 'dasu mu sum kqse no
Bqdan hann wx Yesu anuonyam kqse nom,
B'rč a Xbqgye Ne de no.

Ahosqpq ni sq yqrenhu owu bio!
Yare, aw'rqhow ne osu betwam akx;
Yebehyia 'W'rade wx wim akx 'nuonyam mu,
B'rč a Xbqgye Ne de no
songTWI:
It may be at morn, when the day is awaking,
When sunlight through darkness and shadow is breaking
That Jesus will come in the fullness of glory
To receive from the world His own.

Refrain
O Lord Jesus, how long, how long
Ere we shout the glad song?
Christ returneth, Hallelujah!
Hallelujah! Amen, Hallelujah! Amen.

It may be at midday, it may be at twilight,
It may be, perchance, that the blackness of midnight
Will burst into light in the blaze of His glory,
When Jesus receives His own.

O joy! O delight! should we go without dying,
No sickness, no sadness, no dread, and no crying,
Caught up through the clouds with our Lord into glory,
When Jesus receives His own.

title:
Yesu Ba a, Sum Bonhwa Befi Hx
There'll Be No Dark Valleys
songEN:
Yesu ba a, sum bonhwa befi hx,
Yesu ba a, sum bonhwa befi hx;
Yesu ba a, sum bonhwa befi hx,
Na Xde ne dč akx fie.

Nnyeso
Na Xde Ne dč akx fie,
Na Xde Ne dč akx fie;
Yesu ba a, sum bonhwa befi hx,
Na Xde Ne dč akx fie.

Yesu ba a, 'w'rqhow ny'naa to betwa,
Yesu ba a, 'w'rqhow ny'naa to betwa;
Yesu ba a, 'w'rqhow ny'naa to bwa,
Na Xde Ne dč akx fie.

Yesu ba a yqbqto 'kwaaba nnwom,
Yesu ba a yqbqto 'kwaaba nnwom;
Yesu ba a yqbqto 'kwaaba nnwom,
Na Xde Ne dč akx fie.
songTWI:
There'll be no dark valleys when Jesus comes,
There'll be no dark valleys when Jesus comes,
There'll be no dark valleys when Jesus comes,
To gather His loved ones Index.

Refrain
To gather His loved ones Index,
To gather His loved ones Index.
There'll be no dark valleys when Jesus comes,
To gather His loved ones Index.

There'll be no more sorrow when Jesus comes,
There'll be no more sorrow when Jesus comes,
There'll be a happy tomorrow when Jesus comes,
To gather His loved ones Index.

There'll be songs of greeting when Jesus comes,
There'll be songs of greeting when Jesus comes,
There'll be songs of greeting when Jesus comes,
To gather His loved ones Index.

title:
Anuonyam Da No Reba
That Glorious Day Is Coming
songEN:
Anuonyam da no reba,
Na dxn no reba ntqm;
Ne hann fqfq no rebqn,
Qhyerqn sen owia;
Xs'ro mununkum mu na
Agyenkwa no bepue,
Abqboaboa N'aponfo
Ano de wxn akx.

'Hotefo nkonimdifo
Behyia wxn Aw'rade,
Na 'nuonyam asase no
Bqyq wxn akatua;
Nyame a Odi hen' no
Bqpopa nusu ny'naa;
Esum bi rentra hx bio
Qbqyq daa 'dekyee.

Kristoni, nyan fi nna mu,
Ma wo dx nyq kase;
Wqn bx mpae di nokware,
T'robqnto no bebom;
Bxn'yqfo, tie kxkxbx 'I,
Guan kx Kristo nkyqn ntqm;
Na nhyira anxpa no
Woakohyia No wx wim.
songTWI:
That glorious day is coming,
The hour is hastening on;
Its radiant light is nearing,
Far brighter than the sun;
In yonder clouds of heaven,
The Savior will appear,
And gather all His chosen,
To meet Him in the air.

The saints, then all victorious
Will go to meet their Lord;
An earth both bright and glorious,
Will then be their reward;
And God Himself there reigning,
Will wipe all tears away;
Nor clouds nor night remaining,
But one eternal day.

O Christian, keep from sleeping,
And let your love abound;
Be watchful, prayerful, faithful,
The trumpet soon will sound!
O sinner, hear the warning!
To Jesus quickly!
Then you, in that blest morning,
May meet Him in the sky!

title:
Munnyan Na 'Nadwo Retwam Ntqm
Awake, Awake, for the Flying
songEN:
Munnyan na 'nadwo retwam ntqm,
Awqmfo a wxwx s'ro reteam;
Munnyan, Yerusalem, monsxr'!
Xdasum dxn no rebx brqoo,
Ne teaseqnam nan rewoso ba;
Mo mmaabun mmadwemma, monwqn,
Momfa xpq nsxre
Monkohyia 'Yef'rokun'; Haleluya!
Momfa mo 'kanea mfa sum nom',
Monyq ntqm nkxfra dxm no mu.

Sion te awqmfo no dwom,
Ne koma de anigye woso.
Onyan, sxre fi 'w'rqhow mu,
N'ayef'rokun' ba 'nuonyam mu,
Xde dom adi nim nokwar' mu;
Ns'romma no apue, hann aba.
Mommx 'se mma 'W'rade,
Yqn 'henkyqw, yqn 'katua; Haleluya!
Yqde nnwom nante hare so
Kxfra 'yef'rodxm nom' 'nigyem.

Nyame Guammaa, xs'ro som Wo,
Nnipa ne 'bxfo to dwom W'anim,
Nsankuw ne akasa nne mu;
Yegyina 'bohemma 'pon ho,
Yqma yqn nne so tea mu dennen
Twa W'ahengua hyqnhyqn ho hyia;
Aniwa biara nhui,
Na aso biara ntee 'Nigye sei da;
Yqma dwom so 'dxm kqse mu,
De yi W'ayq nna santen ny'naa.
songTWI:
Wake, awake, for night is flying,
The watchmen on the heights are crying,
Awake, Jerusalem, arise!
Midnight's solemn hour is tolling,
His chariot wheels are nearer rolling,
He comes; prepare, ye virgins wise.
Rise up with willing feet
Go forth, the Bridegroom meet; Alleluia!
Bear through the night your well-trimmed light,
Speed forth to join the marriage rite.

Zion hears the watchmen singing,
Her heart with deep delight is springing,
She wakes, she rises from her gloom;
Forth her Bridegroom comes, all-glorious,
In grace arrayed, by truth victorious;
Her Star is risen, her Light is come!
All hail, incarnate Lord,
Our crown, and our reward! Alleluia!
We haste along, in pomp and song,
And gladsome join the marriage throng.

Lamb of God, the heavens adore Thee,
And men and angels sing before Thee,
With harp and cymbal's clearest tone.
By the pearly gates in wonder
We stand, and swell the voice of thunder,
That echoes round Thy dazzling throne.
No vision ever brought,
No ear hath ever caught,
Such bliss and joy;
We raise the song, we swell the throng,
To praise Thee ages all along.

title:
Hwq! Xreba Mununkum Mu
Lo! He Comes
songEN:
Hwq! Xreba mununkum mu,
Wokum No maa bxn'yqfo;
Abxfo mpempem ka Ne ho,
De ah'rusi di N'akyi;
Haleluya! Haleluya!
Yesu reba 'bedi Hen'.

Aniwa nyinaa behu No
Wx N'anuonyam tumi mu;
Wxn a wobuu No animtia,
Wxtxn No, bxx No 'sqnnuam'
Besu dennen brč a wobehu
Mesaia Nokwafo no.

Sq wxhyqn t'robqnto no a
S'ro ne fam beguan akx;
N'atamfo nyinaa bqbx hu
B'rč a wxbqte nne bi sq:
Mommra 'temmum', mommra 'temmum'
Mommra 'temmum', mumfi mm'ra.

Yiw, amen! Ma obiara nsom
Wō a Wote daa 'hengua so!
'Gyenkwa, fa 'nuonyam ne tumi
Ma W'atqntrenee nna adi;
O bra ntqmntqm, O bra ntqmntqm
Bqfa 'henni yq Wo de.
songTWI:
Lo! He comes, with clouds descending,
Once for favored sinners slain;
Countless angels, Him attending,
Swell the triumph of His train:
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
Jesus comes, and comes to reign.

Every eye shall now behold Him
Robed in dreadful majesty!
Those who set at nought and sold Him,
Pierced, and nailed Him to the tree,
Deeply wailing, Deeply wailing,
Shall the true Mesiah see!

When the solemn trump has sounded,
Heaven and earth shall flee away;
All who hate Him, must, confounded,
Hear the summons of that day-
Come to judgment! Come to judgment!
Come to judgment! Come away!

Yea, amen! let all adore Thee,
High on Thy eternal throne!
Savior, take the power and glory,
Make Thy righteous sentence known;
O come quickly, O come quickly,
Claim the kingdom for Thine own!

title:
B're Adu Sq Awurade Ba
'Tis Almost Time for the Lord to Come
songEN:
B're adu sq Awurade ba,
Mete sq nk'rxfo ka;
Xs'ro ns'romma han no redum
Qyq adekyee na qrepue.

Nnyeso
O qyq adekyee na qrepue!
O qyq adekyee na qrepue!
'Desae rekx awiei, 'dekyee afi ase;
O qyq adekyee na qrepue!

Sqnky'rqnne a aba 'wia ne 'sram,
'Sase ne po ne s'ro
Bx no daw'ru ky'rq adasa,
Sq Owura no mmae no abqn.

B're aso sq xtwqn asafon'
To n'ahantan gu na
Qsiesie ne ho fa kanea
De hwehwq 'dekyee a qrepue.

Ka wo ho na pue kx mmxnten so
Ne akwantempxn mu,
Se mmubuafo ne 'nif'raefo
Sq wxnyq krado mma 'dekyee no.
songTWI:
'Tis almost time for the Lord to come,
I hear the people say;
The stars of heaven are growing dim,
It must be the breaking of the day.

Refrain
O it must be the breaking of the day!
O it must be the breaking of the day!
The night is almost gone,
The day is coming on;
O it must be the breaking of the day!

The signs foretold in the sun and moon,
In earth and sea and sky,
Aloud proclaim to all mankind,
The coming of the Master draweth nigh.

It must be time for the waiting church
To cast her pride away,
With girded loins and burning lamps,
To look for the breaking of the day.

Go quickly out in streets and lanes
And in the broad highway,
And call the maimed, the halt, and blind,
To be ready for the breaking of the day.

title:
Yesu Resan Aba Bio'
Jesus Is Coming Again
songEN:
Momma t'robqnto no so na monhyqn:
Yesu resan aba bio!
Akwantufo, munni dew monto dwom;
Yesu resan aba bio'.

Nnyeso
Xreba bio, Xreba bio.
Yesu resan aba bio'.

Mmepx ne n-saseta monka sq:
Yesu resan aba bio!
'Guammaā a wokum No reba 'nuonyam mu,
Yesu resan aba bio.

Asase wosow ma mpempem hu sq:
Yesu resan aba bio!
Ahum ne mframa gu so to dwom sq;
Yesu resan aba bio!

Yqnam amn abufuw so hu sq:
Yesu resan aba bio!
Nimdeq ne akxneaba redxxso;
Yesu resan aba bio!
songTWI:
Lift up the trumpet, and loud let it ring:
Jesus is coming again! Cheer up, ye pilgrims,
be joyful and sing; Jesus is coming again!

Refrain
Coming again, coming again,
Jesus is coming again!

Echo it, hilltops; proclaim it, ye plains:
Jesus is coming again! Coming in glory,
the Lamb that was slain; Jesus is coming again!

Heavings of earth, tell the vast, wondering throng;
Jesus is coming again! Tempests and whirlwinds,
the anthem prolong; Jesus is coming again!

Nations are angry-by this we do know
Jesus is coming again! Knowledge increases;
men run to and fro; Jesus is coming again!

title:
Yqwx 'Nidaso Yi Wx Yqn
We Have This Hope
songEN:
Yqwx 'nidaso yi wx yqn komam,
Aw'rade mmae ho 'nidaso.
Yqwx gyidi a Kristo nko de ma,
Ne bxhyqsqm no mu gyidi.
Yqgye di sq b're adu,
B're a amn no nyinaa
Benyan ateam, ato sq:
Haleluya! Hen' Kristo!
Yqwx 'nidaso yi wx yqn komam,
Aw'rade mmae ho 'nidaso.
songTWI:
We have this hope that burns within our hearts,
Hope in the coming of the Lord.
We have this faith that Christ alone imparts,
Faith in the promise of His Word.
We believe the time is here,
When the nations far and near
Shall awake, and shout, and sing
Hallelujah! Christ is King!
We have this hope that burns within our hearts,
Hope in the coming of the Lord.

title:
Xhen' No Bqba, Brč a 'Nopa
The King Shall Come
songEN:
Xhen' no bqba, brč a 'nxpa
Hann bepue nkonim mu;
B'rč a apuei mmepx bqyq fq
Na nkwa benyan 'nigyem.

Xremma sq abofra bio
Mmqsoa bxn' nnesoa nwu;
Na mmom Obepue 'nuonyam mu
Te sq anxpawi.

Na qhy'rqn sen adekyee hann
Brč a Kristo de nkonim
Sxre fii awufo mu tiaa
Tamfo abufuw no.

Nea 'hy'rqn sen 'nuonyam 'dekyee no
Bepue wx nnipa mu;
Dá a Kristo bqba 'nuonyam mu n'
Na yebehu N'anim.

Xhen' no bqba brč a 'nxpa
Da hann fqfq bqba;
'W'ra Kristo, Wo mma bx mpae sq:
Bra ntqmntqm, 'hen' mu Hen'.
songTWI:
The King shall come when morning dawns
And light triumphant breaks,
When beauty gilds the eastern hills
And life to joy awakes.

Not as of old a little child,
To bear and fight and die,
But crowned with glory like the sun
That lights the morning sky.

O, brighter than the rising morn
When Christ, victorious, rose
And left the lonesome place of death,
Despite the rage of foes.

O, brighter than that glorious morn
Shall dawn upon our race
The day when Christ in splendor comes,
And we shall see His face.

The King shall come when morning dawns
And light and beauty brings.
Hail, Christ the Lord! Your people pray:
Come quickly, King of kings.

title:
