De soaa nnipa ahiade;
Wō a wxpoo Wo 'sqnnua no so
Nso Woyqq dom adwuma:
Wo nkoa de yqn som rebrq Wo,
'Nyq nne mu nko, na komam;
Yqde akyqde biara a
Wode ma yq W'apqde.

Wo mma da so wx ntwqtwqdq;
Xkxm mma da so resu;
Nneduafo p're pq 'hofadi;
Yqda so su yqn 'wufo.
Sqnea Wode ahummxb'rx
Sa xkra no yare no,
Fa Wo Honhom tumi no so
Besiesie yqn wiase yi

Yqresom yi, ma yqn nhun'mu
Kosi sq Wo dx hann no
Wx ne k'rxn ne kqseyq mu
Bqkanyan yqn adehu;
Na yqahu 'hiade ne nnesoá a
W'adxe hyq yqn ma yqsoa,
Na akanyan yqn ama 'som
Ne Wo nkwa ho 'dansedi.
songTWI:
Lord, whose love in humble service
Bore the weight of human need,
Who upon the cross, forsaken,
Worked Your mercy's perfect deed:
We, Your servants, bring the worship
Not of voice alone, but heart;
Consecrating to Your purpose
Every gift which You impart.

Still Your children wander Indexless;
Still the hungry cry for bread;
Still the captives long for freedom;
Still in grief we mourn our dead.
As You, Lord, in deep compassion
Healed the sick and freed the soul,
By Your Spirit send Your power
To our world to make it whole.

As we worship, grant us vision,
Till your love's revealing light
In its height and depth and greatness
Dawns upon our quickened sight,
Making known the needs and burdens
Your compassion bids us bear,
Stirring us to ardent service,
Your abundant life to share.

title:
Yesu Kristo, Yqn Nnwom Foro Ba Wo Hx
O Jesus Christ, to You
songEN:
Yesu Kristo, yqn nnwom foro ba Wo hx
Kųro biara mu Wo dx ne banbx nti;
Kanyan yqn som, ma yqn dqw sononko a
Wo Honhom de ma nnipa baabiara.

Ma yqn nnamyq, 'hofama, 'hobrqase ne
W'ahoxden a qma yetum' gyina,
Na yema wxn a wxahwe ase no so
Hwehwq ankonam, ka W'adxe no ky'rq.

Ky'rq yqn Wo Honhom a ebutu 'man so,
Sqnea Wusuu Yerusalem man so,
Hwehwqq sq Wobqboa wxn ano asa
Wxn a wxsx W'atade mu yare.
songTWI:
O Jesus Christ, to You may hymns be rising
In every city for Your love and care;
Inspire our worship, grant the glad surprising
That Your blest Spirit brings men everywhere.

Grant us new courage, Vsacrificial, humble,
Strong in Your strength to venture and to dare,
To lift the fallen, guide the feet that stumbe,
Seek out the lonely and God's mercy share.

Show us Your Spirit, brooding o'er each city,
As You did weep above Jerusalem,
Seeking to gather all in love and pity,
And healing those who touch Your garment's hem.

title:
O Sion, Yq Ntqm Na Wie
O Zion, Haste
songEN:
O Sion, yq ntqm na wie w'adwuma no,
Ka no wiase ny'naa sq Nyame yq hann;
Ky'rq wxn sq Nea Xbxx amn nyinaa no
Mpq sq xkra bqy'ra sum mu.

Nnyeso
Ka 'nigyesqm no, asomdwoesqm,
Yesu ho nsqm, xgye ne ahofadi.

Ka ky'rq aman, kasa ne nnipa nyinaa
Sq Nyame a wxte Ne mu yq dx;
Ka sqnea Xbrqq Ne ho ase gyee wxn,
Na Owui sqnea nnipa bqtra s'ro.

Ma wo mma no nsoa anuonyam nkrasqm no,
Fa w'ahode no pia wxn wx kwan so;
Fa nkotosrq bx mpae ma wonni nkonim,
Nea wohw're no, Yesu bqhyqw' anan.

Xreba bio, O Sion, siesie wo ho,
Ka Ne gye 'dom no ky'rq koma biara;
Ma Obiará a Wagye no mma No 'kwaaba.
Woanyq saá a worentumi nhu N'anim.

title:
Apaafo a Wxboaboaa Nnxbae Pa
O Where Are the Reapers?
songEN:
Apaafo a wxboaboaa nnxbae pa
Ano fi bxne mfuw mu no wx he?
Wxde nokwar' nkrantq di dwuma no,
Na hom'gye nnim kosi sq wobewie.

Nnyeso
Apaafo wx he? Hena bqba
Abqka otwa anuonyam no ahwq?
Hena bqboa yqn ama yqatwa
Nnxbae pa afi bxne mfuw mu?

Mfuw no nyinaa ahoa wx baabiara;
Wiasč ayq krado retwqn otwa no;
Adwuma no so, apaafo no sua,
Otwan' anyq ntqm a akra bqy'ra.

Momfa mo nkrantq mmra, mo nnipa mma,
Na mommoaboa awi pa no ano;
Monyq 'dwuma kosi 'twa W'ra no mmae,
Na mo ne No akyq Ne twa ho dqw.
songTWI:
O where are the reapers that garner in
The sheaves of the good from the fields of sin?
With sickles of truth must the work be done,
And no one may rest till the "harvest Index."

Refrain
Where are the reapers? O who will come
And share in the glory of the "harvest Index"?
O who will help us to garner in
The sheaves of good from the fields of sin?

The fields all are ripening, and far and wide
The world now is waiting the harvest tide:
But reapers are few, and the work is great,
And much will be lost should the harvest wait.

So come with your sickles, ye sons of men,
And gather together the golden grain;
Toil on till the Lord of the harvest come,
Then share ye His joy in the "harvest Index."

title:
Gye Wxn a Wxrey'ra
Rescue the Perishing
songEN:
Gye wxn a wxrey'ra, Hwq wxn' a wxr'wu,
Fa 'yamhyehye hwim wxn fi bxn' ne wum';
Su ma akwantofo: Ma wxn so fi fam
Ka Yesu, Xgyefo, ho nsqm ky'rq wxn.

Nnyeso
Gye wxn a wxrey'ra,
Hwq wxn a wxrewu,
Yesu yq mmxb'rxhun',
Yesu gye nkwa.

Wxmfa No nyq hwee de, Nso Xwqn ara;
Xretwqn ahonufo agye wxn;
Frq wxn anib're so, Ka wxn brqbrq bra;
Sq wxgye di nkō a Xde bef'ri wxn.

Gye wxn a wxrey'ra, Qyq w'asede,
Awurade bqma wo ahoxden;
San kx kwan teaa no so, Gye wxn boasetxm
Ka 'Gyenkwa wu ky'rq wxn a wxafom kwan.

title:
Wqmfom Hyqn 'Sqmpa T'robqnto
Watchman, Blow the Gospel Trumpet
songEN:
Wqmfo, hyqn 'sqmpa t'robqnto
Bx xkra biara kxkx;
Obiará a xte nkrasqm no
N'xsakra no benya nkwa.

Nnyeso
Hyqn t'robqnto, xwqmfo pa,
Esum mu ne awia mu;
Nyame hyq wo, ka asqm no!
Deduani bqde ne ho.

Hyqn no den mmepx atifi,
Esum mu ne awia mu;
Po bun no gye nkrasqm no so,
Nkwagye dwom a qyq dq.

Hyqn no wiram ne 'tempxn so
Sum mu nea 'kobxfo nam;
Hyqn no sq wxasiesie nnepa,
Agya no rehwq wxn kwan.

Hyqn ma wxn a wxasoa nnesoa
Abrq repq xhome;
Hyqn Agyenkwa frq dqdq a
Qka sq "Bra Me nkyqn" no.
songTWI:
Watchman, blow the gospel trumpet,
Every soul a warning give;
Whosoever hears the message
May repent, and, turn and live.

Refrain
Blow the trumpet, trusty watchman,
Blow it loud o'er land and sea;
God commissions, sound the message!
Every captive may be free.

Sound it loud o'er every hilltop,
Gloomy shade and sunny plain;
Ocean depths repeat the message,
Full salvation's glad refrain.

Sound it in the hedge and highway,
Earth's dark spots where exiles roam;
Let it tell all things are ready,
Father waits to welcome Index.

Sound it for the heavy laden,
Weary, longing to be free;
Sound a Savior's invitation,
Sweetly saying, "Come to me."

title:
Nnxbae No Bqba
Bringing in the Sheaves
songEN:
Yegu aba 'nxpa, yegu 'yamye aba,
Yegu no awiab're ne 'nwumm're bosum;
Yqtwqn otwa ne nnxbae anoboaboa b're,
Yqde ah'rusi de nnxbae no bqba.

Nnyeso
Nnxbae no bqba, nnxbae no bqba,
Yqde ah'rusi de nnxbae no bqba,
Nnxbae no bqba, nnxbae no bqba,
Yqde ah'rusi de nnxbae no bqba.

Yegu no 'wia ketee, gu no sunsuma mu,
N-suro mununkum anaa awxb're;
Qrenkyq na twab're no mu nnwuma asa
Yqde ah'rusi de nnxbae no bqba.

Yqde nusu regu ama Owura no,
Hwammxdi yqn 'kwaaba B'rč a yqn su to atwa
Yqde ah'rusi de nnxbae no bqba.
songTWI:
Sowing in the morning, sowing seeds of kindness,
Sowing in the noontide and the dewy eve;
Waiting for the harvest, and the time of reaping,
We shall come rejoicing bringing in sheaves.

Refrain
Bringing in the sheaves, Bringing in the sheaves,
We shall come rejoicing, Bringing in the sheaves;
Bringing in the sheaves, Bringing in the sheaves,
We shall come rejoicing, Bringing in the sheaves.

Sowing in the sunshine, sowing in the shadows,
Fearing neither clouds nor winter's chilling breeze;
By and by the harvest, and the labor ended,
We shall come rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves.

Going forth with weeping, sowing for the Master,
Though the loss sustained our spirit often grieves;
When our weeping's over, He will bid us welcome,
We shall come rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves.

title:
Yqto Kristo Ho Dwom
Christ for the World
songEN:
Yeto Kristo ho dwom
Yi No ky'rq wiase ny'naa
Wx nsiyq mu;
Wxn a wxn w'rq ahow
Wxn a wxso nnesoa
Na bxne hyq wxn so
Nya 'yaresa.


Yqto Kristo ho dwom
Yi No ky'rq wiase ny'naa
Wx mpaebx mu.
Wxn a wxayera na
Akxnnx ha wxn no
Wxatx wxn aboxden.
Afi sum mu.

Yqto Kristo ho dwom
Yi No ky'rq wiase ny'naa
Wx nnwonto mu;
Akra a wxagye wxn
Afi year kwan so,
Nya 'nidaso bqyq
Kristo de daa.
songTWI:
Christ for the world we sing,
the world to Christ we bring,
with loving zeal;
the poor, and them that mourn,
the faint and overborne,
sinsick and sorrow-worn,
whom Christ doth heal.

Christ for the world we sing,
the world to Christ we bring,
with fervent prayer;
the wayward and the lost,
by restless passions tossed,
redeemed at countless cost,
from dark despair.

Christ for the world we sing,
the world to Christ we bring,
with joyful song;
the newborn souls, whose days,
reclaimed from error's ways,
inspired with hope and praise,
to Christ belong.

title:
Ma No So
Lift Him Up
songEN:
Ma No so, Nyame na Xhyqw'
Nea xrewu nhwq nnya nkwa;
Xbqma nnebxn'yqfo a
Sukxm de wxn no nkwa nsu;
Ewom, Xbrqq Ne ho ase,
Nanso na Xyq 's'ro Hen,
"Nifraefo a wxte sum mu
Hu ade Yesu mogyam.

Nnyeso
Ma No so, 'Gyenkwá a Wasxre
Nea Xk'rxn sen obiara;
Ma No so, Xno na Xse
Wo sq guan fi bxne ho.

Ma No so, 'Gyenkwá a Xsom bo,
Ma amansan mmqhwq No;
Wxde xpq bqhwehwq No;
Xde wxn bqba Ne nkyqn;
Wxbqboaboa wxn ho ano
De 'nigye aba ntqm so,
Wxbqsoa Yesu asqnnua
Na wxahu nkwagye mu dqw.

Ma No so, N'anuonyam ny'naa mu,
Nyame Ba a Xwx s'ro;
Ma No so, Ne dx bqtwe wxn,
Agyegyentwi mpo bqba;
Ma wxnte asqnnua no ho
Asqm, 'nimguase 'wu no;
Ma tqkrqma biara nnye so;
Nnipadxm behy'ra Ne din.

Qnde ma No so nnwonto mu,
Ma 'Gyenkwa no so mpaebxm',
Xyq Gyefo 'nuonyamfo a
Xsoaa adasa bxn' ny'naa
Mmofra bqkoto N'anim na
Mpanyin ama wxn nne so;
Sotifo bqte hosana
Na mum ato N'ayeyi

title:
Wxn Nan Ase Yq Fq
How Beauteous Are Their Feet
songEN:
Wxn nan ase yq fq,
Wxn a wogy'na Sion
Bepx so ka nkwagye 'sqmpa
Yi asomdwoe ky'rq no.

Sqnea wxn nne yq dq,
Na nsqm no nso yq dq;
Sion, hwq wo Hen' 'Gyenkwa no,
Odi hen nkonim mu.

'Nigye hyq y'asom ma
B'rč a yqte dqw nnyigyei
A nhemfo ne 'diyifo twqn
Hwehwqe nso wxanhu no.

Nhyira ne yqn ani
A ehu s'ro hann yi;
'Diyifo ne nhemfo hwehwqe
Nso wxanhu de kxx 'wum.

Awqmfo ka wxn nne
Bom to dwom xdqw mu;
Yerusalem nso to nnwom ma
Anweatam di 'h'rusi.
songTWI:
How beauteous are their feet
Who stand on Zion's hill;
Who bring salvation on their tongues,
And words of peace reveal!

How charming is their voice,
So sweet the tidings are:
"Zion, behold thy Savior King;
He reigns and triumphs here!"

How happy are our ears,
That hear the joyful sound
Which kings and prophets waited for,
And sought, but never found!

How blessed are our eyes,
That see this heavenly light;
Prophets and kings desired it long,
But died without the sight!

The watchmen join their voice,
And tuneful notes employ;
Jerusalem breaks forth in songs,
And deserts learn the joy.

title:
Kxhwehwq Wxn Yiw
Seeking the Lost
songEN:
Kxhwehwq wxn, yiw, wxn a wxayera,
Wxn a wxafom kwan mmepx so no;
"Mommra Me nkyqn"; eyi ne Ne nkrasqm,
Ka Owura no nsqmpa yi nnq.

Nnyeso
Kx aky'rik'ri mmepx atifi
Fa akwantofo san bra fie.
Fa wxn bra me Gyefo no nguankuwm'
Guammaá a wxkum No maa bxne.

Kxhwehwq wxn, na kyerq wxn Yesu,
Mm'rqwyqfo ne komam yawdifo;
Di wxn anim kx nkwagye akwan so,
Na kyerq wxn kwan kx daa nkwa mu.

Saa na mqkx mmxb'rxhunu soma,
B're a midi Kristo akyi daa,
Rekyekye abrqfo w'rq ma wxn so,
Ky'rq 'kwantofo kwan kx Yesu nkyqn.
songTWI:
Seeking the lost yes, kindly entreating
Wanders on the mountain astray;
"Come unto Me," His message repeating,
Words of the Master speaking today.

Refrain
Going afar upon the mountain,
Bringing the wand'rer back again, back again,
Into the fold of my Redeemer,
Jesus, the Lamb for sinners slain, for sinners slain.

Seeking the lost and pointing to Jesus
Souls that are weak and hearts that are sore,
Leading them forth in ways of salvation,
Showing the path to life evermore.

Thus I would go on missions of mercy,
Following Christ from day unto day,
Cheering the faint and raising the fallen,
Pointing the lost to Jesus, the Way.

title:
Yesu, Ne W'asafo Ntra
Jesus, With Thy Church Abide
songEN:
Yesu, ne W'asafo ntra
Sq 'Gyenkwa, 'W'ra ne Hwqfo;
B'rč a wxresx no ahwq'i,
Yqsrq Wo sq tie yqn.

Ma ne nne mu nna hx daa,
N'xmmx 'temmu ho kxkx
Nka 'Gyenkwa no ho asqm;
Yqsrq Wo sq tie yqn.

Ma no nky'rq 'nifraefo kwan,
Xnhwehwq xyera mma,
Na xnsiesie komasqe;
Yqsrq Wo sq tie yqn.

Ma no nni nkonim kronkron
Wx bxne horow ny'naa so,
Na xmmoa aman ny'naá ano;
Yqsrq Wo sq tie yqn.
songTWI:
Jesus, with Thy church abide;
Be her Savior, Lord, and Guide,
While on earth her faith is tried:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

May her voice be ever clear,
Warning of a judgment near,
Telling of a Savior dear:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

May she guide the poor and blind,
Seek the lost until she find,
And the broken hearted bind:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

May she holy triumps win,
Overthrow the hosts of sin,
Gather all the nations in:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

title:
Yq 'Dwuma Ade Resa
Work, for the Night Is Coming
songEN:
Yq 'dwuma ade resa,
Yq 'dwuma anxpa;
B're a bosu regugu,
Yq 'dwuma nhw'ren mu
Yq 'dwuma b're a owia
Hy'rqn wx qda no mu;
Yq 'dwuma ade resa
'Ma nnipa apxn.

Yq 'dwuma ade resa,
Yq 'dwuma owia b're;
Yq 'dwuma wx b're pa mu,
Home bqba ntqm.
B're tiawa biara mu no,
Yq b'ribi pa bi sie;
Yq 'dwuma ade resa
'Ma nnipa apxn.

Yq 'dwuma ade resa,
Owia rekxtx yi;
Anwumm're wia rebx yi,
Yq na hann retwam';
Yq kosi b'rč a owia tx,
Na qrenhyerqn bio;
Yq 'dwuma na sum redu
Nnipa dwumá asa

title:
Ade Ny'naa WxW', Yenni 'Kyqde
All Things Are Thine

Wo Ne Kristo Nkx Anim
Go Forth, Go Forth With Christ
songTWI:
Go forth, go forth with Christ,
Who called you to this day,
He who has led, will lead
And keep you in His way:
His word is fast, His promise sure
To all who serve Him and endure.

Go forth, go forth with Christ,
With purpose not your own,
Each vict'ry you shall gain
Through Him your Lord alone:
To guard you in fidelity
His Spirit shall your strength'ner be.

Go forth, go forth with Christ,
His Priesthood you shall share,
Who bought us by His blood
To be His servants here:
Walk in the way your Savior trod,
Go forth with Him, go forth with God.

title:
'W'ra No Se: "Kxla M'asqmpa
Go, Preach My Gospel

Yqde 'Bofra Yi MaW'
We Give This Child to You
songEN:
Yqde 'bofra yi maW'
Yqn dx akyqde pa;
Ma yqnky'rq no anammxntu
Wx Wo s'ro 'kwanky'rq mu.

O, hy'ra Wo mmofra ny'naa
Na B'rč a wobenyin no,
Wxahu sq wxbqdx W'akwan
Afa ayq wxn de.

Yqde yqn ho ma Wo,
Ma Wo Honhom mmqhyq
Yqn koma ne yqn 'fie mu ma,
Na yqayq W'apqde.
songTWI:
We give this child to You,
Our precious gift of love.
Help us to lead each step aright
With guidance from above.

O bless each child of Yours,
And grant when they are grown,
They will have learned to love Your way,
And choose it for their own.

We give ourselves to You,
And may Your Spirit fill
Our hearts and Index, that all we do
Be subject to Your will.

title:
A Kwaaba, 'Index Da Pa!
Welcome, Day of Sweet Repose
songEN:
Akwaaba, 'home da pa!
Nhyira nka wo mm're kronkron!
Yqbqtwere Nea Onim
Yqn mmerqwyq ne sintx.

Akwaaba, Eden da pa!
'Hotefo home kronkron!
Ma wo mm're mmra yqn nkyqn bio,
Sq anxpa hann fqfq.

Akwaaba, dá a 'W'rade 'hy'ra,
Brq ne dadwen to betwa.
Da a N'asqm de 'si hx,
Ayeyi ne mpaebx da.

Akwaaba, da a 'Gyenkwan'
De yqq yqn trenee nhwqso.
Da a Nyame se yqnkae;
Nna mu dá a yqhy'ra Ne din.
songTWI:
Welcome, day of sweet repose!
Blessed be thy sacred hours!
We would trust the One who knows
All our weak and failing powers.

Welcome, day in Eden born!
Holy rest for sinless man!
Like the dawning of fair morn
Come thy hours to us again.

Welcome, day blessed by our Lord!
Toil shall cease and anxious care.
Day commanded by His word,
Day for song and praise and prayer.

Welcome, day our Savior kept!
Keeping, wrought our righteousness,
Day God bids us ne'er forget,
Day of days His name to bless.

title:
Indexda Yq Da Kronkron
Holy Sabbath Day of Rest
songEN:
Homeda yq da kronkron,
A yqn Wura ahy'ra so;
Xs'ro Nyame na Xyqe
De sii hx sq b're kronkron.

Nnyeso
Yiw, Xhome da kronkron,
A yqn Nyame ahy'ra so;
Qbqyq yqn sqnky'rqne,
Mmeresanten nyinaa mu.

N-hwehwq wiase 'nigye
Ne ne bxne akxnnx;
Nnepa bi wx hx ma wo,
Wx asu no agya hx.

B'rč a Homeda no rebqn,
Fiada 'nwumm're 'witxe no;
Kristofo nhyia wxn afim',
Nto dwom mmx mpae Yesu mu.

Mummisa No xgye dom
Ne mm'rikatun' mu nkonim;
Na Xmfa Ne tum' mmoa yqn,
Ma yqnyq kronn b're biara.
songTWI:
Holy Sabbath day of rest,
By our Master richly blest,
God created and divine,
Set aside for holy time.

Refrain
Yes, the holy Sabbath rest,
By our God divinely blest,
It to us a sign shall be
Throughout all eternity.

Seek not pleasures of this earth,
With its folly, noise, and mirth,
There are better things in store,
Over on the other shore.

As the Sabbath draweth on
Friday eve at set of sun,
Christian household then should meet,
Sing and pray at Jesus'feet.

Asking Him for saving grace,
Also vict'ry in the race,
And to help us by His pow'r,
To keep holy every hour.

title:
Anigye Ne Indexda
O Day of Rest and Gladness
songEN:
Anigye ne homeda,
O, xde ne hann da;
Aw'rqhow ano ad'ru,
Da a emu hyerqn.
Wo mu na nnipa nyinaa
Koto 'henguan' anim,
To kronkron, kronkron, kronkron,
Ma Tete Kwaframmoa.

Woyq beá a wxabx ho ban,
Ahum a etu mu;
Turo a Paradise,
N-subxnten sen hx;
Woyq nsunwini nsuti,
Xbra anwea yi so;
Yefi Wo mu, sq Pisga,
Hwq bxhyq 'sase no.

Dá a yenya mu nsusui pa,
Woyq xdx da pa;
Da a yqma yqn dx so
Fi ha dwen soro hx;
Yenya dom foforo daa,
Yqn homeda yi mu
Yqhwehwq homč a aka
Fi soro trabea hx.
songTWI:
O day of rest and gladness,
O day of joy and light,
O balm of care and sadness,
Most beautiful, most bright;
On thee, the high and lowly,
Who bend before the throne,
Sing, Holy, holy, holy,
To the Eternal One.

Thou art a port protected
From storms that round us rise,
A garden intersected
With streams of Paradise;
Thou art a cooling fountain
In life's dry, dreary sand;
From thee, like Pisgah's mountain,
We view our promised land.

A day of sweet reflection
Thou art, a day of love;
A day to raise affection
From earth to things above.
New graces ever gaining
From this our day of rest
We seek the rest remaining
In mansions of the blest.

title:
Anigye Ne Indexda
O Day of Rest and Gladness
songEN:
Anigye ne homeda,
O, xde ne hann da;
Aw'rqhow ano ad'ru,
Da a emu hyerqn.
Wo mu na nnipa nyinaa
Koto 'henguan' anim,
To kronkron, kronkron, kronkron,
Ma Tete Kwaframmoa.

Woyq beá a wxabx ho ban,
Ahum a etu mu;
Turo a Paradise,
N-subxnten sen hx;
Woyq nsunwini nsuti,
Xbra anwea yi so;
Yefi Wo mu, sq Pisga,
Hwq bxhyq 'sase no.

Dá a yenya mu nsusui pa,
Woyq xdx da pa;
Da a yqma yqn dx so
Fi ha dwen soro hx;
Yenya dom foforo daa,
Yqn homeda yi mu
Yqhwehwq homč a aka
Fi soro trabea hx.
songTWI:
O day of rest and gladness,
O day of joy and light,
O balm of care and sadness,
Most beautiful, most bright;
On thee, the high and lowly,
Who bend before the throne,
Sing, Holy, holy, holy,
To the Eternal One.

Thou art a port protected
From storms that round us rise,
A garden intersected
With streams of Paradise;
Thou art a cooling fountain
In life's dry, dreary sand;
From thee, like Pisgah's mountain,
We view our promised land.

A day of sweet reflection
Thou art, a day of love;
A day to raise affection
From earth to things above.
New graces ever gaining
From this our day of rest
We seek the rest remaining
In mansions of the blest.

title:
Dapqn Fof'ro Mu Nyame
Safely Through Another Week
songEN:
Dapqn fofro mu Nyame
Ahwq y'akwantu so dwoo;
Momma yqnhwehwq nhyira,
Yqretwqn Ne fie nnq yi;
Dapqn nyinaa mu da pa,
Daa home ho sqnky'rqnne.
Dapqn nyinaa mu da pa,
Daa home ho sqnky'rqnne.

B're a yqnam Dimafo
Din mu hwehwq xdom yi,
Fa W'aniim pa no ky'rq yqn,
Yi yqn bxn' ne fqre hx;
Gye yqn dadwen ne haw mu,
Ma yqnhome Wo mu nnq.
Gye yqn dadwen ne haw mu,
Ma yqnhome Wo mu nnq.

Yqsxre anxpa a,
Ma yqnte nka sq Wobqn;
Y'aba W'ahengua so yi,
Ma y'ani nhu W'anuonyam;
'Wura ma yqnka daapem
Aponto no nhwq wx ha.
'Wura ma yqnka daapem
Aponto no nhwq wx ha.

Ma 'sqmpa no ho 'nigye
Nni bxn' so nim, nkyekye w'rq;
Ma xdom aba nnxxso
Mfa 'hosan mma obiara;
Ma home nna ny'naa nyq saa,
Kosi sq yebedi hen;
Ma home nna ny'naa nyq saa,
Kosi sq yebedi hen'.
songTWI:
Safely through another week
God has brought us on our way;
Let us now a blessing seek,
Waiting in His courts today;
Day of all the week the best,
Emblem of eternal rest;
Day of all the week the best,
Emblem of eternal rest.

While we seek supplies of grace
Through the dear Redeemer's name,
Show Thy reconciling face,
Take away our sin and shame;
From our worldly cares set free
May we rest this day in Thee.
From our worldly cares set free
May we rest this day in Thee.

When the morn shall bid us rise,
May we feel Thy presence near,
May Thy glory meet our eyes
When we in Thy house appear;
Here afford us, Lord, a taste
Of our everlasting feast.
Here afford us, Lord, a taste
Of our everlasting feast.

May the gospel's joyful sound
Conquer sinners, comfort saints;
Make the fruits of grace abound,
Bring relief to all complaints;
Thus may all our Sabbaths be
Till we rise to reign with Thee.
Thus may all our Sabbaths be
Till we rise to reign with Thee.

title:
A Debx Mu Xbohemma
Crowning Jewel of Creation
songEN:
Adebx mu xbohemma
A wxahy'ra so atew ho,
Qtra mm're ne nsakrae nyinaa
Wxde ma yqn 'nuonyam mu.

Nnyeso
Dá a wxahy'ra ama 'nipa,
Xbxadeq nsam akyqde.

Bxne, yare, mpaebx ne 'su
To twa wiase awiei b'rem';
Nso Wo Homeda tim hx daa.
Yqde dqw da Wo ase.

'W'ra, ahum ne awiam, ky'rq yqn
Sqnea yqhome Wo mu,
Wo Homeda mu asomdwoe
Ntwa yqn ho nhyia daa nyinaa.
songTWI:
Crowning jewel of creation,
Blest and hallowed, sanctified;
Time and changes all transcending,
Shared forever, glorified.

Refrain
Blessed Sabbath made for man,
Gift from the Creator's hand.

Sin and sickness, prayer and weeping
Cease at close of earthly days;
But Thy Sabbath is eternal,
Joyful thanks to Thee we raise!

Teach us Lord, in storm or sunshine
How to truly rest in Thee,
May Thy Sabbath peace enfold us
And our shelter ever be.

title:
Wxtoo Dwom Kronkron No
The Sacred Anthem
songEN:
Wxtoo dwom kronkron no brqoo wx
Ayeyi nsase so;
B'rč a wxyqq Homeda de wiee
Adebx nyinaa no.
B'rč a adasamma
Ne Nyame nantew no wonya
Homeda no mu nhy'ra,
Na wiase fqfq nom, wohu
Sq Nyame nnwuma yq.

Seesei a yqn nkwa rehi yi,
Nkekae wx yqn nnwontom',
'Sase atete apansam
Yqn nnwuma ny'naa nkx yie;
Nanso yqn som mu,
B'rč a yqka bom ayeyi mu
Nya Homeda nhy'ra no,
Yqto yqn sųro ne 'kyinnye gu
Tra Nyame home mu.

Homeda W'ra a Xkata
B're ne beae so hwehwq
Fofroyq ma 'sasč a abrq,
Ne 'yar'sa ma yqn haw.
Koma bedi dqw;
Osu ny'naa to betwa b're a
Yebehu yqn ho no;
Yqne xgye mma bqto dwom
Atwa 'hengua no ho.
songTWI:
The sacred anthem slowly rang
Across the fields of praise,
When earth's first Sabbath made complete
All creatures and all days.
Walking with God, there,
Woman and man together share
The blessed Sabbath mood;
And in that green and golden world
Know all God's works are good.

But now in our diminished lives
We sing a blemished song;
The earth is worn and disarrayed
And all our work goes wrong.
Still in our worship,
Joining in praise and fellowship,
By Sabbath radiance blessed,
We put our doubt and fear away
And rest within God's rest.

And arching over time and space
The Lord of Sabbaths wills
Renewal for the weary earth
And healing for our ills.
Hearts will rejoice then;
There will be no more weeping, when
We know and shall be known.
With hosts of the redeemed we'll sing
Around God's shining throne.

title:
Xhome Da, Fa 'Somdwoe
Come, O Sabbath Day
songEN:
Xhome da, fa 'somdwoe
Ne ayaresa brq yqn;
Ka xsoro asqm ky'rq
Kra a haw 'hyq no ma sq:
"Bqhome, bqhome!"

Ma fam akxnnx to ntwa,
Na dum xhaw gya nyinaa;
Ka soro nsqm ky'rq wxn a
Wxafom kwan, so nnesoa sq:
"Bqhome, bqhome!"

Popa 'niwam nusu ny'naa,
Ma haw ne ehu to ntwa;
Ade ny'naa reyq yie no,
Ky'rq yqn s'ro nsqm a qse:
"Bqhome, bqhome!"
songTWI:
Peace and healing on thy wing;
And to every troubled breast
Speak of the divine behest:
Thou shalt rest, Thou shalt rest!

Earthly longings bid retire,
Quench the passions' hurtful fire;
To the wayward, sin oppressed,
Bring thou thy divine behest:
Thou shalt rest, Thou shalt rest!

Wipe from every cheek the tear,
Banish care and silence fear;
All things working for the best,
Teach us the divine behest:
Thou shalt rest, Thou shalt rest!

title:
Mma Mo W'rq Mfi Hom'da
Don't Forget the Sabbath
songEN:
Mma mo w'rq mfi Hom'da
A Nyame ahy'ra,
Dapqn mu da a qhy'rqn,
Dapqn mu da pa ni.
Qma home fi nnwumam',
Qka s'ro dqw kyerq;
Ne hann nhy'rqma fi soro
Hy'rqn wx ahoxfq mu.

Nnyeso
'Kwaaba, 'kwaaba, daa akwaaba.
Homedā a wxahy'ra;
'Kwaaba, 'kwaaba, daa akwaaba,
Homedā a wxahy'ra.

Munsie Homeda no
Kronkron na nnq monsom
Nea Xsee N'asuafo sq:
"Mene n-kwa kwan no".
Sq yefi xdwo mu di
'Gyenkwan' akyi fam há a,
Xbqma yqanom nsutė a
Daa nkwa sen' fi mu no.

Anigye kronkron da,
Yebedi ne mm're pan'
Wx 'seda nnwontom' ama
Yesu, mmofra yxnko;
O Agyenkwa dxfo pa,
Sqnea W'ayamye te;
Wo bxhyq pa no ky'rq sq,
Wobqtra yqn komam'.
songTWI:
Don't forget the Sabbath,
The Lord our God hath blest,
Of all the week the brightest,
Of all the week the best;
It brings repose from labor,
It tells of joy divine,
Its beams of light descending,
With heavenly beauty shine.

Refrain
Welcome, welcome, ever welcome,
Blessed Sabbath day,
Welcome, welcome, ever welcome,
Blessed Sabbath day.

Keep the Sabbath holy,
And worship Him today,
Who said to His disciples,
"I am the living way;"
And if we meekly follow
Our Savior here below,
He'll give us of the fountain
Whose streams eternal flow.

Day of sacred pleasure!
Its golden hours we'll spend
In thankful hymns to Jesus,
The children's dearest Friend;
O gentle loving, Savior,
How good and kind Thou art,
How precious is Thy promise
To dwell in every heart!

title:
Hann Mu Hann, Bqkanyan Me
Light of Light, Enlighten Me
songTWI:
Light of light, enlighten me,
Now anew the day is dawning;
Sun of grace, the shadows flee;
Brighten Thou my Sabbath morning;
With Thy joyous sunshine blest,
Happy is my day of rest.

Let me with my heart today,
Holy, holy, holy, singing,
Rapt awhile from earth away,
All my soul to Thee up springing,
Have a foretaste inward given
How they worship Thee in heaven.

Hence all care, all vanity!
For the day to God is holy;
Come, Thou glorious Majesty,
Deign to fill this temple lowly;
Nought today my soul shall move,
Simply resting in Thy love.

title:
'W'ra YqdxW' Homeda
We Love Thy Sabbath, Lord
songEN:
'W'ra yqdxW' Homeda,
Som Wo sqnea Wopq;
O ma saa b're yi nyq 'somdwoe,
Na to yqn gyidi mu.

W'abxfo de 'nigye
Hwqq W'adebx too dwom.
Nnq yqn nso ma yqn koma so
De ayeyi ma Wo.

Nnaase nka Wo dx a
Qyqq da yi kronkron,
Sqnky'rqnnč a qma 'biara hu
Sq Wo na yqdan Wo.

Xbxadeq 'Hhenkqse,
Fa Wo gye dom pa no
Yq yqn koma fofro tew ho,
Na ma yenhu W'anim.

Na yqne 'hotefo
Hyia Sion bepx sō a,
Yqato Homeda dwom 'nigyem
Mfesanten nyinaa mu.
songTWI:
We love Thy Sabbath, Lord,
And worship at Thy will;
Oh may these hours sweet peace afford
And deeper faith instill.

Thine angels sang for joy
Creation's work to see;
We too, this day, would raise our hearts
In grateful praise to Thee.

Praise for Thy wondrous love,
That sealed this sacred day,
A sign that all may understand
We own Thy sovereign sway.

O great Creator King,
Through Thy redeeming grace,
Renew and sanctify our hearts
That we may see Thy face.

And with the whiterobed throng,
Upon Mount Sion be,
And joyful sing our Sabbath song
Through all eternity.

title:
A Kwaaba, XIndex Da
Welcome, Welcome, Day of Rest
songEN:
Akwaaba, xhome da,
Wxde kyqq adasa kwa;
Megyew' xdwo koma yim'
Sq hann a efi s'ro hy'rqn.

Xdqw ne xhome da,
Wo mmere resen brqoo yi;
Dwudwo yqn haw ne mmusu,
Kosi sq yqn b'rq bqsa.

Da Kronkron, wo bo yq den,
Ayeyi ne mpaebx da;
Dá a qky'rq nkwasea nyansa,
Wo nhy'ra dxxso dqn ara!

Akwaaba, xhome da,
Xs'ro tumi kawo ho;
Nhyira nka wo mm're kronkron,
Mma me komá a qretwqn.
songTWI:
Welcome, Welcome, Day of Rest
To the world in kindness given;
Welcome to this humble breast,
As the beaming light from heaven.

Day of calm and sweet repose,
Gently now thy moments run;
Balm to soothe our cares and woes,
Till our labor here is done.

Holy day that most we prize,
Day of solemn praise and prayer,
Day to make the simple wise,
O, how great thy blessings are!

Welcome, welcome, day of rest,
With thy influence all divine;
May thy hallowed hours be blessed
to this waiting heart of mine.

title:
'Wura, Yqaba Ha Owitxe
Dear Lord, We Come at Set of Sun
songEN:
'Wura, yqaba ha owitxe
BqkotoW' nan ase,
Som Wo, Xhen' a Xbxx ade,
Dá a Woasx ano yi.

Yegyaa 'sase so nnwuma mu
Sqnea W'asqm ky'rq no;
Yqhyqn Wo home kronkron no,
'W'rade Homeda nom!

Dqw da, wo mm're kronkron te sq
Sika nkxnsxnkxnsxn
A efi Eden 'pon ano
Kyerq yqn fie kwan bio.

B'rč a wxbqyq 'sase'i fofro
Asqe bxn' ne 'wu no,
Homeda biara xgye mma
Beyi Nyame ayq.
songTWI:
Dear Lord, we come at set of sun,
And at Your feet we kneel
To worship You, Creator, King,
This day, Your sign and seal.

Our earthly tasks we lay aside,
According to Your Word,
To enter now Your holy rest,
The Sabbath of the Lord.

Sweet Sabbath rest, your sacred hours
Are as a golden chain
That reaches back to Eden's gate
And points us Index again.

And when this earth shall be renewed,
And sin and death destroyed,
Shall all redeemed each Sabbath day
Still meet to praise their God.

title:
Homeda Ne Ne Hann Wura
Lord of the Sabbath
songEN:
Homeda ne ne hann Wura,
Mebx Wo da kronkron no se;
Me kra brqfo anigyede,
Me komá a 'bubu w'rqkyekye;
Me komá a 'bubu w'rqkyekye.

'Somdwoe, ne nigye da kronkron,
Wo mmere ho hia ma me daa;
Mma bxne adwen biara nsqe
Wo mu 'somdwoe a minya no;
Wo mu 'somdwoe a minya no.

Dqw bqn ara na wxde sen!
Kommyq kronkron n'efi wxn mu!
Wxn dwom dqdq no fro kx s'ro,
Qte sq s'ro 'nisoadehu,
Qte sq s'ro 'nisoadehu.

Yesu, ma memmx Wo se daa,
W'anim wx homeda yi mu;
Na W'akoa adwen daa sq Wo
Homeda yq nhyira mmxho,
Homeda yq nhyira mmxho.
songTWI:
Lord of the Sabbath and its light,
I hail Thy hallowed day of rest;
It is my weary soul's delight,
The solace of my careworn breast,
The solace of my careworn breast.

O sacred day of peace and joy,
Thy hours are ever dear to me;
Ne'er may a sinful thought destroy
The holy calm I find in thee,
The holy calm I find in thee.

How sweetly now they glide along!
How hallowed is the calm they yield!
Transporting is their rapturous song,
And heavenly visions seem revealed,
And heavenly visions seem revealed.

O Jesus, let me ever hail
Thy presence with the day of rest;
Then will Thy servant never fail
To deem Thy Sabbath doubly blest,
To deem Thy Sabbath doubly blest.

title:
Yegyaw Haw Ny'naa Hy'ra
Far From All Care
songTWI:
Far from all care we hail the Sabbath morning;
O'er waving fields and from the distant sea
Swell notes of praise in harmony resounding
As all creation turns her heart to Thee.

Though man alone, Lord, of Thy great creation
Fails now to laud Thee for Thy love and power,
Yet still a remnant love Thee and remember
Thy holy law and each sweet Sabbath hour.

Lord of the Sabbath, Savior and Creator,
Calm now the throbbings of each troubled breast.
Speak to our hearts the peace of Thy commandments,
Breathe on each soul fair Eden's hallowed ret.

Strong in Thy might and quiet in Thy meekness,
May we Thine image bear from day to day.
Then may we enter pearly gates eternal
And sing redemption's song each Sabbath day.

title:
Sqnea Nnomaa Guan Awx Ne Wim a
As Birds Unto the Genial Indexland
songEN:
Sqnea nnomaa guan awx ne wim a
Ayq tumm kx wxn ahotx fie no,
Sa'ra na me kra hwehwq W'anim dom,
Nya xhome ne asomdwoe Wo mu.

Yegyaw yqn haw mu ko ny'naa W'asxr'fie,
Yqnkae huammmxdi, nusu, ne yaw bio,
Yqnam 'nidaso nnwom ne mpaebx mu
Na yqsxre te Wo Honhom no nka.

Hy'ra wxn a 'nadwo yi wxwx yaw mu;
Wxn a wxso nnesoa, wxatx beraw
Ma W'aw'rqkyekye nka w'rqhowdifo,
Na boa wxn a 'hiade hyq wxn so no.

Homeda dqw, bqhyq koma ny'naa ma;
Na ma asomdwoe pa ntra yqn afim;
Ma 'yeyi nnwom nhyq koma biara ma
Na wxmfa wxn ho nhyq Nyame dx mu.
songTWI:
As birds unto the genial Indexland fly,
The winter's cold and low'ring skies to flee,
So seeks my soul Thy gracious presence here
And finds, O God, its rest and peace in Thee.

Here at Thy shrine we leave all vexing care,
For get the disappointment, grief and tear,
And on the wings of hopeful song and prayer
We rise, and rising feel Thy Spirit here.

Bless all who spend this night in pain and woe,
The burdened heart, the fainting, and distressed,
Thy comfort send to darkened Indexs bereaved,
Thy saving help to those by want oppressed.

Come, Sabbath joy, each trusting heart now fill,
And blissful peace within our Indexs abide,
May thankful praise each grateful heart now thrill,
And to God's loving care their lives confide.

title:
'Wura, Wo Dx Afrq Yqn Ha
Look, You Saints! the Sight Is Glorious
songEN:
'Wura, Wo dx afrq yqn ha;
Sqnea Wobxx yqn maa dx no,
Yqda so kura Wo suban;
Qwom 'soxden nti yqasqe de,
Yqde yqn koma ny'naa aba,
Rebetie Wo anya Wo dx.

Yaw a yede aba yqn so
Wx asoxden ne mfomso mu;
Yqn mu mpoky'rq a akyeky're yqn,
'Setram' nhyqsodč a qha yqn,
Nhyehyqe a qfa yqn nnommum
Yqaba 'bqhwehwq 'nidaso.

'Wura, Wofrq yqn Kristo mu,
Wogye yqn yq W'ankasa de
Qnyq sq yqfata ntira,
Na mmom W'adxe nkutoo no nti.
Yqp're hwq Wo dom agua no
B're a yqakoto W'anim no.

Fa mpopaho, bubu bodoo,
Brq yqn ase frq yqn nnamfo.
Som yqn kosi sq yqbqmee.
Na ky'rq sqnea dx hwehwq sq
Qbqyq 'dwuma ma 'bxde
De dwonto ahyq wiase ma.

'Wura, Woyq yqn adehye
Kristom' sq yqbqbx Wo bra.
Ma yqn Wo Honhom 'hofadi
Ma yqnnan mfi afodi mu,
Mfa gyidi nyq nea yebetum'
B'rč a 'dx yq nneqma ny'naa fof'ro.
songTWI:
Look, you saints, the sight is glorious,
See the Man of sorrows now;
From the fight returned victorious,
Every knee to Him shall bow.
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
Crowns become the victor's brow.
Crowns become the victor's brow.

Crown the Savior! angels crown Him!
Rich the trophies Jesus brings;
On the seat of power enthrone Him
While the vault of heaven rings.
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
Crown the Savior, King of Kings.
Crown the Savior, King of Kings.

Sinners in derision crowned Him,
Mocking thus the Savior's claim;
Saints and angels crowd around Him,
Own His title, praise His name.
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
Spread abroad the victor's fame!
Spread abroad the victor's fame!

Hark! those bursts of acclamation!
Hark! those loud triumphant chords!
Jesus takes the highest station;
Oh, what joy the sight affords!
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!
King of kings and Lord of lords!
King of kings and Lord of lords!

title:
A Bans'ro Na Yqn Wura Siesie
All Who Love and Serve Your City
songEN:
Abans'ro na yqn Wura siesie
Maa N'adxfo kosi awiei;
N'asuafo da so hyia hx de kae
Wxn 'Damfo a Wasxre no.

Adidi n' akyi no Xhoho'roo
Wxn nan ho sq 'som kronkronne;
Yqn 'nigye wie pqyq wx Ne mu
Sq yqnkxsom sq Xyqe no.

Yesu de 'kyqde maa Ne de sq
Wxnkyq Ne honam ne mogya;
Nnesoa biará a qbrq yqn asen'
Xnam 'sqnnuan' so ma yqn so.

Qnso hx ara; yqtetem' 'somdwoem',
Xdx yqn ma no boro so;
Dan biará a qwx y'Agya fie no,
Xbqtra hx sq Ofiew'ra.
songTWI:
All who love and serve your city,
All who bear its daily stress,
All who cry for peace and justice,
All who curse and all who bless.

In your day of loss and sorrow,
In your day of helpless strife,
Honor, peace, and love retreating,
Seek the Lord, who is your life.

For all days are days of judgment,
And the Lord is waiting still,
Drawing near His friends who spurn Him,
Off'ring peace from Calv'ry's hill.

Risen Lord, shall yet the city
Be the city of despair?
Come today, our judge, our glory;
Be its name "The Lord is there!"

title:
Wxabubu Wiase Paanoo
Bread of the World
songEN:
Wxabubu wiase paanoo 'dom mu,
Wxahwie xkra no nsa 'dom mu;
Nea wxnam Ne so de nkwasqm mae
Na yqn bxne wu Ne wum' no.

Hwq koma a yaw abubu no.
Hwq nusu a bxn'yqfo kyi;
Na ma W'aponto no nyq nkaede
Na yqn krá amee Wo dom mu.
    Amen.
songTWI:
Bread of the world in mercy broken,
Wine of the soul in mercy shed,
By whom the words of life are spoken,
And in whose death our sins are dead;

Look on the heart by sorrow broken,
Look on the tears by sinners shed;
And be Thy feast to us the token
That by Thy grace our souls are fed. Amen.

title:
Aniso Amanne Yim' Na
Beneath the Forms of Outward Rite
songEN:
Aniso Amanne Yim' Na
'W'ra, wxde W'aduan no
Kx abans'ro dan biara mu,
Nea wxma 'kra aduan.

Wxate paanoon' ho b're biara,
Sq adasamma nkyq;
Na onuadx nneyqe biara
Frq W'aponto no bio.

Wxde nhyira k'ruwa no yq
Wo nokware nkaede:
B'rč a wxde 'bra fof'ro hwie nsa
Wx mudi pa mu no.

'W'ra, ma nsohyqdč a yqwx yi
Nyq nea Wode ama;
Na yqn daa 'brabx akanyan
Wo mmxb'rxhun' koma.
songTWI:
Beneath the forms of outward rite
Thy supper, Lord, is spread
In every quiet upper room
Where fainting souls are fed.

The bread is always consecrate
Which men divide with men;
And every act of brotherhood
Repeats Thy feast again.

The blessed cup is only passed
True memory of Thee,
When life anew pours out its wine
With rich sufficiency.

O Master, through these symbols shared,
Thine own dear self impart,
That in our daily life may flame
The passion of Thy heart.

title:
Mede Dqw Rebehyia Me W'ra
I Come With Joy
songEN:
Mede dqw rebehyia me W'ra,
Fafri ne xdx mu.
Mede 'hodw'riw bqkae Ne nkwá a
Xde too hx maa me.
Xde too hx maa me.

Me ne Kristofo ny'naa reba
Abehu nokwar' dx
Ayxnkofa b'rč a yqredi
Kristo mu paanoo no.
Kristo mu paanoo no.

Sq Kristo ma yqn paanoo a,
Mpaapaemu ny'naa to twa;
'Dx a qbxx yqn no ka yqn bom,
Na 'hxho yq nnamfo.
Na 'hxho yq nnamfo.

Saa na yqde dqw hyia yqn W'ra,
Xbqn yqn b're biara,
Wx saa 'yxnkofa pa yi mu;
Yehu No kamfo No,
Yehu No kamfo No.

Yqahyia mu wx nkabom pa mu,
Yebedi ntetemu,
Na yqyq Ne nk'rxfo wiase;
Yqbqto N'ayeyi.
Yqbqto N'ayeyi.
songTWI:
I come with joy to meet my Lord,
Forgiven, loved and free,
In awe and wonder to recall
His life laid down for me,
His life laid down for me.

I come with Christians far and near
To find, as all are fed,
Our true community of love
In Christ's communion bread,
In Christ's communion bread.

As Christ breaks bread for us to share
Each proud division ends.
That love that made us makes us one,
And strangers now are friends,
And strangers now are friends.

And thus with joy we meet our Lord.
His presence always near,
Is in such friendship better known:
We see and praise Him here,
We see and praise Him here.

Together met, together bound,
We'll go our diff'rent ways,
And as His people in the world,
We'll live and speak His praise,
We'll live and speak His praise.

title:
Yqreyq Saa Xsom Yi Bio
In Imitation, Lord, of Thee
songEN:
Yqreyq saa xsom yi bio,
Sqnea, Aw'rade, Woyqe no;
'Fisq Wo dom nhwqsopa no
De dqw aba dwumadi yim'.

Sx 'dx biara ano fofro,
Ma gyaframa kronkron no nsx;
Na ma yqn koma nnya nkabom,
B'č a yqyq no Yesu din mu.

Woyq nhwqso kqse ma yqn,
Sq Wohoh'roo 'suafon' nan ho;
Yqredi W'ahyqde so yi,
Ma yqn 'yxnkofa nwie mudi.
songTWI:
In imitation, Lord, of Thee,
This solemn service we repeat;
For Thine example full of grace,
Has made this humble duty sweet.

Renew each sacred spark of love,
And vitalize the holy flame;
May union strong our hearts unite
While this we do in Jesus' name.

Our great example Thou shalt be,
In washing Thy disciples feet;
And as we follow Thy command,
Make Thou our fellowship complete.

title:
Yqnam Kristom Fofroyq Ne
By Christ Redeemed
songEN:
Yqnam Kristom fof'royq ne
Xgye so kamfo nkaede yi,
De ky'rq Aw'rade no wu
Kosi Ne mmae.

Ne honam a wxabubu no,
Yehu wx paanoo nkaede yim';
Qnam saa so ma yqn dx mee
Kosi Ne mmae.

Yehu Ne yawdi kqse ne
Ne mogyá a Ohwie gu maa yqn;
Nsa no bqka 'hintasqm no
Kosi Ne mmae.

Yqkae 'nadwo a woyii No
Mae, nam som yi so kae mmae no,
Aniwu ne 'nuonyam no bom
Kosi Ne mmae.
songTWI:
By Christ redeemed, In Christ restored,
We keep the memory adored,
And show the death of our dear Lord,
Until He come.

His broken body in our stead Is here,
In this memorial bread;
And so our feeble love is fed,
Until He come.

His fearful drops of agony,
His life blood shed for us we see;
The wine shall tell the mystery,
Until He come.

And thus that dark betrayal night,
With the last advent unite—
The shame, the glory, by this rite,
Until He come.

title:
Momma Yqmmom Nkoto
Let Us Break Bread Together
songEN:
Momma yqmmom nkoto
     mmubu 'bodoo,
Momma yqmmom nkoto
     mmubu 'bodoo.

Nnyeso
Sq mibu nkotodwe
De m'anim ky'rq owipuei a,
Aw'rade, hu me mmxbx.

Momma yqmmom nkoto
     nnom bobesa,
Momma yqmmom nkoto
     nnom bobesa.

Momma yqmmom nkoto
     nyi Nyame ayq,
Momma yqmmom nkoto
     nyi Nyame ayq.
songTWI:
When I fall on my knees,
With my face to the rising sun,
Lord, have mercy on me.

Refrain
Let us drink wine together on our knees;
Let us drink wine together on our knees.

When I fall on my knees,
With my face to the rising sun,
Lord, have mercy on me.

When I fall on my knees,
With my face to the rising sun,
Lord, have mercy on me.

title:
Momma Yqnsxr' Mfi Pon Yi Ho
Now Let Us From This Table Rise
songEN:
Momma yqnsxr' mfi pon yi ho,
Honam, kra nč adwen fof'royem;
Yqne Kristo wu san sxr' bio,
Ned x no ma yewie mudi.

B're a yqnam dom so ayq
Krado trqw 'sqmpa no mu yi,
Yedi Kristo 'nammxn akyi
'Nidaso ne 'hiade k'ro mu.

'Dx a yqde bqhyq fie biaram'
Yq xsom ahiade kronkron
Dwumā a Kristo fii ase no,
Yqde 'hobrqase bqtoa so.

Qnde Agya, hyq yqn den ma
Yqmpaw 'kwantufo kwan no bio,
Na boa ma yqmfa 'nigye nnye
Nea xkyena wx ma yqn no.
songTWI:
Now let us from this table rise
Renewed in body, mind, and soul;
With Christ we die and live again,
His selfless love has made us whole.

With minds alert, upheld by grace,
To spread the word in speech and deed,
We follow in the steps of Christ,
At one with all in hope and need.

To fill each human house with love,
It is the sacrament of care;
The work that Christ began to do
We humbly pledge ourselves to share.

Then grant us courage, Father God,
To choose again the pilgrim way
And help us to accept with joy
The challenge of tomorrow's day.

title:
Nyame a Wonhu Wo Nso Wobqn
O God, Unseen, Yet Ever Near
songEN:
Nyame a wonhu Wo nso Wobqn,
Yi Wo hō adi seesei;
B'rč a yqde dx a suro nnim
Koto W'anuonyam no.

Ma Wo nkurxfo nokwafo
Nhu Wo dx mu nhy'ra ha;
Nsuten a qsen sare so,
Mana a efi s'ro.

W'asqm ho setieyem' yqaba
Rebedi s'ro aduan;
'W'rade honam ne yqn aduan,
Ne mogya ne yqn nsa.

Ma yqnyq W'asqm ho setie,
'Fisq yqwxW', Nyame;
Na yqmfa anigye mfi ha
Xs'ro fof'royq mu.
songTWI:
O God, unseen, yet ever near,
Reveal Thy presence now
While we in love that hath no fear,
Before Thy glory bow.

Here may Thy faithful people know
The blessings of Thy love,
The streams that thro' the dessert flow,
The manna from above.

We come, obedient to Thy Word
To feast on heav'nly food,
Our meat, the body of our Lord,
Our drink, His precious blood.

Thus may we all Thy words obey,
For we, O God, are Thine,
And go rejoicing on our way,
Renewed by strength divine.

title:
'Dx Tew 'Hobrease Ne Adxe
Love Consecrates the Humblest Act
songEN:
'Dx tew 'hobrqase ne adxe
Dwumadi nyinaa ho.
Ehwie nhy'ra gu adasa so
Tew wxn ahiade ho.

B'rč a Kristo rebqn 'sqnnua no,
Xkoto hohoroo
Asuafo no nan ho de yqq
'Dx sqnky'rqnne maa yqn.

Xdx de xpe na qsom;
Nea Kristo nam dx so
Ayq ama yqn ny'naa momma
Yqmfa anigye nyq.
songTWI:
Love consecrates the humblest act
And haloes mercy's deeds;
It sheds a benediction sweet
And hallows human needs.

When in the shadow of the cross
Christ knelt and washed the feet
Of His disciples, He gave us
A sign of love complete.

Love serves and willing, stoops to serve;
What Christ in love so true
Has freely done for one and all,
Let us now gladly do!

title:
B'rč a Nyame Mma De Ne
Sent Forth by God's Blessing
songEN:
B'rč a Nyame mma de Ne
Nhy'ra apxn no, wxde
Nokware gyidi fi Ne trabea hx kx.
'Didi no abá awiei, Ma saa som yi aba
No bi nkodu agyidifo nyinaa so.
Ne nky'rqky'rq aba a Akra 'tiefo nya no
Bedi dwuma 'ma Nyame ne obiara.
Ne dom to nsa frq yqn, Ned x ka yqn bom ma
Yqyq adwuma ma Nyame 'henni no.

Yqde ayeyi ne Nnaase bqma Nyame
De ahyia yqn daa asetram dwumadi.
Yqkyq yqn gyidi no, Yi xdx adi ky'rq
De yq Ne mma a wxwx mmaa ny'naa atuu.
Woma yqn aduan di,
Fa Wo hann ky'rq yqn kwan;
Ka yqn bom yq yqn k'ro wx saa nkwa yi mu.
Saa na 'teasefo ny'naa De nkamfo ne nnaase
Bqhyq Kristo ne Ne din no anuonyam.
songTWI:
Sent forth by God's blessing, Our true faith confessing,
The people of God from His dwelling take leave.
The supper is ended. Oh, now be extended
The fruits of this service in all who believe.
The seed of His teaching, Receptive souls reaching,
Shall blossom in action for God and for all.
His grace did invite us, His love shall unite us
To work for God's kingdom and answer His call.

With praise and thanks giving To God ever living,
The tasks of our everyday life we will face.
Our faith ever sharing, In love ever caring,
Embracing His children of each tribe and race.
With Your feast You feed us, With Your light now lead us;
Unite us as one in this life that we share.
Then may all the living With praise and thanks giving
Give honor to Christ and His name that we bear.

title:
'W'rá a Wudi Hen S'ro 'Nuonyam Mu
Lord, Enthroned in Heavenly Splendor
songEN:
'W'rá a Wudi hen s'ro 'nuonyam mu,
Wō a Wudii kan nyan fii wum',
Wo nkutoo ne yqn banbxfō a
Wama Wo mma so wx s'ro; Haleluya!
Yesu, nokwar' nkwa 'bodoo.

Yehu Wo 'hobrqase tebeam
Sq Betlehem hx de no,
W'abxfo bxW' 'se ha sq hx;
Wo, Yisai aseni no. Haleluya!
Yqne wxn ka bom som Wo.

Nyame 'Guammaa, W'afxre no
Dii mu b'rč a wokum Wo no;
Qyq 'fxre a ne mudi
Bqkx so atra hx daa, Haleluya!
Ahoh'ro akra bxne.

Xs'ro mana a woma nkwa,
Botan a nsu fi mu pue;
S'ro ne 'sase to hosana
Som Wo, 'Guammaa a Wuwui no;
Haleluya! Woasxr' kx s'ro 'nuonyam mu.
songTWI:
Lord, enthroned in heav'nly splendor,
First begotten from the dead,
You alone, our strong defender,
Lifting up Your people's head.
Alleluia, Jesus, true and living Bread!

Tho' the lowliest form now veil You
As of old in Bethlehem,
Here as there Your angels hail You
Branch and flow'r of Jesse's stem.
Alleluia, We in worship join with them.

Paschal Lamb, Your off'ring finished
Once for all when You were slain,
In its fullness undiminished
Shall forever more remain.
Alleluia, Cleansing souls from every stain.

Life imparting heav'nly manna,
Stricken rock with streaming side,
Heav'n and earth with loud hosanna
Worship You the Lamb who died.
Alleluia, Ris'n, ascended, glorified!

title:
Yesu Frq 'Hotefo
Jesus Invites His Saints
songEN:
Yesu frq 'hotefo
Sq wommehyia N'anim,
Mmedidi mfa nkae wxn W'ra no
Wu ne N'amanehun'.

Yqfa 'bodoo ne nsa
Sq Wow u ho agy'rae;
'W'ra, ma yqn kra so ma yqmfa
Gyidi nniW' honam no.

Yqdi nkwa 'bodoo no
Nom nkwa nsa no gyidim.
Gyidi hwq tra ha 'p'rep're yi
Ka yqne Boben' bom.

'Nadwo yi retwam kx,
Yqn W'ra bqsan aba;
'Guammaan' 'yefrohyia 'ponto no
Bqhyq N'ahenni ase.
songTWI:
Jesus invites His saints
To meet around His board,
And sup in memory of the death
And sufferings of their Lord.

We take the bread and wine
As emblems of Thy death;
Lord, raise our souls above the sign,
To feast on Thee by faith.

Faith eats the bread of life,
And drinks the living wine;
It looks beyond this scene of strife
Unites us to the Vine.

Soon shall the night be gone,
Our Lord will come again;
The marriage supper of the Lamb
Will usher in His reign.

title:
'W'ra, 'Bodoo a Yebubu Yi
Thy Broken Body, Gracious Lord
songTWI:
Thy broken body, gracious Lord,
Is shadowed by this broken bread;
The wine which in this cup is poured,
Points to the blood which Thou hast shed.

And while we meet together thus,
We show that we are one in Thee;
Thy precious blood was shed for us,
Thy death, O Lord, hast set us free!

We have one hope that Thou wilt come,
Thee in the air we wait to see;
When Thou wilt give Thy saints a Index,
And we shall ever reign with Thee.

title:
Kamfo Nyame Ba No
The Son of God Proclaim
songEN:
Kamfo Nyame Ba no,
B're ne beae Wura no,
Nyame a Xmaa hann bae no,
Hy'rqn Yesų anim seesei.

Hwq nsa a Watrqw mun';
Na Xyq Tumfo de,
Xfaa mpopaho ne guasqn,
Na Xda so som yqn.

Xno Nyame asqm,
Asafo no Ti no,
Frq yqn bom sq Ne nnamfo pa,
Ma yqkyq 'bodoo no.

Owu ne nkwa Wura,
Yqto N'ayeyi no;
Yqkyq bodoo yi n'asqm so,
Nyankopxn ne Hene,

Yqma k'ruwa yi so
'Nidasom', fisq Nea
Xde 'nigye soaa 'sqnnua no
Asxre di hen' daa.
songTWI:
The Son of God proclaim,
The Lord of time and space;
The God who bade the light break forth
Now shines in Jesus' face.

Behold His out stretched hands,
Though all was in His power
He took the towel and basin then,
And serves us in this hour.

He, God's creative word,
The church's Lord and head,
Here bids us gather as His friends,
And share His wine and bread.

The Lord of life and death
With wondering praise we sing;
We break the bread at His command,
And name Him God and King.

We take this cup in hope:
For He, who gladly bore
The shameful cross, is ris'n again,
And reigns forevermore.

title:
Ne Bra Bqhoa Me Sen Suky'rqmma
Cover With His Life
songTWI:
Look upon Jesus, sinless is He;
Father, impute His life unto me.
My life of scarlet, my sin and woe,
Cover with His life, whiter than snow.

Refrain
Cover with His life, whiter than snow;
Fullness of His life then shall I know;
My life of scarlet, my sin and woe,
Cover with His life, whither than snow.

Deep are the wounds transgression has made;
Red are the stains; my soul is afraid.
O to be covered, Jesus, with Thee,
Safe from the law that now judgeth me!

Longing the joy of pardon to know;
Jesus holds out a robe white as snow;
"Lord, I accept it! Leaving my own,
Gladly I wear Thy pure life alone."

Reconciled by His death for my sin,
Justified by His life pure and clean,
Sanctified by obeying His word,
Glorified when returneth my Lord.

title:
Nyame Name N'adiyifo So
God Has Spoken By His Prophets
songEN:
Nyame nam N'adiyifo so
Ada N'asqm no adi;
Wxn ny'naa fi mm'resanten ka sq
Nyame ne trenee W'ra no.
Wiase basamtu ne haw mun',
Ne sqkyq kura yqn mu;
Nyame yq Hen, N'agua tim hx
Xne mfiase ne awiei.

Nyame nam Kristo Yesu so,
Xba noso akasa;
Okura Agya no 'nuonyam
Ne Agya no yq baako.
Asqm-a-qbqyqq-nipa,
Tete Kwaframoa Nyame,
Hann pa a qbaa 'sase so
Beyii Nyame adi ky'rqe.

Nyame nam Ne Honhom no so
Kasa ky'rq nnipa koma;
Tete Asqm no da Nyame
Nkrasqm adi sq kan no;
Aman sxre ne asehwem,
Gyidi k'ro no gy'na pintinn;
Nyame yq Hen, N'asqm tim hx
Xne mfiase ne awiei.
songTWI:
God has spoken by His prophets,
Spoken His unchanging Word,
Each from age to age proclaiming
God, the one, the righteous Lord.
Mid the world's despair and turmoil,
One firm anchor holding fast;
God is King, His throne eternal,
God the first, and God the last.

God has spoken by Christ Jesus,
Christ, the everlasting Son,
Brightness of the Father's glory,
With the Father ever one;
Spoken by the Word incarnate,
God of God, ere time began,
Light of light, to earth descending,
Man, revealing God to man.

God yet speaks by His own Spirit
Speaking to the hearts of men,
In the age-long Word expounding
God's own message, now as then;
Through the rise and fall of nations
One sure faith yet standing fast,
God is King, His Word unchanging,
God the first, and God the last.

title:
Nnua Pa a S'ro Honhom No Dua
Fruitful Trees, the Spirit's Sowing
songEN:
Nnua pa a s'ro Honhon no dua,
Momma yqmm're na yqnso
Nkwa aba pii a enyin daa,
Nea dx ne dqw ahyq ma.

Mman a qso akyqde a
'Mafon' kxn dx sq Ohy'ra;
'Yi ne abá a qde xma,
'Yamye ne boasetx nyin.

Yqn W'ra Kristo, yqatim Wo mu,
Yqn botae ne yqn nhwqso;
B're a mfe resen yi, ky'rq yqn
Papayq ne 'hohyqso.

Nnua pa a Honhom no siesie,
Ma yennyin nkosi twab're;
B'rč a yqbqka daa nkwa ahwq,
'S'ro dx ne asomdwoe no.
songTWI:
Fruitful trees, the Spirit's sowing,
May we ripen and increase,
Fruit to life eternal growing,
Rich in love and joy and peace.

Laden branches freely bearing
Gifts the Giver loves to bless;
Here is fruit that grows by sharing,
Patience, kindness, gentleness.

Rooted deep in Christ, our Master,
Christ, our pattern and our goal,
Teach us, as the years fly faster,
Goodness, faith, and self control.

Fruitful trees, the Spirit's tending,
May we grow till harvests cease;
Till we taste, in life unending,
Heaven's love and joy and peace.

title:
'W'ra Kristō a Tumi Ny'naa Wx No
Christ the Lord, All Power Possessing
songEN:
'W'ra Kristō a tumi ny'naa wx No,
B're a Xrekx s'ro no,
Xtrqw Ne dom basam' de hy'rae,
Na mununkum gyee No kxe,
Kristo fro kxe, Kristo fro kxe,
Xfro kxx mununkum so (Xfro kxe)
Xfro kxx mununkum so.

Daniel hwq wiase temmub're;
'Bxfo hyiam buebue nwomam';
Nyame te gyaframa 'gua so,
Hwq Ne Ba no mmae no kwan.
Kristo rebqn, Kristo rebqn,
Xrebqn mununkum so (Xrebqn)
Xrebqn mununkum so.

Adiyisqm mu nsqm rebam';
T'robqnto nne gyigye wim;
Treneefo s'rew, bxn'fo twa hwe.
Aniwa biara hu No.
Kristo reba. Kristo reba.
Xreba mununkum so (Xreba)
Xreba mununkum so.
songTWI:
Christ, the Lord, all power possessing,
Parting, mounted heaven's height,
Gracious hands outstretched in blessing,
Clouds received His from their sight.
Christ ascended, Christ ascended,
Christ ascended on the clouds. (on the clouds)
Christ ascended on the clouds.

Daniel views earth's judgment hour,
Angels gathering open books.
God enthroned inflaming power
For His Son's arrival looks.
Christ approaches, Christ approaches,
Christ approaches on the clouds. (on the clouds)
Christ approaches on the clouds.

Revelation's word fulfilling,
Trumpet, voices pierce the air.
Saint and sinner fainting, thrilling,
Every eye behold Him there.
Christ is coming, Christ is coming,
Christ is coming on the clouds. (on the clouds)
Christ is coming on the clouds.

title:
Atemmu Adu
The Judgment Has Set
songEN:
Atemmu adu, wxabuebue nwoma mu;
Yebegyina dqn dapxn nom'
B're a Nyame bqkari adwen,
Kasa ne nneyqe biara?

Nnyeso
Yebgyina dqn dapxn nom'?
Yebgyina dqn dapxn nom'?
So wobehu yqn sq yqmfata,
Anaa wxahoh'ro yqn bxne?

Wxafi ase fi wxn a wxadeda so;
Qrenkyq, ateasefo nso,
Wofi Nyame nkae nwoma no mu.
Bebu wxn atqntrenee.

O, yebegyina dqn nhwehwqmu dxn nom,
B'rč nwoma no da yqn bxne
Nyinaa adi, wobu yqn fx, na
'Guantoafo bi nni hx no?
songTWI:
The judgment has set, the books have been opened;
How shall we stand in the great day
When every thought, and word, and action,
God the righteous Judge, shall weight?

Refrain
How shall we stand in that great day?
How shall we stand in that great day?
Shall we be found before Him wanting?
Or with our sins all washed away?

The work is begun with those who are sleeping,
Soon will the living here be tried,
Out of the books of God's remembrance,
His decision to abide.

O, how shall we stand that moment of searching,
When all our sins those books reveal?
When from that court, each case decided,
Shall be granted no appeal?

title:
O Adwempa, So Ebetum'
O Solemn Thought
songEN:
O adwempa, so ebetum'
Ayq seesei atemmu dxn
A qbqky'rq yqn nkrabea na
Asx 'bxnefo sqq ano?
Yiw, qte sa, 'temmu dxn no
Reba n'awiei xhare so;
Na Temmufon' befi tumim
Abqtx n'atamfo so w're.

Nea Xbaa 'sase so bewui,
Sq nnipa bxn' ho 'fxr'bxde;
Na afei Xsan fro kxx s'ro,
Na Xbqsan aba bio no,
Gyina 'daka ne dom agua,
Ne Kerubin anim seesei,
DeN' mogya srq ma hotefo
De wie wxn bxn' ho dwumadi.

B're kunin no abqn pa 'ra;
B'rč a yqn a yqbx Ne din no,
Begyina ankorankoro,
Na yqadi nim sxhwq no mu;
Yesu! Wone yqn 'nidaso,
Fa Wo mmxb'rxhun' no hwq yqn;
Bx yqn din agua n' anim na
Popa yqn bxn' fi Wo nwomam.

Agyenkwa Hy'rafo, ma yennya
Atenka mma saa b're pa yi;
Fa nsiyq kanyan yqn koma;
Fa Wo Honhom tumi boa yqn,
Na yqayq den W'ahoxden mu
Ahyia 'ko no kokod'ru mu;
Na Sion bepx no so hx,
Yqato nkonimdi dwom no bi.
songTWI:
O solemn thought and can it be
The hour o judgment now is come
Which soon must fix our destiny,
And seal the sinner's fearful down?
Yes, it is so; the judgment hour
Is swiftly hastening to its close;
Then will the Judge, in mighty power,
Descend in vengeance on His foes.

He who came down to earth to die
An offering for the sins of men,
And then ascended upon on high,
And will e'er long return again,
Is standing now before the ark,
And mercy seat and cherubim,
To plead His blood for saints, and make
The last remembrance of their sin.

The solemn moment is at hand
When we who have His name confessed,
Each in his lot must singly stand
And pass the final, searching test.
Jesus! we hope in Thee alone;
In mercy now upon us look,
Confess our names before the throne,
And blot our sins fromout Thy book.

O blessed Savior! may we feel
The full importance of this hour.
Inspire our hearts with holy zeal,
And aid us by Thy Spirit's power,
That we may in Thy strength be strong,
And brave the conflict valiantly;
Then, on Mount Zion, join the song,
And swell the notes of victory.

title:
A Temmu Da, 'Nwanwade Da!
Day of Judgement, Day of Wonders!
songEN:
A temmu da, 'nwanwade da!
Muntie t'robqnto nne no,
Ano yq den sen aprannaa;
Qwosow abxde ny'naa!
Sqnea frq no, sqnea frq no
Bqwosow bxn'fo koma!

Hwq, 'W'ra no reba 'nuonyam mu,
Ofura s'ro tumidi;
Wō a wohwq N'ahoyi kwan no
Bqka sq "Nyame wx me!"
'Gyenkwa Dqqfo, 'Gyenkwa Dqqfo,
Fa me yq Wo de da no.

Awufo sxre Ne frq so,
Fi 'sase ne pom' ba nkwam'!
Abxde ny'naa wosow N'anim
P're hwehwq sq wobeguan;
Bxneyqfo, bxneyqfo,
Ebewie wo dqn da no?

Na wxn a wxkaa wxn bxne,
Som 'W'rade fam ha no de,
Xbqse wxn sq: "Mo 'hy'rafo,
Mommqhwq M'ahenni no;
Mubehu daa, mubehu daa,
Me dx ne M'anuonyam no".
songTWI:
Day of judgement, day of wonders!
Hark the trumpet's awful sound,
Louder than a thousand thunders,
Shakes the vast creation round!
How the summons
Will the sinner's heart confound!

See the Lord in the glory nearing,
Clothed in majesty divine,
You who long for His appearing,
Then shall say, "This God is mine!"
Gracious Savior, Gracious Savior,
Own me in that day as Thine.

At His call the dead awaken,
Rise to life form earth and sea!
All the powers of nature shaken
By His looks prepare to flee.
Careless sinner, Careless sinner,
What will then become of thee?

But to those who have confessed
Loved and served the Lord below,
He will say, "Come near, ye blessed,
See the kingdom I bestow;
You forever, You forever
Shall my love and glory know."

title:
Qrenkyq, Nyankopxn
Soon Shall the Trump of God
songEN:
Qrenkyq, Nyankopxn
Abqn bqma 'kwaabá a
Qbqwosow owu 'fasu,
Na adw'riw n'asase.

Mō a moadeda dxtem',
Monsxre mmqto dwom;
Mo awxwb're nom' yq den de,
Mo sxre bqyq fq.

Woduaa no mm'rqwyqm' ha;
Wobenyan tumi mu;
Nea woduae sq fam aba no,
Bqsxre sq s'ro nhw'ren.
songTWI:
Soon shall the trump of God
Give out the welcome sound,
That shakes death's silent chamber walls,
And breaks the turf sealed ground.

You dwellers in the dust,
Awake, come forth, and sing;
Sharp has your frost of winter been,
But bright shall be your spring.

'Twas sown in weakness here;
'Twill then be raised in power;
That which was sown in earthly seed
Shall rise a heav'nly flower.

title:
Yerusalem, M'anigye Fie
Jerusalem, My Happy Home
songEN:
Yerusalem, m'anigye fie
O, mafe wo dodo!
Da bqn na m'aw'rqhow bqsa,
Na mabehu wo dqw?

W'afasu yq abopa nko,
Qyq anuonyam pii,
Wxde sika n'ayq w'apon,
W'abxnten nso sika.

Wo turo ne mu akwan no,
Masua ho nsqm akyq;
Ne fq tra nnipa adwen so,
Na aniwa nhuu da.

Awurade, dom boa yqn ma
Yqnhwq nkonim bo no;
Kosi sq W' bqba 'befa yqn
Akx Paradise.
songTWI:
Jerusalem, my happy Index,
O how I long for thee!
When will my sorrows have an end,
The joys when shall I see?

The walls are all of precious stone,
Most glorious to behold;
Thy gates are richly set with pearl,
Thy streets are paved with gold.

Thy garden and thy pleasant walks
My study long have been;
Such dazzling views by human sight
Have never yet been seen.

Lord, help us by Thy mighty grace,
To keep in view the prize,
Till Thou dost come to take us Index
To that blessed paradise.

title:
'Hotefo A WxreIndex No Ny'naa
For All The Saints
songEN:
'Hotefo a wxrehome no ny'naa,
Nam gyidi so dii Wo ho adanse,
O Yesu, nhyira nka Wo din no daa;
Haleluya, Haleluya!

Woyqq wxn Botan ne Abankqse,
Woyqq wxn Sahen wxn akodi mu,
'Sum huhu mu, Woyqq wxn
nokwar' hann, Haleluya, Haleluya!

Ma Wo nokwar' nsraafo mfa nnam kqse
Nko sq 'hotefō a wxkoo tete no,
Ne wxn nnya nkonim sika 'bot'ri no
Haleluya, Haleluya!

Sq xtaa nom' yq, na ko no kyq,
Na wxte aky'rik'kyri nkonim dwom a,
Qna koma ne nsa san nya denyq
Haleluya, Haleluya!

Wofi nsase ne mpoano aky'riky'ri
Nam sika apon mu to 'yeyi dwom
Ma Agya, 'ba ne Honhom Kronkron no:
Haleluya, Haleluya!
songTWI:
For all the saints, who from their labors rest,
who thee by faith before the world confessed,
thy name, O Jesus, be forever blest.
Alleluia, Alleluia!

Thou wast their rock, their fortress, and their might;
thou Lord, their captain in the well-fought fight;
thou in the darkness drear, their one true light.
Alleluia, Alleluia!

O may thy soldiers, faithful, true, and bold,
fight as the saints who nobly fought of old,
and win with them the victor's crown of gold.
Alleluia, Alleluia!

O blest communion, fellowship divine!
We feebly struggle, they in glory shine;
yet all are one in thee, for all are thine.
Alleluia, Alleluia!

And when the strife is fierce, the warfare long,
steals on the ear the distant triumph song,
and hearts are brave again, and arms are strong.
Alleluia, Alleluia!

From earth's wide bounds, from ocean's farthest coast,
through gates of pearl streams in the countless host,
singing to Father, Son, and Holy Ghost:
Alleluia, Alleluia!

title:
Yqnam Rekx Sion
Marching To Zion
songEN:
Mo a modx Nyame
Mommra mma yenni dqw;
Momma yemmom nto dwom dqdq,
Momma yemmom nto dwom dqdq,
Ntwa 'hengua no ho nhyia,
Ntwa 'hengua no ho nhyia,

Nnyeso
Yqnam rekx Sion,
Sion a qyq fq no mu,
Yqnam, yqnam rekx Sion,
Nyankopxn kuro fqfq nom'.

Wxn a wonnim No no
Tum' gyae Ne ho dwom to;
Nanso xs'ro Hene mma no,
Nanso xs'ro Hene mma no,
Bqka wxn dqw aky'rq
Bqka wxn dqw aky'rq

Sion bepx ma yqn Qdew ahorow pii,
Ansa na yqadu soro hx
Ansa na yqadu soro hx,
Anante sika so, anante sika so.

Qnde yqbqto nnwom Apopa yqn nusu;
Yqnam Imanuel 'sase so,
Yqnam Imanuel 'sase so,
Rekx s'ro man no mu,
Rekx s'ro man no mu.
songTWI:
Come, we that love the Lord,
and let our joys be known;
join in a song with sweet accord,
join in a song with sweet accord,
and thus surround the throne.
and thus surround the throne.

Refrain
We're marching to Zion
Beautiful, beautiful Zion,
We're marching upward to Zion
The beautiful city of God

Let those refuse to sing
who never knew our God;
but children of the heavenly King
but children of the heavenly King
may speak their joys abroad.
may speak their joys abroad.

The hill of Zion yields
a thousand sacred sweets
before we reach the heavenly fields,
before we reach the heavenly fields,
or walk the golden streets.
or walk the golden streets.

Then let our songs abound,
and every tear be dry;
we're marching through Emmanuel's ground,
we're marching through Emmanuel's ground,
to fairer worlds on high.
to fairer worlds on high.

title:
Wxka Wo Ho Anuonyam Nsqm
Glorious Things of Thee Are Spoken
songEN:
Wxka wo ho anuonyam nsqm
Yqn Nyankopxn kųrow Sion;
Nyame a wommu N'asqm so,
Xtoo wo Tete Bo no so,
Dqn na qbqwosow wo?
Nkwagye fasu twa wo ho hyia
Wobqserew w'atamfo.

Hwq n-kwa nsubxnten no a
Qsen fi daapem dx mu;
Yqn wo mmabanin ne mmabea,
Yi xkxm ho suro hx;
Nsu yi rekum wxn sukxm yi
Hena n'xbqtx beraw?
Yqn Wura dqqfo no dom no
To nso rentwa ara da.

Hwq sq mununkum ne ogya
Kyinkyin trabea biara ho,
Mano 'nuonyam ne nkataho,
De ky'rq sq 'W'rade abqn;
Hy'rafo a wxtete Sion,
Wxaguar' wxn Gyefo mogyam;
Yesu a wxn kra twer' No no,
Yq wxn Nyame asxfo.

Agyenkwa, sq Sion kuro no,
Wonam dom so gyem' hx a,
Ma wiase nsi me atwetwe,
Menya 'nuonyam Wo din mu;
Wiase anigye, ahantan
Ne akqsesqm retwam;
Xdqw ne ahyehyqde pa,
Sion mma nko na wonim.
songTWI:
Glorious things of thee are spoken,
Zion, city of our God;
He whose word cannot be broken
Formed thee for His own abode;
On the Rock of Ages founded,
What can shake thy sure repose?
With salvation's wall surrounded,
Thou mayest smile at all thy foes.

See the streams of living waters
Springing from eternal love,
Well supply thy sons and daughters,
And all fear and want remove;
Who can faint when such a river
Ever flows their thirst to assuage?
Grace, which, like the Lord, the Giver,
Never fails from age to age.

Round each habitation hovering,
See the cloud and fire appear
For a glory and a covering,
Showing that the Lord is near;
Blest inhabitants of Zion,
Washed in the Redeemer's blood;
Jesus, whom their souls rely on,
Makes them kings and priests to God.

Savior, if of Zion's city
I, through grace, a member am,
Let the world deride or pity,
I will glory in Thy name;
Fading is the worldling's pleasure,
All his boasted pomp and show;
Solid joys and lasting treasure
None but Zion's children know.

title:
Wo, Xman a Medx Wo
For Thee, O Dear, Dear Country

Kronkron, Kronkron Ne Abxfo No Dwom
Holy, Holy, Is What the Angels Sing
songEN:
Dwonto bi rekx so s'ro a
Yqntee ne nsqso bi da;
Faako a 'bxfo to 'Guammaā a
Qte agua so 'yeyi;
Wxn nsankuhama so yq dq,
Na wxn nne nso mu da hx;
Anka yentumi nyq sq wxn
B'rč a yqsom 'W'ra no ha yi!

Nnyeso
Kronkron, kronkron ne abxfo no dwom,
Na mepq sq meboa ma s'ro abangua no wosow;
Nso meto xgye dwom a wxbqbrq wxn ntaban 'se
'Fisq 'bxfo nnim 'nigye a yqn nkwagye de ba no.

Nanao mete dwom fof'ro bi
Wx nne a qyq dq mu;
Qka sq yqyq Nea Wagye
Yqn na Watx yqn no de;
Yefi ahohiahia mu na
Yqaba hann 'sase yi so;
Wasi yqn ntade no fitaa
Bura a qsen kwa nom'.

Abxfo gyina hx tie, na
Wontumi nto saa dwom a
Egyigye sq nsu a dxm a
Wxaguar' wxn mogyam to no;
'fisq dwom no fa akodi
Ne wxn nkonimdi no ho
Woyi wxn Gyefo kqse a
Wama wxn "Mo" na aye.

Ewom sq menyq 'bxfo de,
Nso minim sq s'ro hx no,
Mqfra nnwontofō a wxahy'ra wxn
Na 'bxfo ntum' nka ho nom';
Mqto n'Agyenkwa no ho dwom,
Nea Xpataa me mm'rato
Na Owu de gyee 'bxn'yqni
Wx Kalbre sum mu hx no.
songTWI:
There is singing up in heaven
such as we have never known,
Where the angels sing the praises
of the Lamb upon the throne;
Their sweet harps are ever tuneful
and their voices are always clear,
O that we might be more like them
while we serve the Master here!

Refrain
Holy, holy, is what the angels sing,
And I expect to help them make
the courts of heaven ring;
But when I sing redemption's story,
they will fold their wings,
For angels never felt the joys
that our salvation brings.

But I hear another anthem,
blending voices clear and strong,
"Unto Him who hath redeemed us
and hath bought us," is the song;
We have come thro' tribulations
to this land so fair and bright,
In the fountain freely flowing
He hath made our garments white.

Then the angels stand and listen,
for they cannot join that song,
Like the sound of many waters,
by that happy, blood-washed throng;
For they sing about great trials,
battles fought and vict'ries won,
And they praised the great Redeemer,
who hath said to them, "Well done."

So, although I'm not an angel,
yet I know that over there
I will join a blessed chorus
that the angels cannot share;
I will sing about my Savior,
who upon dark Calvary
Freely pardoned my transgressions,
died to set the sinner free.

title:
Mehu Xhen' No, Nea 'Bxfo To Dwom
I Shall See the King
songEN:
Mehu Xhen' no, nea 'bxfo to dwom;
Menu Xhen' no da bi,
'Sase pa no so, sika mpoano hx,
Na me ne No atra daa.

Nnyeso
Mehu Xhen' no N'anuonyam mu,
Na mato ayeyi dwom daa daa;
Kalbre so hx na Yesu wu maa me;
Mehu Xhen' no ba bi.

Nnwonto 'sase a 'nuonyam dxm wx so,
Nea anadwo nni hx no,
Me ne me W'ra no bedi ahen' daa
'Nuonyam hann 'sase no so.

Mehu Xhen' no de m'aboade ny'naa
Ama na mahwq N'anim;
Me dwom bqyq senea Xde Ne dom
Agye me akōra me no.
songTWI:
I shall see the King where the angels sing,
I shall see the King some day, in the better land,
On that golden strand,
And with Him shall ever stay.

Refrain
In His glory, I shall see the King,
And forever endless praises sing;
'Twas on Calvary Jesus died for me;
I shall see the King someday.

In the land of song, in the glory throng,
Where there never comes a night,
With my Lord once slain I shall ever reign
In the glory land of light.

I shall see the King, all my tributes bring,
And shall look upon His face;
Then my song shall be how He ransomed me
And has kept me by His grace.

title:
Daa 'Dekyee 'Sase N' So Na
No Night There
songEN:
Daa 'dekyee 'sase n' so na
"'Hinanan kųro" no da;
Na qrentwa mu nkx da,
Na adesae nni hx.

Nnyeso
Nyame bqpopa nusu;
Owu, yaw ne sųro nini hx,
Na wommu b're wx mfe mu,
Fisq 'desae nni hx.

Abopa na wxdč ayq
"'Hinanan kųro" n' apon;
N'abxnten yq sika nko,
Na adesae nni hx.

Wxrentow 'pow a qkx
"'Hinanan kųro" no mu;
Fisq 'Guammaa no ne hann,
Na adesae nii hx.

Wxrenhia 'wia hann wx saa
"'Hinanan kųro" nom' hx;
'Fisq 'Guammaan' yq hann no,
Na adesae nni hx.
songTWI:
In the land of fadeless day
Lies "the city four-square;"
It shall never pass away,
And there is "no night there."

Refrain
God shall "wipe away all tears;"
There's no death, no pain, nor fears;
And they count not time by years,
For there is "no night there."

All the gates of pearl are made,
In "the city four-square;"
All the streets with gold are laid,
And there is "no night there."

And the gates shall never close
To "the city four-square;"
There life's crystal river flows,
And there is "no night there."

There they need no sunshine bright,
In "that city four-square;"
For the Lamb is all the light,
And there is "no night there."

title:
Xdqw Nom', Daakye Bi
Sweet By and By
songEN:
Asase kama be wx soro,
Gyidi aniwa na yqde hu;
Na Agya retwqn wx kwan no so,
Resiesie trabea ama yqn hx.

Nnyeso
Xdqw nom', daakye bi,
Yebehyiam wx mpoano fqfq hx;
Xdqw nom', daakye bi,
Yebehyiam wx mpoano fqfq hx.

Yebehim nnwom mpoano fqfq hx,
'Hyirafo nnwom a qyq dq no;
Na yqn honhom renni yaw bi-o
Apinisi remfra yqn homem'.

Yqn soro Agya Xdqqfo no,
Yebeyi No ayq daa nyinaa,
Wx Ne dx akyqde pa no nti,
Ne nhyira a qteq yqn nna ho.
songTWI:
There's a land that is fairer than day,
And by faith we can see it afar;
For the Father waits over the way,
To prepare us a dwelling place there.

Refrain
In the sweet by and by,
We shall meet on that beautiful shore;
In the sweet by and by,
We shall meet on that beautiful shore;

We shall sing on that beautiful shore
The melodious songs of the blest,
And our spirits shall sorrow no more,
Not a sigh for the blessings of rest.

To our bountiful Father above,
We will offer a tribute of praise,
For the glorious gift of His love,
And the blessings that hallow our days.

title:
Sika Yerusalem a
Jerusalem the Golden
songEN:
Sika Yerusalem a
Nufusu ne 'wo wom',
Wo ho adwen ma koma
Ne nne my yaw tu y'ra;
Minnim, O minnim 'nigye
Kronkron a qwx hx,
Anuonyam a qhy'rqn ne
'Dqw a enni nsqso.

Sion adampxn no mu
'H'rusi dwom ahyq ma;
Mogya 'dansefo kuw ne
'Bxfo dxm pii hy'rqn hx,
Xhen' no wx wxn mu daa;
'Dekyee hann no yq dwoo,
Anuonyam haban pii wx
'Hy'rafon' didibea hx.

Dawid agua no wx hx,
Nkonimdifo no nteam
Ne ponton' asefo dwom
No nyinaa hyq hx ma;
Na wxn a wxne wxn W'ra
Ako adi nim no,
Wxahyq wxn ntade fitaā a
Wxrenworx bio da.

O, xdqw ne hhyira man,
Nyame aponfo fie;
O, xdqw ne nhyira man
A koma p're hwehwq
Yesu, fa yqn bra 'sasč a
Ahome wx so no.
Nhyira nka Wo ne Agya
Ne Honhom do daa ny'naa.
songTWI:
Jerusalem the golden,
With milk and honey blest,
Beneath thy contemplation
Sink heart and voice oppressed.
I know not, O I know not
What holy joys are there;
What radiancy of glory,
What bliss beyond compare.

They stand, those hall of Zion,
All jubilant with song,
And bright with many an angel,
And all the martyr throng.
The Prince is ever in them,
The daylight is serene;
The pastures of the blessed
Are deck in glorious sheen.

There is the throne of David,
And there, from care released,
The shout of them that triumph,
The song of them that feast;
And they who, with their Leader,
Have conquered in the fight,
Forever and forever
Are clad in robes of white.

O sweet and blessed country,
The Index of God's elect!
O sweet and blessed country,
That eager hearts expect!
Jesus, in mercy bring us
To that dear land of rest;
Who art, with God the Father,
And Spirit, ever blest.

title:
Odew Beba 'Dwuma No Awiei
O, There'll Be Joy
songEN:
Xdqw bqba 'dwuma no awiei,
B'rč a 'paafo bqboa awi no
Ano owitxe de akx
Yerusalem Fof'ro nom'

Nnyeso
Dqw,dqw,qhx ny'naa bqyq dq'
Dqw, dqw,faako a dqw nsa da;
Dqw, dqw, da no rekx awiei,
B'rč a 'paafo bqpxn 'dwuma

Dwom a yqbqto no bqyq dq,
'Seda nnwom befi yqn komam,
Akamfo yqn Hen' Kristo daa
Yerusalem Fof'ro nom'.

Xdqw kronn na qretwqn yqn hx;
Sika adan pii wx hx a
Yesu Ankasā asiesie wx
Yerusalem Fof'ro nom'.
songTWI:
Jerusalem, my happy Index,
O how I long for thee!
When will my sorrows have an end,
The joys when shall I see?

The walls are all of precious stone,
Most glorious to behold;
Thy gates are richly set with pearl,
Thy streets are paved with gold.

Thy garden and thy pleasant walks
My study long have been;
Such dazzling views by human sight
Have never yet been seen.

Lord, help us by Thy mighty grace,
To keep in view the prize,
Till Thou dost come to take us Index
To that blessed paradise.

title:
Aky'riky'ri Hx
Over Yonder
songEN:
Bra m'yqnto kųro no ho dwom
Ahwehwq po no ho,
'Sase nwanwasō a Yesu
Asi fie ama me no

Nnyeso
Aky'riky'ri hx, ahwehwq po no ho,
Aky'riky'ri hx, faakō a m'ani gyina;
Aw'rqhow, xbrq ne dadwen
Nni kuro fqfq no mu Wx aky'riky'ri hx.

N-kwa nsu sen hx nyinaa,
Nnuaba abu so hx,
'Dehye a wxwx man hom'
Nni xkxm ne sukxm bio.

B'ra ma yqnkx kųro no mu,
Yesu to nsa frq wo;
Boa ma xfrq no my ntrqw;
Bx nnipa ny'naa amanne.
songTWI:
Come let us sing of Indexland,
Down by the crystal sea;
Wonderful land where Jesus
Buildeth a mansion for me.

Refrain
Over yonder, down by the crystal sea,
Over yonder, there's where I long to be,
No more sorrow, toil, grief, nor care,
In the Indexland bright and fair,
Over, over there.

Water of life there floweth,
Fruit in abundant store;
Citizens of that country
Hunger and thirst never more.

Come go with me to Indexland,
Jesus invites you there;
Help spread the invitation,
Tell it to men everywhere.

title:
So Yebehyiam Asu No So
Shall We Gather At The River
songEN:
So yebehyiam asu no so,
Nea abxfo atiatia;
Asu k'ronnyen a qsen daa
Fi Nyame 'hengua mu no?

Nnyeso
Yiw, yebehyiam asu no so,
Asu fqfq, asu fqfq no a
Efi Nyame 'henguam sen no,
Yqne 'hotefo behyiam

Asu fqfq no ano hx,
Nea ne nsu sen hyqnhyqn no;
Yqbqnante hx asom daa
Wx ahotx da no mu.

Momma yqnto yqn nnesosa ngu,
Ansa na yqadu s'ro hx;
Yqn honhom no benya xdom,
Ma yqanya ntade ne kyqw.

Qrenkyq na yebedu hx,
Akwantu yi to betwa;
Awxse bqka yqn koma,
Xdqw asomdwoe nnwom mu.
songTWI:
Shall we gather at the river,
Where bright angel feet have trod,
With its crystal tide forever
Flowing by the throne of God.

Refrain
Yes, we'll gather at the river,
The beautiful, the beautiful river;
Gather with the sains at the river
That flows by the throne of God.

On the margin of the river
Washing up its silver spray,
We will walk and worship ever,
All the happy golden day.

Ere we reach the shining river,
Lay we ev'ry burden down;
Grace our spirits will deliver,
And provide a robe and crown.

Soon we'll reach the shining river,
Soon our pilgrimage will cease;
Soon our happy hearts will quiver
With the melody of peace.

title:
Xpedu Ah'row Mpem Du
Ten Thousand Times Ten Thousands
songEN:
Xpedu ah'row mpem du,
Hyq ntade a qhy'rqn;
'Hotefo a wxagye wxn no
Nam hann apon no mu;
Wxawie, ne nyinaa asa,
Wxadi bxn' ne 'wu so;
Mummuebue sika 'pon mu mma
Nkokimfo no nhyqn mu.

Haleluya horow hyq
Asase ne wim ma!
Asanku mpempem nne team ka
Nkonim no wx wim;
O, da a wxbxx ade
Ne ne mmusuakuw ny'naa!
Dqw aba, ne kan mmusu ny'naa,
Wxatua ne ka awie.

O, wxde dqw bqkyeakyea
Wx Kanaan mpoano hx!
Nnamfō a wxadi ntetew'm behyiam;
'Wu 'ntetew wxn ntam bio;
'Niwa a nusu ahyq
Ma no de dqw bqhy'rqn
Nyisiaa nni hx, saa ara na
'Kunafo renni yaw.

Fa Wo nkwagye kqse n' bra,
'Guammaā a wokum Wo no!
Frq wxn a Woapaw wxn ny'naa na
Fa Wo tumi di hen;
Bra, aman Ahwehwqde
Wo nk'rxfo afe fie;
MaW' bxhyq sqnky'renne mpue wim,
Bra, Xhen', Agyenkwa!
songTWI:
Ten thousand times ten thousand,
In sparkling raiment bring,
The armies of the ransomed saints
Throng up the steeps of light.
'Tis finished, all is finished,
Their fight with death and sin.
Fling open wide the golden gates,
And let the victors in.

What rush of hallelujahs
Fills all the earth and sky!
The ringing of thousand harps
Proclaims the triumph high.
O day for which creation
And all its tribes were made!
O joy, for all its former woes
A thousand-fold repaid!

O then what raptured greetings
On Canaan's happy shore!
What knitting severed friendship
Where Death partings are no more!
Then eyes with joy will sparkle,
That brimmed with tears of late;
Orphans no longer fatherless,
Nor widows desolate.

Bring near Thy great salvation,
Thou Lamb for sinners slain,
Fill up the roll of Thine elect,
Then take Thy power and reign!
Appear, Desire of nations,
Thine exiles long for Index;
Show in the heavens Thy promised sign;
Thou Prince and Savior, come!

title:
Yqka Hy'rafo Man No Ho Nsqm
We Speak of the Realms
songEN:
Yqka hy'rafo man no ho nsqm,
Saa man a qyq fq no a
Wxtaaa ka mu 'nuonyam ky'rq no;
Nanso emy tra bqyq dqn!
Yqka ne sika akwan no,
N'afasų a qyq nhene pa,
Emu anigyede wxnka,
Nanso emy tra bqyq dqn!

Yqka bxne ne aw'rqhow,
Dadwen ne sxhwq horow a
Entumi mma hx no ho nsqm
Nanso emu tra bqyq dqn!
Yqka ne dx som ne 'nuonyam
Ntade a 'hotefo no hyq,
S'ro mmakan 'safo no ho nsqm,
Nanso emu tra bqyq dqn!

B'rč a nkwa asqm n nyan yqn no,
Yqn aw'rqhow ba awiei na
Yehu kųro no sq qresian
Sq ayef'ro ma ne Wura.
Kųro no yq kronn na emu tew,
'W'rqhow biara ntumi nhyqn hx;
Ahohia anaa bxne ne
Mmusu sunsuma bi nni hx.

Fi haw horow mu boa wo ho,
Na s'ro na me honhom hwehwq;
Qrenkyq pii me nso mehu
Sqnea emu tra no te fa.
Yqbqnante mfuw fqfq so,
Xs'ro 'nuonyam ne pqyq mu,
Yqne 'hotefo ne 'bxfo,
Ne Yesu Ankasa bqtra.
songTWI:
We speak of the realms of the blest,
That country so bright and so fair,
And oft are its glories confessed—
But what must it be to be there!
We speak of its pathway of gold—
Its walls decked with jewels so rare,
Its wonders and pleasures untold—
But what must it be to be there!

We speak of its freedom of sin,
From sorrow, temptation and care,
From trials without and within—
But what must it be to be there!
We speak of its service of love,
Of the robes which glorified wear,
Of the church of the First Born above—
But what must it be to be there!

Our mourning is all at an end,
When, raised by the life-giving word,
We see the new city descend,
Adorned as a bride for her Lord;
The city so holy and clean,
No sorrow can breathe in the air;
No gloom of affliction or sin,
No shadow of evil, is there.

Do Thou, midst temptation and woe,
For heaven my spirit prepare;
And shortly I also so shall know
And feel what it is to be there.
Then o'er the bright fields we shall roam,
In glory celestial and fair,
With saints and with angels at Index,
And Jesus Himself will be there.

title:
'Nuonyam Amam
The Glory Song
songEN:
Sq me brq ne me sxhwq nyinaa twam'
Na mikodu mpoano fqfq no so;
Na mebqn Nyame a mesom No a,
Anuonyam bqyq me de afebxx

Nnyeso
Qbqyq anuonyam amam'
'Nuonyam amam, 'nuonyam amam;
B're a Ne dom nti mqhwq N'anim no,
Qbqyq anuonyam, 'nounyam amam!

Enam Ne dom akyqde kqse nti,
Wxasiesie trabea ama me soro,
Sq memkx hx na memkxhwq N'anim,
Anuonyam bqyq me de afebxx.

Yxnkonom a madx wxn bqha hx,
Xdqw betwq me ho ahyia sq nsu;
Na m,'Agyenkwa bqs'rew akyerq me,
Anuonyam bqyq me de afebxx.
songTWI:
When all my labors and trails are o'er,
And I am safe on that beautiful shore,
Just to be near the Lord I adore,
Will through the ages be glory for me.

Refrain
O that will be Glory for me, Glory for me,
Glory for me; When by His grace
I shall look on His face,
That will be glory, be glory for me.

When, by the gift of His infinite grace,
I am accorded in heaven a place,
Just to be there and to look on His face,
Will through the ages be glory for me.

Friends will be there I have loved long ago;
Joy like a river around me will flow,
Yet, just a smile form my Savior, I know,
