Will through the ages be glory for me.

title:
Kuro No
The Homeland

Me S'ro Fie Hy'rqn Na Qyq Fq
I'm Going Index
songEN:
Me s'ro fie hy'rqn na qyq fq,
Yaw ne owu ntumi nkx hx;
N'abantenten hy'rqn sen owia,
Saa s'ro fie no bqyq me de.

Nnyeso
Merekx fie, Merekx fie,
Merekx fie, Merenwu bio;
Merenwu bio, Merenwu bio,
Mereko fie, Merenwu bio.

M'Agya fič a wxasi no s'ro,
Wx ewim aky'riky'ri nohoa;
Mede me ho fi sase so a,
Saa s'ro fie no bqyq me de.

Ma binom nhwehwq fie fam ha,
Nea egya hyew, na nsu sqe no;
Mede no som bo sen 'yinom,
S'ro fie a qbqn 'hengua no.
songTWI:
I'm going Index, I'm going Index,
I'm going Index to die no more;
To die no more; to die no more-
I'm going Index to die no more.

Chorus
My heav'nly Index is bright and fair,
Nor pain nor death can enter there;
It's glitt'ring tow'rs the sun outshine,
That heav'nly mansion shall me mine.

My Father's house is built on high,
Far, far above the starry sky;
When from this earthly prison free,
That heav'nly mansion mine shall be.

Let others seek a Index below,
Which flames devour or waves oe'r flow;
Be mine a happier lot to own
A heav'nly mansion near the throne.

title:
Mubehu Sq Mo W'ra Reba
You Will See Your Lord A-Coming
songEN:
Mubehu sq mo W'ra reba.
Mubehu sq mo W'ra reba,
Mubehu sq mo W'ra reba,
Nna tiawa bi mu.

Nnyeso
Muntie wxn s'ro dwom no,
Muntie wxn s'ro dwom no,
Muntie wxn s'ro dwom no,
A qregyigye wim no.

Gabriel hyqn ne t'robqnto no,
Gabriel hyqn ne t'robqnto no,
Gabriel hyqn ne t'robqnto no,
Nna tiawa bi mu.

Mubehu 'hotefo sxre,
Mubehu 'hotefo sxre,
Mubehu 'hotefo sxre,
Nna tiawa bi mu.

'Bxfo soa wxn ko 'Gyenkwa nkyqn,
'Bxfo soa wxn ko 'Gyenkwa nkyqn,
'Bxfo soa wxn ko 'Gyenkwa nkyqn,
Nna tiawa bi mu.

Yqteam sq yqn 'manehun' kx,
Yqteam sq yqn 'manehun' kx,
Yqteam sq yqn 'manehun' kx,
Nna tiawa bi mu.
songTWI:
You will see your Lord acoming,
You will see your Lord acoming,
You will see your Lord acoming
In a few more days.

Refrain
Hear the band of music,
Hear the band of music,
Hear the band of music
Which is sounding thro' the air.

Gabriel sounds his mighty trumpet,
Gabriel sounds his mighty trumpet,
Gabriel sounds his mighty trumpet
In a few more days.

You will see the saints arising,
You will see the saints arising,
You will see the saints arising
In a few more days.

Angels bear them to the Savior,
Angels bear them to the Savior,
Angels bear them to the Savior
In a few more days.

Then we'll shout, our suff'ring over,
Then we'll shout, our suff'ring over,
Then we'll shout, our suff'ring over
In a few more days.

title:
Mibisae Sq: Ha Ne Fie War?
How Far Form Home?
songEN:
Mibisae sq: Ha ne fie war'?
Xwqmfo no bua see me sq:
Anadwo no rekx awiei,
Qrenkyq, 'de bqkye.
Qnde nsu bio, kx 'hare so,
'Nidaso ns'romma nky'rq wo kwan
Kosi sq wubedu hann man
No mu wx daa 'dekyeem'.

Mibisaa xkofo no nso;
Na ne nkuranhyq dwom ne sq:
Mqso afoa no mu 'boxd'rum',
Xko no renkyq pii.
Qnde nsu bio, gyina pintinn
Wx 'ko no my kosi awiei;
Yenim sq yedi nkonim a
'Katua da hx ma yqn.

Mibisaa bio, 'sase ne po
Ne owia de nne k'ro buaa sq:
Mm're no rekx awiei ntqm so,
Daa nkwa abqn pa'ra.
Qnde nsu bio, kxkxbx ni,
Sqnky'rqnne horow da adi;
'Bxde si apini twqn sq
T'robqnto no bebom.
songTWI:
How far from Home? I asked, as on
I bent my steps-the watchman spake:
"the long, dark night is almost gone,
The morning soon will break.
Then weep no more, but speed thy flight,
With Hope's bright star guiding ray,
Till thou shalt reach the realms of light,
In everlasting days."

I asked the warrior on the field;
This was his soul-inspiring song:
"With courage, bold, the sword I'll wield,
The battle is not long.
Then weep no more, but well endure
The conflict, till thy work is done;
For this we know, the prize is sure,
When victory is won."

I asked again; earth, sea, and sun
Seemed, with one voice, to make reply:
"Time's wasting sands are nearly run,
Eternity is nigh.
Then weep no more-with warning tones,
Portentous signs are thickening round,
The whole creation, waiting, groans,
To hear the trumpet sound."

Not far from Home! O blessed thought!
The traveler's lonely heart to cheer;
Which oft a healing balm has brought,
And dried the mourner's tear.
Then weep no more, since we shall meet
Where weary footsteps never roam-
Our trails past, our joys complete,
Safe in our Father's Index.

title:
Sqnea Kristoni 'Nidaso
How Cheering Is the Christian's Hope
songEN:
Sqnea Kristoni 'nidaso
Ma yqn nkųranhyq fam ha!
Qhyq yqn den b're a yqnam
Mmusu sare so yi.

Qky'rq homebeá a 'hotefo
Ne Kristo bedi hen';
Nea yebehyia adxfo na
Yenni ntetewmu bio.

Mm're, monntwentwqn, monkx nteqmntqm,
'Gyenkwa pa, bra ntqm so,
Yqpq sq yehu W' sq Wote
Na yqba 'hotx fie.
songTWI:
How cheering is the Christian's hope,
While toiling here below!
It bouys us up while this passing through
This wilderness of woe,

It bouys us up while this passing through
This wilderness of woe,
It bouys us up while passing through
This wilderness of woe.

It points us to a land of rest,
Where saints with Christ will reign;
Where we shall meet the loved of earth,
And never part again.

Fly, lingering moments, fly, O, fly,
Dear Savior, quickly come!
We long to see Thee as Thou art,
And reach that blissful Index.

title:
Mihuu Brqfo Mmxb'rxni Bi
I Saw One Weary
songEN:
Mihuu brqfo mmxb'rxni bi;
'de awerqhyem tu ne kwan;
Nea wasoa 'sqnnua no akyq
Da so hwq bxhyq da no kwan.
B're a aw'rqhow ne ohaw,
Aye mpomponoe wx n'anim;
Mibisaa nea 'hyqq ne kra den,
Obuae sq, "nidaso pa no".

Mihuu peaw ne kyqm kurafo,
'De nisiyq pam wiase 'bufuw,
Koo mmarima so wx sar' so
De nyaa daapem ahenkyqw no.
Mmom wabrq, 'tamfo hyqn' so de,
Nso 'nwinwii bi 'mfi ne komam',
Mibisaa nea hyq ne kra den,
Obuae sq "nidaso pa no".

Obi nso wx hx a ogyaw
Ne kan m-fe mu nnamfo pa;
Anuonyam 'nigye ne sika
Bqfaa kwan a nusu wx so.
Nsxhwq ne xko nwenwen mu,
Nanso xtoa so s'rew 'nigyem.
Mibisaa nea hyqq ne kra den,
Obuae sq "nidaso pa no".

B're a yetu yqn kwan pa yi
Wx sum ne bxne wiase yi,
Wx haw, tan ne atwetwe mu
Anaa owu bxn apon mu.
Kosi sq yqn Hen' no bq ba
Bqfa Ne nneduafō akx fie,
O, dqn na tumi kyq kra den
Nyq hwee sq "nidaso no nko".
songTWI:
I saw one weary, sad, and torn,
With eager steps press on the way,
Who long the hallowed cross had born,
Still looking for the promised day;
While many a line of grief and care,
Upon his brow was furrowed there;
I asked what buoyed his spirits up,
"O this" said he-"the blessed hope."

And one I saw, with sword and shield,
Who boldly braved the world's cold frown,
And fought, unyielding, on the field,
To win an everlasting crown.
Though worn with toil, oppressed by foes,
No murmur from his heart arose;
I asked what buoyed his spirits up,
"O this!" said he-"the blessed hope."

And there was one who left behind
The cherished friends of early years,
And honor, pleasure, wealth re-signed,
To tread the path bedewed with tears.
Through trials deep and conflict sore,
Yet still a smile of joy he wore;
O! what can bouy the spirit up?
'Tis this alone-the blessed hope.

While pilgrims here we journey on
In this dark vale of sin and gloom,
Through tribulation, hate, and scorn,
Or through the portals of the tomb,
Till our returning King shall come
To tkae His exile captives Index,
O! what can bouy the spirits up?
'Tis this alone— the blessed hope.

title:
Amanneq No Yq Dq Wx 'Kwantuni
How Sweet Are the Tidings
songEN:
Amanneq no yq dq wx 'kwantuni asom
B're a wafi fie rekokyin no;
Qrenkyq na 'Gyenkwa apue anounyam mu,
Ahenni no bqba ntqm so.

Nnyeso
Minim sq Xreba, Xreba ntqm so,
Xresan aba wiase bio;
'Kwatufo a wxabrq bqkx 'nuonyam mu,
B're a 'Gyenkwa bedi hen' no.

Akwantufo damoa a afufuw nwura
Bebuebue sq kan de nō ara;
Na mpempem a wxadeda wq damoa mu no,
Bqtra asase yi so bio.

Yqrenni ntetewmy yqn 'nigye Eden fie,
Yqbqto xgye nnwon dqdq;
Wxn a wxagye wxn nyinaa fi
mmeammea bqba Abqkoto yqn soro Hen'.

Haleluya Amen, Haleluya bi-o,
Yedi nokwar' a yqbqkx hx,
O monwqn, nya 'nidaso nni dqw kosi sq
Yqbqhyq 'nuonyam 'henkyqw no.
songTWI:
How sweet are the tidings that greet the pilgrim's ear,
As he wanders in exile from Index!
Soon, soon will the Savior in glory appear,
And soon will the kingdom come.

Refrain
He's coming, coming, coming soon I know,
Coming back to this earth again;
And the weary pilgrims will to glory go,
When the Savior comes to reign.

The mossy old graves where the pilgrims sleep
Shall be open as wide as before,
And the millions that sleep in the mighty deep
Shall live on this earth once more.

There we'll meet ne'er to part in our happy
Eden Index, Sweet songs of redemption we'll sing;
From the north, from the south, all the ransomed shall come,
And worship our heavenly King.

Hallelujah, Amen! Hallelujah again!
Soon, if faithful, we all shall be there;
O, be watchful, be hopeful, be joyful till then,
And a crown of bright glory we'll wear.

title:
'Desae Bi Nni S'ro Ho
There'll Be No Nights There
songEN:
'Desae bi nni s'ro hx,
Man a wxahy'ra no mu;
Dwunmaden ne xbrq nni hx,
Qhx yq xdx nko.

RNnyeso
Aw'rqhow remma hx,
Aw'rqhow remma hx;
Xdx nko na qwx s'ro hx,
Aw'rqhow remma hx.

Yawdi bi nni s'ro hx,
Xbra yq 'nigye nko;
Nusu yq kan nneqma no bi,
Ne nyinaa atwam kx.

Bxne bi nni s'ro hx,
Monhwq hy'rafo dxm no;
Wxn nyinaa hyq ntade fitaa,
Na wxto dwon kronkron.
songTWI:
There'll be no night in heaven,
In that blest world above;
No anxious toil, no weary hours;
For labor there is love.

Refrain
There'll be no sorrow there,
There'll be no sorrow there;
In heaven above, where all is love,
There'll be no sorrow there.

There'll be no grief in heaven;
For life is one glad day,
And tears are those of former things
Which all have passed away.

There'll be no sin in heaven;
Behold that blessed throng,
All holy in there spotless robes,
All holy in their song.

title:
Meyq 'Hxho Ne Xkwantuni
I'm A Pilgrim
songEN:
Meyq 'hxho ne xkwantuni
Metumi atwqn anadwo biako pq;
Mma munnsiw me kwan, 'fisq merekx
Faako a nsuten sen' mm'resanten ny'naa.

Nnyeso
Meyq 'hxho ne xkwantuni,
Metumi atwqn anadwo biako pq.

Qhx na 'nuonyam hy'rqn b're biara;
O me koma yi, me koma yi wx hx,
Xman a ayq sum ne 'w'rqhow yi,
Me nko mamante akyq na mabrq.

Qhx ne kųro a merekx so n',
Me Gyefo no, me Gyefo no ne ne hann;
'W'rqhowdi anaa 'pinisi nni hx,
Nusu nni hx na owu nso nni hx.

title:
Meyq 'Hxhx Wx Ha
I'm But a Stranger Here

Hwq 'Nuonyam Bi a Qrepwe
Lo, What a Glorious Sight Appears
songEN:
Hwq 'nuonyam bi a qrepue Wx yqn ani so ha!
Asase ne po ny'naa atwam, Qne kan soro no,
Qne kan soro no, Qne kan soro no,
Asase ne po ny'naa atwan Qne kan soro no.

Nnyeso
O, qbqyq 'nigye, 'nigye, 'nigye,
O, qbqyq 'nigye;
B're a yqrentetewm' bio,
B're a yqrentetewm' bio wx
Kanaan mpoano hx;
Yqbqtra Yesu nan ase,
B're a yqrentetewm' bio.

Abxfo no di ah'rusi, Na dxm no to dwom sq,
Adasamma, monhwq mo Hen' A Xresian nō agua,
A Xresian nō agua, A Xresian nō agua,
Adasamma, monhwq mo Hen' A Xresian nō agua.

N'ankasa nsa bqpopa wxn Aniwam nusu ny'naa;
Na yaw, apini, suro ne Wu ankasa betwam,
Wų ankasa betwam, Wu ankasa betwam;
Na yaw, apini, suro ne Wu ankasa betwam,

'Gyenkwa pa, enkosi da bqn Na saa dxn yi bqteqn?
Mm're, tu mm'rika na kx ntqmntem
Kxfa da pa no bra,
Kxfa da pa no bra, Kxfa da pa no bra;
Mm're, tu mm'rika na kx ntqmntem
Kxfa da pa no bra.
songTWI:
Lo, what a glorious sight appears
To our believing eyes!
The earth and seas are passed away
And the old rolling skies.
And the old rolling skies,
And the old rolling skies;
The earth and seas are passed away,
And the old rolling skies.

Refrain
O that will be joyful, joyful, joyful!
O that will be joyful
When we meet to part no more!
When we meet to part no more
On Canaan's happy shore;
'Tis there we'll meet at Jesus' feet,
When we meet to part no more!

Attending angels shout for joy
And the bright armies sing-
Mortals! Behold the sacred seat
Of your descending King.
Of your descending King,
Of your descending King;
Mortals! Behold the sacred seat
Of your descending King.

His own soft hand shall wipe the tears
From every weeping eye;
And pains, and groans, and griefs, and fears,
And death itself shall die!
And death itself shall die,
And death itself shall die;
And pains, and groans, and griefs, and fears,
And death itself shall die.

How long, dear Savior! Oh, how long
Shall this bright hour delay?
Fly swifter round, ye wheels of time!
And bring the welcome day.
And bring the welcome day,
And bring the welcome day;
Fly swifter round, ye wheels of time!
And bring the welcome day.

title:
Fi Tete Na Wxabx Nguankuw
Long Upon the Mountains

B're Bqn Na Mehu Yesu Ne No
O, When Shall I See Jesus
songEN:
B're bqn na mehu Yesu ne No adi hen' s'ro,
Na mate t'robqnto nne anxpa no?
Mqnom daa dx nsu afi asubxnten no mu,
Na mate t'robqnto nee anxpa no.

Nnyeso
Monteam, 'nuonyam! Efisq mqf'ro akx s'ro
B'rč a mete t'robqnto nee anxpa no.

Hyq 'sqmpa akode, gyidi, 'nidaso ne dx,
Na woate t'robqnto nee anxpa no;
Na sq 'ko no kx awiei a, Xde w'akx s'ro,
Na woate t'robqnto nee anxpa no.

Yqn aso bqte xs'ro dxm dwonto anigyem,
Na yqate t'robqnto nee anxpa no;
Yqn tqkrqma bqto yqn daa Hen' no anuonyam,
Na yqate t'robqnto nee anxpa no.
songTWI:
O, when shall I see Jesus and reign with Him above,
And shall hear the trumpet sound in that morning?
And from the flowing fountain drink everlasting love,
And shall hear the trumpet sound in that morning.

Refrain
O, shout, glory! For I shall mount above the skies,
When I hear the trumpet sound in that morning.

Gird on the gospel armor of faith and hope and love,
nd you'll hear the trumpet sound in that morning.
And when the combat's ended He'll carry you above,
And you'll hear the trumpet sound in that morning.

Our ears shall hear with transport the host of heaven sing,
And shall hear the trumpet sound in that morning.
Our tongues shall chant the glories of our immortal King.
And shall hear the trumpet sound in that morning,

title:
Ahotx 'Sase Bi Wx Hx
Never Part Again
songEN:
Ahotx 'sase bi wx hx,
Nea dqw ahyq hx ma;
'Dekyee nkutoo, 'nadwo nni hx,
'Hx 'nigye tu yaw ny'naa.

Nnyeso
Yqr'ko Immanuel 'sase so,
Qrenkyq t'robqnto bebom,
Na yqne Yesu adi hen'
A yerenni ntetewmu bio.
So yqbqtew mu bio?
Yqrentetew mu da!
So yqbqtew mu bio?
Yqrentetew mu da;
Na yqne Yesu adi hen!
A yqrenni ntetewmu bio.

Qhx na daa nkwa nsuten ne
Nhwiren a entwan wx;
Kwan tiaa bi n'qda s'ro 'sase n'
Ne fam ha de yi ntam.

Sq yetum' gyina nea Mose
Gyina hwqq 'sase nō a
Wiase b'ribiara rentumi
Ntwe yqn sq hx de no.
songTWI:
There is a land of pure delight,
Where bliss eternal reigns,
Infinite day excludes the night
And pleasures banish pain.

Refrain
We're trav'ling to Immanuel's land,
We soon shall hear the trumpet sound,
And soon we shall with Jesus reign,
And never, never part again.
What! Never part again? No, never part again,
What! Never part again? No, never part again,
And soon we shall with Jesus reign,
And never, never part again.

There everlasting spring abides,
And never with'ring flowers,
And but a little space divides
This heav'nly land from ours.

Could we but stand where Moses stood,
And view the landscape o'er,
Not all this world's pretended good
Could ever charm us more.

title:
Sion Fqfq a Wxayq No S'ro
Beautiful Zion Built Above
songEN:
Sion Fqfq a wxayq no s'ro
Kuro fqfq a medx no;
Nhene pa apon fqfq,
Dan fqfq, Nyame ne ne hann.
Nnua a qyq fq wx hx daa,
Qsow aba fqfq daa daa;
Asubxnten fqfq sen hx,
Nsuti fqfq no renwe da.
'Henkyqw fqfq hyq obiara,
Nkonimdifo no kura brqw;
N-tade fqfq hyehyq wxn
Wxn a wxkx hx ny'naa ho tew.
songTWI:
Beautiful Zion, built above,
Beautiful city that I love,
Beautiful gates of pearly white,
Beautiful temple, God its light.
Beautiful trees forever there,
Beautiful fruit they always bear,
Beautiful rivers gliding by, 
Beautiful fountains never dry.
Beautiful crowns on every brow,
Beautiful palms the conquerors show,
Beautiful robes the ransomed wear,
Beautiful all who enter there.

title:
Momma Yemmom Ntra
Together Let Us Sweetly Live
songEN:
Momma yemmom ntra xdqw mu,
Me nan si kwan so rekx Kanaan;
Momma yqnka mmom nnx Yesu,
Me nan si kwan so rekx Kanaan.

Nnyeso
O Kanaan, Kanaan Pa,
Me nan si kwan so rekx Kanaan;
O Kanaan, qyq m'anigye fie,
Me nan si kwan so rekx Kanaan.

Momma yemmom nwqn wx mpaebom
Me nan si kwan so rekx Kanaan;
Na yqntwqn nkwagye da pa no,
Me nan si kwan so rekx Kanaan.

Yqn 'yeyi dwom bqhyq S'ro ma
Me nan si kwan so rekx Kanaan
B're a yqn nigye bqk'rxn no
Me nan si kwan so rekx Kanaan.

title:
Xs'ro Dwom Bqn Na Egyigye Po So Yi
What Heavenly Music
songEN:
Xs'ro dwon bqn na egyigye po so yi;
Dwon dqdq bi a qkanyan atenka,
Qyq 'bxfo nne a qnam mframa mu brqoo,
Wxreto dwon yi ama me akwaaba.

Migyina Yordan agya agyen m'ani,
Mede anigyina atene me nsa;
Soma abxfodxm, 'W'ra Yesu, mesrq Wo!
Ma menka wxn ho nto bi na fa me kx.

Ewon sum nq nsu no so, na 's'rxkye bx,
Nanso Yesu pene a mqfa mu dwoo;
Efisq xs'ro dwom no afa me dommum,
Qsq sq mefra mu bi na ma menkx.
songTWI:
What heavenly music steals over the sea!
Entrancing the senses like sweet melody!
'Tis the voice of the angels borne soft on the air;
For me they are singing; their welcome I hear.

On the banks of old Jordan, here gazing I stand,
And earnestly longing, I stretch forth my hand;
Send a convoy of angels, dear Jesus, I pray!
Let me join that sweet music; come, take me away.

Though dark are the waters and rough is the wave,
If Jesus permit, the wild surges I'll brave;
For that heavenly music hath ravished me so,
I must join in that chorus! I'll go! let me go!

title:
Yqate Afi 'Sase Kronkron No So
We Have Heard
songEN:
Yqate afi 'sase kronkron no so,
Yqare na yqn koma di dqw
'Fise na yqyq 'kwantufo kuw,
A yqabrq, di awerqhow
Wxka sq ahotefo wx fie bi-
Yqnyq adedamfikyi bio;
Yenim sq 'sase no yq 'sase pa
Nea nkwa nsuo sen hx daa.

Wxka sq nwųra frxmfrxm di ahim hx,
Qyq nea entumi nkisa;
Anweatam dan asesa bere
Na Saron nhwiren nyin frxmfrxm,
Nnomaa pii a wxn ho yq fq wx hx,
Wxn nnwom yq dq, yq anigye;
Wxn nne nnyigyei yq foforo daa daa,
'Bxfo sanku gye so.

Yqate berqw ne ntade, ne nhenkyqw
Ne dwontofo 'hoxfqfo nka;
Kuro papāa n'apon yq 'bopa
A ne nyinaa de hann hyerqn;
Yqate abxfo ne 'hotefo nka,
Wxde sika sanku to nnwom
Fa bepx ne nkwa dua no ne nhaban
A qsa yare ho.

Saa xman no mu Hene ho yq fq,
Xne beae no dqw ne ne hann,
Yebehu No hx N'ahoxfq mu,
Yqbqsqpqw yqn ho N'anim,
Qrenkyq, qrenkyq yebedu hx,
Yqne ahotefo bebom;
Yebenya berqw, ntade, ne nhenkyqw,
Na yqahome dapen.
songTWI:
We have heard from the bright, the holy, land;
We have heard, and our hearts are glad;
For we were a lonely pilgrim band,
And weary, and worn, and sad.
They tell us the saints have a dwelling there-
No longer are Indexless ones;
And we know that the goodly land is fair,
Where life's pure river runs.

They say green fields are waving there,
That never a blight shall know;
And the deserts wild are blooming fair,
And the roses of Sharon grow.
There are lovely birds in the bowers green,
Their songs are blithe and sweet;
And their warblings, gushing ever new,
The angels' harpings greet.

We have heard of the palms, the robes, the crowns,
And the silvery band in white;
Of the city fair, with pearly gates,
All radiant with light.
We have heard of the angels there, and saints,
With their harps of gold, how they sing;
Of the mount with the fruitful tree of life,
Of the leaves that healing bring.

The King of that country, He is fair,
He's the joy and light of the place;
In His beauty we shall behold Him there,
And bask in His smiling face,
We'll be there, we'll be there in a little while,
We'll join the pure and the blest;
We'll have the palm, the robe, the crown,
And forever be at rest.

title:
So Wunhu Sq Yesu Reba
Don't You See My Jesus Coming?
songEN:
So wunhu sq Yesu reba
Wx soro munumkum mu?
Abxfo mpempem ka Ne ho,
Hwq sq wxatwa Ne ho 'hyia!

Nnyeso
Merekx ahenni nom,
Wo ne me bqkx 'nuonyam mu?
Haleluya! Kamfo Aw'rade.

Wunhu sq hotefo rekx?
Tie sq wxreteam wx wim,
Yesu serew, t'robqnto bom,
Wobenya N'anuonyam bi.
songTWI:
Don't you see my Jesus coming,
See Him come in yonder cloud?
With ten thousand angels round Him,
How they do my Jesus crowd!

Refrain
I am bound for the kingdom,
Will you go to glory with me?
Hallelujah! O praise ye the Lord!

I am bound for the kingdom,
Will you go to glory with me?
Hallelujah! O praise ye the Lord!

Don't you see the saints ascending,
Hear them shouting thro' the air.
Jesus smiling, trumpets sounding,
Now His glory they shall share.

I am bound for the kingdom,
Will you go to glory with me?
Hallelujah! O praise ye the Lord!

title:
Daa Dx a Qso Nte Da No
Immortal Love, Forever Full
songEN:
Daa Dx a qso nte da no,
Qsen kwa da biara;
Wxkyq no daa, nso qso nte
Po a qnwe da no.

Yerentumi nkx s'ro nkxfa
'W'ra Kristo mma fam ha;
Yqbreq kwa hwehwe No 'bun mu
Fisq 'bun ntum' nkōra No

Nanso Xwx 'dwo ne tema
Xyq mprempren boafo;
Gyidi wx Ne Ngo bepx so
Dx wx Ne Galilee.

N'atade mu yaresa no
Bqn yqn yare mpa no;
Yqde yqn nsa ka No mpo a,
Yenya ayaresa.

Mpae a edi kan fa Ne so,
Yqn mmxfrab'rem' de no;
Wxn a wxda wu mpa so mpo
De Ne din dx wu mu.

O, yqn nyinaa Awurade
Din biarā a yqwx no,
Efi Wo hx, yqte Wo frq;
Yqhwq W'bra bx yqn de.
songTWI:
Immortal Love, forever full,
Forever flowing free,
Forever shared, forever whole,
A never ebbing sea!

We nay not climb the heavenly steeps
To bring the Lord Christ down;
In vain we search the lowest deeps,
For him no depths can drown.

But warm, so tender, even yet
A present help is He;
And faith has still its Olivet,
And love its Galilee.

The healing of His seamless dress
Is by our beds of pain;
We touch Him in life's throng and press,
And we are whole again.

Through Him the first fond prayers are said,
Our lips of childhood frame;
The last low whispers of our dead
Are burdened with His name.

O Lord and Master of us all:
Whate'er our names or sign,
We own Thy sway, we hear Thy call,
We test our lives by Thine!

title:
Mewx Adamfo Pa Bi
My Lord and I
songEN:
Mewx Adamfo pa bi,
Xsom me bo bebree;
Xwx ayamhyehye ma me,
Xdx me nokwarem';
Xnka me hō a mentumi ntra,
Me kxn dx sq Xbqn me,
Enti me ne No tra bom,
Me ne me W'ra.

Qtx dā a na mabotow,
Onim sq meyq mm'rqw,
Mede dqw hwehwq Ne hx mmoa,
Fisq Xpe no saa;
Xde me fa hann kwan no so,
Owia ntremu ase,
Enti me ne No tra bom,
Me ne me W'ra.

Meka m'awerqhow ne
M'anigye ny'naa ky'rq No,
Meka nea qsx m'ani ne,
'Bufuwsqm ny'naa kyrq No;
Xky'rq me nea 'sq sq meyq,
Xma me nkuranhyq,
Enti yedi nkxmmx bom,
Me ne me W'ra.

Onim sq mepere sq
Mqgye kra brqfo bi,
Xhyq me sq menkx nkxka
Xdx nsqm no mma No,
Na menka N'awanwa dx ne
Nea 'nti Owui no nky'rq;
Enti yqyq 'dwuma bom,
Me ne me W'ra.
songTWI:
I have a Friend so precious,
So very dear to me,
He loves me with such tender love,
He loves so faithfully;
I could not live apart from Him,
I love to feel Him nigh,
And so we dwell together,
My Lord and I.

Sometimes I'm faint and weary,
He knows that I am weak,
And as He bids me lean on Him,
His help I gladly seek;
He leads me in the paths of light,
Beneath a sunny sky,
And so we walk together,
My Lord and I.

I tell Him all my sorrows,
I tell Him all my joys,
I tell Him all that pleases me,
I tell Him what annoys;
He tells me what I ought to do,
He tells me how to try,
And so we talk together,
My Lord and I.

He knows that I am longing
Some weary soul to win,
And so He bids me go and speak
The loving word for Him;
He bids me tell His wondrous love,
And why He came to die,
And so we work together,
My Lord and I.

title:
Medx Sq Mqka 'Sqm No
I Love To Tell The Story
songEN:
Medx sq mqka 'sqm no,
S'ro nneqma a wonhu;
Yesu ne N'anuonyam no
Jesu ne Ne dx no.
Medx sq mqka 'sqm no,
'Fisq qyq nokwar';
Ema m'ahwehwqde a
B'ribi fof'ro ntum' mma.

Nnyeso
Medx sq mqka 'sqm no
Qbqyq m'anuonyamsqm
Sq mqka tetesqm no,
Yesu ne Ne dx no.

Medx sq mqka 'sqm no,
Qyq 'nwanwade a
Qkyqn nsusui pā a yehu
Wx adaeso nyinaam';
Medx sq mqka 'sqm no;
Ayq bi ama me,
Enti na mereka no
Seesei aky'rq wo no.

Medx sq mqka 'sqm no,
Ne ka yq m'anigye;
B're biara a mqka no
Qma xdqw mm'roso;
Medx sq mqka 'sqm no,
'Fisq binom nnya ntee
Nkwagyesqm no a efi
Nyame nnwuma mu no.

Medx sq mqka 'sqm no,
'Fisq wxn a wonim
Mpo ho pere wxn te sq
Wxn a wxntee da no;
Na meto dwom fof'ro no
Wx anuonyam mu a,
Qbqyq tetesqm a
Madx no mpqm pii no.
songTWI:
I love to tell the story
Of unseen things above,
Of Jesus and his glory,
Of Jesus and his love.
I love to tell the story,
Because I know 'tis true;
It satisfies my longings
As nothing else can do.

Refrain
I love to tell the story,
'twill be my theme in glory,
To tell the old, old story
Of Jesus and his love.

I love to tell the story;
More wonderful it seems
Than all the golden fancies
Of all our golden dreams.
I love to tell the story,
It did so much for me;
And that is just the reason
I tell it now to thee.

I love to tell the story;
'tis pleasant to repeat what seems,
Each time I tell it,
More wonderfully sweet.
I love to tell the story,
For some have never heard
The message of salvation
From God's own holy Word.

I love to tell the story,
For those who know it best
Seem hungering and thirsting
To hear it like the rest.
And when, in scenes of glory,
I sing the new, new song,
'twill be the old, old story
That I have loved so long.

title:
Ma MemmxW' Pii Kristo
More Love to Thee

Sq 'Yef'rokun 'Te Ne Nk'rxfom'
As the Bridegroom to His Chosen
songEN:
Sq 'yef'rokun 'te ne nk'rxfom',
Xhen' te wx ne man mu,
Xwqnfo te wx aban mu,
Hyqnkafo, af'rė anim no,
Wote saa ma me, 'W'ra.

Sq nsuti te ma turow no
Kanea te wx esum mu,
'Gyapade te wx korabea,
Mana, apam 'dakam' no,
Wote saa ma me, 'W'ra.

Sq nhenepa te ne tebeam',
Qwox te wx ne kyqm mu,
Sqnea hann te kanea mu na
Agya te wx ofie no,
Wote saa ma me, 'W'ra.

Sq owia hann te wx ewim,
Sunsum te wx ahwehwqm',
Nnuaba te wx b'rxdoma so,
Bosu te nwura so no,
Wote saa ma me, 'W'ra.
songTWI:
As the bridegroom to his chosen,
As the king to his realm,
As the keep unto the castle,
As the pilot to the helm,
So, Lord, art Thou to me.

As the fountain in the garden,
As the candle in the dark,
As the treasure in the coffer,
As the manna in the ark,
So, Lord, art Thou to me.

As the ruby in the setting,
As the honey in the comb,
As the light within the lantern,
As the father in the Index,
So, Lord, art Thou to me.

As the sunshine in the heavens,
As the image in the glass,
As the fruits up in the fig tree,
As the dew upon the grass,
So, Lord, art Thou to me.

title:
Sqnea Nsu Dwudwo Sukxm
As Water to the Thirsty
songEN:
Sqnea nsu dwudwo sukxm,
'Niwa hwq 'fqfqde,
'Hoxden di mm'rqwyq akyi
Nokwar' sė at'ro anan;
Dwonto ne fefq mm're
Hwq huhub're kwan no,
Sq m'Aw'rade Teasefo no
Te ma me nso ne no.

Sq ap'rep're ano dwo,
'Somdwoe di yaw akyi,
Ntetewmdi akyi nhyiamdi,
'Sutx akyi 'wihy'rqn,
Xsram ne ns'romma hann
Ne po so 'wia hann no,
Sq m'Aw'rade Teasefo no,
Te ma me nso ne no.

Sq nna di 'hoxmm'rq akyi,
Sika pa sen dxte,
Nnommum akyi 'hofadi,
Owipuei ma 'dekyee;
Ofie ma 'kwantuni
Ne nea xtwqn ny'naa no,
Sq m'Aw'rade Teasefo no,
Te ma me nso ne no.
songTWI:
As water to the thirsty,
As beauty to the eyes,
As strength that follows weakness,
As truth instead of lies;
As songtime and springtime
And summertime to be,
So is my Lord, my living Lord,
So is my Lord to me.

Like calm in place of clamor
Like peace that follows pain,
Like meeting after parting,
Like sunshine after rain;
Like moonlight and starlight
And sunlight on the sea,
So is my Lord, my living Lord,
So is my Lord to me.

As sleep that follows fever,
As gold instead of grey,
As freedom after bondage,
As sunrise to the day;
As Index to the trav'ler
And all he longs to see,
So is my Lord, my Living Lord to me.

title:
Me Kra Yq Komm: Aw'rade Wx W'afa
Be Still, My Soul
songEN:
Me kra yq komm: Aw'rade wx w' afa,
Fa boasetx soa wo yaw 'sqnnua no;
MaW' Nyame kwan ma Xnhyehyq w'akwan,
Nsakrae biara mu no Xnsea da;
Me kra yq komm: Wo s'ro 'Damfo pa no
Bqma woanya awiei pa wx haw mu.

Me kra yq komm: Wo Nyame no kura
Daakyem' sqnea W'ayq nea atwan no;
Mma b'ribiara nwosow w'anidaso,
Seesie 'hintasqm ny'naa mu bqda hx;
Me kra yq komm: 'srxkye ne ahum nim
Nea Odii wxn so ha b're bi no nne.

Me kra yq komm: na b're no rebqn sq
Yqne Aw'rade bqtra afebxx;
Brč a basmtu, yaw ne suro 'twan kx,
'W'rqhow asa; dx mu dqw aba bio
Me kra yq komm: nusu ne nsakrae twā a,
B'rč a wxahy'ra yqn no, yebehyia mu bio.
songTWI:
Be still, my soul: the Lord is on thy side;
Bear patiently the cross of grief or pain;
Leave to thy God to order and provide;
In every change He faithful will remain.
Be still, my soul: thy best, thy heavenly friend
Through thorny ways leads to a joyful end.

Be still, My soul: thy God doth undertake
To guide the future as He has the past.
Thy hope, thy confidence let nothing shake;
All now mysterious shall be bright at last.
Be still, my soul: when waves and winds still know
His voice who ruled them while He dwelth below.

Be still, my soul: the hour is hastening on
When we shall be forever with the Lord,
When disappointment, grief, and fear are gone,
Sorrow forgot, love's purest joys restored.
Be still, my soul: when change and tears are past,
All safe and blessed we shall meet at last.

title:
Nokwasqm Pa Ni, Yesu Yqm' De
Blessed Assurance, Jesus Is Mine
songEN:
Nokwasqm pa ni, Yesu yqm' de,
O, s'ro anuonyam a maka mahwq;
Nyame atxde, nkwagye dehye
Honhom awo me, wxaguar'm mogyam'.

Nnyeso
M'asqm ara ni, me dwom nso ni,
Mqkamfo m'Agyenkwa daa nyinaa,
M'asqm ara ni, me dwom nso ni,
Mqkamfo m'Agyenkwa daa nyinaa.

Ahofama pa anigye pa!
Xdqw ho aniso-adehu ni:
Abxfo de mmxborxhunu
Ne xdx ho nsqm fi s'ro sian ba.

Ahofama pa, home aba
M'Agyenkwa mu na manya ahotx
Merewqn, retwqn soro
Ne papa mee me, mete Ne dxm'
songTWI:
Blessed assurance, Jesus is mine!
O what a foretaste of glory divine!
Heir of salvation, purchase of God,
Born of his Spirit, washed in his blood.

Refrain
This is my story, this is my song,
Praising my Savior all the day long;
This is my story, this is my song,
Praising my Savior all the day long.

Perfect submission, perfect delight,
Visions of rapture now burst on my sight;
Angels descending bring from above
Echoes of mercy, whispers of love.

Perfect submission, all is at rest;
I in my Savior am happy and blest,
Watching and waiting, looking above,
Filled with his goodness, lost in his love.

title:
Asomdwoe Pa, Bxne Sum Wiase Yim
Peace Perfect Peace
songEN:
Asomdwoe pa, bxne sum wiase yim'?
Yesu mgoya n'qma kra asomdwoe.

Asomdwoe pa, nnwuma abu so yi?
Yesu apqdeyq n'qyq 'home.

Asomdwoe pa yqne adxfo a
Wxwō aky'ri ny'naa wx banbx Yesu mu.

Asombwoe pa, yennim daakye asqm?
Yenim Yesu, Xte N'ahengua so.
songTWI:
Peace, perfect peace,
In this dark world of sin?
The blood of Jesus
Whispers peace within

Peace, perfect peace,
By thronging duties pressed?
To do the will of Jesus;
This is rest.

Peace, perfect peace,
With loved ones far away?
In Jesus' keeping
We are safe, and they,

Peace, perfect peace,
Our future all unknown?
Jesus we know,
And He is on the throne.

title:
Sq Mitumi Hu Me Din No
When I Can Read My Title Clear
songEN:
Sq mitumi hu me din no
Xsoro fie hx a,
Megya ehu biara aky'ri
Mqpopa me nusu;
Mqpopa me nusu,
Mqpopa me nusu,
Megya ehu biara aky'ri,
Mqpopa me nusu.

Sq 'sase sxre tia me kra,
Wxto me agyan a,
Qnde mqs'rew Satan 'bufuw,
Mehyia wiase munu;
Mehyia wiase munu;
Mehyia wiase munu;
Qnde mqs'rew Satan 'bufuw
Ahyia wiase muna.

Ma xhaw mmra sq nsuyiri,
Na amanehum' ntx!
Nanso medu me fie 'hotxm,
Nyame, m'ade nyinaa;
Nyame, m'ade nyinaa,
Nyame, m'ade nyinaa,
Nanso medu me fie 'hotxm
Nyame, m'ade nyinaa;
songTWI:
When I can read my title clear
To mansions in the skies
I'll bid farewell to every fear,
And wipe my weeping eyes;
And wipe my weeping eyes,
And wipe my weeping eyes,
I'll bid farewell to every fear,
And wipe my weeping eyes.

Should earth against my soul engage,
And fiery darts be hurled,
Then I can smile at Satan's rage,
And face a frowning world;
And face a frowning world,
And face a frowning world,
Then I can smile at Satan's rage,
And face a frowning world.

Let cares like a wild deluge come,
And storms or sorrow fall!
May I but safely reach my Index,
May God, my heav'n, my all;
My God. my heav'n, my all,
My God, my heav'n, my all,
May I but safely reach my Index,
My God, my heav'n, my all.

title:
Metee Sq Yesu Nne Ka Sq
I Heard the Voice of Jesus
songEN:
Metee sq Yesu nne ka sq:
"Bra Me nkyqn bqhome;
Fa wo ti bra, wo a woabrq
Fa bqto Me kokom".
Mebaa Yesu nkyqn sq mete'i
Xbrq ne aw'rqhowm';
Minyaa ahomegye Ne mu,
Wama me anigye.

Metee sq Yesu nne ka sq:
"Hwq na Mede nkwa nsu
Ma kwa, wo a sukxm de wo
Koto nom bi nya nkwa".
Na mebaa Yesu nkyqn bqnom
N-kwa asuten no;
Me sukxm gyae na me kra nyan,
Seesei mete Ne Mu.

Metee sq Yesu nne ka sq:
"Mene sum wiase'i hann;
Hwq Me, na w'anxpa bepue
Na wo da ayq hann".
Mehwqq Yesu anim mehuu
Me nsoromma, m'awia,
Mqnante saa nkwa hann no mu
Kosi m'akwantų awiei.
songTWI:
I heard the voice of Jesus say,
"Come unto Me and rest;
Lay down, thou weary one, lay down
Thy head upon My breast."
I came to Jesus as I was,
Weary and worn and sad;
I found in Him a resting place,
And He has made me glad.

I heard the voice of Jesus say,
"Behold, I freely give
The living water; thirsty one,
Stoop down and drink and live."
I came to Jesus, and I drank
Of that life giving stream;
My thirst was quench'd, my soul revived,
And now I live in Him.

I heard the voice of Jesus say,
"I am this dark world's light;
Look unto Me, thy morn shall rise,
And all thy day be bright."
I looked to Jesus, and I found
In Him my star, my sun;
And in that light of life I'll walk,
Till trav'ling days are done.

title:
Anadwo Yi, Wx me Honhom
Wonderful Peace
songEN:
Anadwo yi, wx me honhom bun ase txnn,
Na dwon a qyq dq kyqn so fi;
Egyigye daa te sq dwon a efi soro
Wx me kra so te sq 'somdwoe pa.

Nnyeso
'Somdwoe! 'somdwoe nwanwā a
Efi Agya no nkyqn soro ba;
Mesrq sq betwiw fa me honhom so daa
Wx dx a enni kabea mu.

Hwq 'gyapade a mewx saa 'somdwoe yi mu
Asie wx me kra bun ase pqq,
Tumi biara rentumi mmetutu n'ase
Bere a daapem mfe resen yi!

Minim sq mikodu saa 'somdwoe man no mu,
Na mihu 'somdwoe Wura no a,
Dwom biako a wxn a wxagye wxn no bqto
Wx saa s'ro 'hemman no mu bqyq:

Xkra brqfo a wunni 'nigye ne home,
A wonam xbra kwan fo no so!
Yq 'Gyenkwan' w'adamfo ansa na sum aba;
O gye saa asomdwoe nwanwa yi.
songTWI:
Far away in the depths of my spirit tonight,
Rolls a melody sweeter than psalm;
In celestial like strains it unceasingly falls
O'er my soul like an infinite calm.

Refrain
Peace! Peace! wonderful peace,
Coming down from the Father above;
Sweep over my spirit forever, I pray,
In fathomless billows of love.

What a treasure I have in this wonderful peace,
Buried deep in my inner most soul,
So secure that no power can mine it away,
While the years of eternity roll!

I believe when I rise to that city of peace,
Where the Author of peace I shall see,
That one strain of the song which the ransomed will sing,
In that heavenly kingdom will be—

Weary soul, without gladness or comfort or rest,
Passing down the rough pathway of time!
Make the Savior your friend ere the shadows grow dark;
O accept of this peace so sublime.

title:
N-kaw So! Ma Yqnto Ho Dwom
Life Is Great! So Sing About It
songEN:
N-kwa so! ma yqnto ho dwom,
sqnea 'sq sq yqtumi-
Adan, ahyqn, nkuro, nnipa,
akuraase, mfuw, wuram,
N-kwa so, wxde ama kwa;
N-kwa yq dq na eye.

N-kwa so! nea 'bqsi biara,
Awxm', owiam, 'nigyem', yawm'
Xbrq, wrqhow, anaa huammx
'Manehun' a mintum' nky'rq
N-kwa so, sq obi dx me
Na xsx me nsa frq mč a.

Xdx so! adxfo dx no,
N-sqm brqoo, xdx 'niwa;
Xdx a qhwq mpa no a
Kokoaa dxfo bi da so;
Xdx a babunyq twam a,
Qnsa na enwu da no.

Xdx yq xma ne xgyq-
Wx 'damfo ne 'damfo ntam;
Xdx gye, na qde pirá a
Nitan de ba nyinaa kyq;
Qyq asetram kwan pa bi
A yqsxm' kosi awiei.

Nyame so! Xdxx yqn Kristom,
Bere a yqantumi no,
Nea edii yaw nyaa 'nidaso,
Bere a 'suafo dwanee;
Xdx a edi 'wu so daa.
Kamfo saa 'dx Nipa no.
songTWI:
Life is great! So sing about it,
As we can and as we should—
Shop and buses, towns and people,
Village, farmland, field and wood,
Life is great and life is given;
Life is lovely, free and good.

Life is great!— what ever happens,
Snow or sunshine, joy or pain,
Hardship, grief or disillusion,
Suffering that I can't explain—
Life is great if someone loves me,
Holds my hand and calls my name.

Love is great!— the love of lovers,
Whispered words and longing eyes;
Love that gazes at the cradle
Where a child of loving lies;
Love that lasts when youth has faded,
Bends with age, but never dies.

Love is giving and receiving—
Boy and girl, or friend with friend;
Love is bearing and forgiving
All the hurts that hate can send;
Love's the greatest way of living,
Hoping, trusting to the end.

God is great! in Christ He loved us,
As we should, but never can—
Love that suffered, hoped and trusted
When disciples turned and ran,
Love that broke through death forever.
Praise that loving, living Man!

title:
M'Agya Wx Afie Ne Nsase Bebree
A Child of the King
songEN:
M'Agya wx afie ne nsase bebree;
Wiase yi my adonyade wx Ne nsam!
'Bohemma, dqnkyqmmo, dwetq, sika,
Ahyq N'adan ma, N'ahonya nni ano.

Nnyeso
Meyq 'Hene no ba
Xhene no ba!
Yesu yq m'Agyenkwa 'i,
Meyq 'Hene no ba.

M'Agya n'ara Ba, nnipa, 'Gyenkwa ni,
Bqnantee 'sase so sq wxn mu hiani,
Xredi ma nnebxn'yqfo wx s'ro,
Sq Xba a Xbqma me trabea pa.

Na meyq 'dedamfikyi ne 'hxho,
Xdebxn'yqni ne xmanfrani bi,
Wxayq me xba aky'rqw me din sq
Ofie, atade ne 'henkyqw dedifo.

Xdan anaa xsese, mennwen ho,
Wxresi ahemfie ama me wx hx!
Ewom mafi fie de nanso mqto:
"Nuonyam nka Nyame, meyq Xhen' no ba."
songTWI:
My Father is rich in houses and lands;
He holdeth the wealth of the world in His hands!
Of rubies and diamonds, of silver and gold,
His coffers are full— he has riches untold.

Refrain
I'm a child of the king, a child of the King!
With Jesus, my Savior, I'm a child of the King!

My Father's own Son, the Savior of men,
Once wandered on earth as the poorest of them;
But now He is pleading for sinners on high,
And will give me a Index when He comes by and by.

I once was an outcast, a stranger on earth,
A sinner by choice, and an alien by birth!
But I've been adopted, my name's written down,
An heir to a mansion, a robe, and a crown.

A tent or a cottage, O why should I care?
They're building a palace for me over there!
Though exiled from Index, yet still I may sing:
"All glory to god, I'm a child of the King."

title:
Ayxnkofa Ni, S'ro Anigye Ni
What a Fellowship
songEN:
Ayxnkofa ni, s'ro anigye ni,
Bere a metwer' daa basa no;
N-hyira pa ni, 'somdwoe a mewx
Bere a metwer' daa basa no.

Nnyeso
Metwer' (Yesu) Metwer' (Yesu)
Mewx banbx fi haw nyinaam'
Metwer' (Yesu) Metwer' (Yesu)
Bere a metwer' daa basa no.

Sqnea 'kwantu yi mu nante yq dq
Bere a metwer' daa basa no;
Sqnea 'kwan no mu yq hann da biara,
Bere a metwer' daa basa no.

Dqn na ebetumi ayi me hu
Bere a metwer' daa basa no?
Mewx 'somdwoe pa wx m'Aw'rade nkyqn
Bere a metwer' daa basa no.
songTWI:
What a fellowship, what a joy divine,
Leaning on the everlasting arms;
What a blessedness, what a peace is mine,
Leaning on the everlasting arms.

Refrain
Leaning, leaning, safe and secure from all alarms;
Leaning, leaning, leaning on the everlasting arms.

O how sweet to walk in this pilgrim way,
Leaning on the everlasting arms;
O how bright the path grows from day to day,
Leaning on the everlasting arms.

What have I to dread, what have I to fear,
Leaning on the everlasting arms?
I have blessed peace with my Lord so near,
Leaning on the everlasting arms.

title:
Owia Hann Wx Me Komam' Nnq
There's Sunshine in My Soul Today
songEN:
Owia hann wx me komam' nnq;
Qhyerqn 'nuonyam mu
Kyqn 'wia a qhyerqn wx wim,
'Fisq Yesu nem' hann.

Nnyeso
Owia hann bi (wx me mu)
Nhyira hann bi (wx me mu)
B're a 'somdwoe mm're pa retwam kx
Sq Yesu serew ky'rq me a
Owia hann bi hy'rqn me mu.

Dwom bi wx me koma mu nnq,
Meto ky'rq me Hen' no;
Yesu retie na Xte nnwom
A mintumi nto mpo.

'Hotx b're wx me kommam' nnq,
'Fisq 'W'rade bqn a,
'Somdwo bu'b'ru to dwom memu,
Na xdom nhwiren pue.

Anigye wx me komam' nnq,
Ne 'nidaso ne dx;
Nhyirā a Xde ma me seesei,
Ne s'ro 'nigyq no nti.
songTWI:
There's sunshine in my soul today,
More glorious and bright
Than glows in any earthly sky,
For Jesus is my light.

Refrain
O theres sunshine, blessed sunshine,
When the peaceful, happy moments roll
When Jesus shows His smiling face
There is sunshine in the soul.

Theres music in my soul today,
A carol to my King,
And Jesus, listening, can hear
The songs I cannot sing.

Theres springtime in my soul today,
For when the Lord is near,
The dove of peace sings in my heart,
The flowers of grace appear.

Theres gladness in my soul today,
And hope, and praise, and love,
For blessings which He gives me now,
For joys "laid up" above.

title:
Agya, Ma Yqn W'asomdwoe No
Grant Us your Peace

Etx Dá a Mete Dwom Bi
A Song of Heaven
songEN:
Etx dá a mete dwom bi,
Nea obi ntee bi da,
Sq qnam s'ro apon mu
Resian ba 'sase so;
Qte sq abxfo nne
Anigye ne xdom',
Qhyq dwonto kqse ma
Twa s'ro 'hengua ho hyia.

Nnyeso
O, xsoro dwom dqdq
A wxte fi nohoa,
Xsoro ne fie dwom a
Efi Nyame apon mu.

Qde asomdwoe tene
Fa me kra mu bxkxx,
Sq Onyankopxn nhyira
Ma 'sase so haw gyae,
Qkorxn sen m'frama,
As'rxkye ne po nne;
Na qde anuonyam dwom
Hyq xsoro fie ma.

Dwom yi ba me so daa daa
Sq dae mu ade bi,
Qba te sq xsoro
Mframa ne asuten;
Xdqw hyq me koma ma
Sq b're bi bqba a
Me ne abxfo bqto
Xs'ro ne fie dwom no.
songTWI:
Sometimes I hear strange music,
Like none e'er heard before,
Come floating softly earthward
As thro' heav'n's open door:
It seems like angel voices,
In strains of and love,
That swell the mighty chorus
Around the throne above.

Refrain
O sweet, celestial music,
Heard from a land afar—
The song of Heav'n and homeland,
Thro' doors God leaves ajar!

Now soft, and low, and restful,
It floods my soul with peace,
As if God's benediction
Bade all earth's troubles cease.
Then grander than the voices,
Of wind, and wave, and sea—
It fills the dome of heaven
With glorious harmony.

This music haunts me ever,
Like something heard in dreams—
It seems to catch the cadence
Of heav'nly winds and streams,
My heart is filled with rapture,
To think, some day to come,
I'll sing it with the angels—
The song of heav'n and Index.

title:
Wo Nkyqn Ara Nyame, Wo Knyqn Ara
Nearer My God, to Thee
songEN:
Wo nkyqn ara Nyame, Wo nkyqn ara;
Sq asqnnua mpo na Qma me sō a
Me dwom ara ne sq Wo nkyqn ara, Nyame
Wo nkyqn ara, Nyame Wo nkyqn ara.

Sq mikyinkyin to kwan Ma 'wia kxtx,
Sum duru me so na, Me nnae yq bō a,
M'adaeso mu mqbqn Wo nkyqn ara, Nyame
Wo nkyqn ara, Nyame Wo nkyqn ara.

Ky'rq me kwam, 'namxn a Wxde kx s'ro;
Nea Wode ma me ny'naa Fi xdom mu,
Abxfo frq me ba Wo nkyqn ara Nyame
Wo nkyqn ara, Nyame Wo nkyqn ara.

Me nyan' fi me nna mu á Meyė W'ayq,
Mifi m'aw'rqhow my Ma Betel so;
Mede 'nigy'na ka sq; Wo nkyqn ara Nyame
Wo nkyqn ara, Nyame Wo nkyqn ara.

Mede nigye ntaban Tu kx wim a,
Megyaw 'wia, 'sram, ns'romma Makx soro,
Mqto dwom daā aka sq Wo nkyqn ara Nyame
Wo nkyqn ara Nyame Wo nkyqn ara.

title:
Fa Yesu Din Bata Wo Ho
Take the Name of Jesus With You
songEN:
Fa Yesu din bata wo ho,
Mmxb'rxni werqhowni;
Qbqma wo aw'rqkyekye
Nea wokx biara, fa kx.

Nnyeso
O din pa, qyq dq!
Ha 'nidaso ne s'ro dqw;
O din pa, qyq dq!
Ha 'nidaso ne s'ro dqw.

Fa Yesu din no yq wo kyqm,
Wx m'firi nyinaa ho;
Sq sxhwq twa wo ho hyia a
Bx mpae din kronkron no mu.

O, Yesu din a qsom bo!
Qde dqw hyq yqn kra ma;
Sq xgye yqn Ne nsa so a,
Yqbqto Ne ho dwom yie.

Yqbebx mpae Yesu din mu,
Akoto Ne nan ase;
YqbqhyqN' ahen mu Hen' s'ro
B'rč a 'kwantu yi to betwa.
songTWI:
Take the name of Jesus with you,
Child of sorrow and of woe;
It will joy and comfort give you,
Take it, where'er you go.

Refrain
Precious name
Hope of earth and joy of heaven;
O how sweet!
Hope of earth and joy of heaven.

Take the name of Jesus ever,
As a shield from every snare;
If temptations round you gather,
Breathe that holy name in prayer.

O the precious name of Jesus!
How it thrills our souls with joy,
When His loving arms receive us,
And His songs our tongues employ!

At the name of Jesus bowing,
Falling prostrate at His feet,
King of kings in heaven we'll crown Him,
When our journey is complete.

title:
'Yaresa 'D'ru Wx Gilead a
Balm in Gilead
songEN:
Nnyeso
'Yaresa 'd'ru wx Gilead a,
Qsa pėrafo yare;
'Yaresa 'd'ru wx Gilead a,
Qsa kra no yare.

Mitumi nya abasamtu
Dwen sq m'adw'ma yq kwa;
Nanso Honhom Kronkron no ba
Bqkanyan me kra bio.

Sq wuntum' nka 'sqm sq Petro,
Mmx mpae sq Paulo a,
Wubetum' aka Yesu dx n'
S'Owu maa nnipa ny'naa.
songTWI:
Refrain
There is a balm in Gilead
To make the wounded whole;
There is a balm in Gilead
To heal the sin-sick soul.

Sometimes I feel discouraged,
And think my work's in vain,
But then the Holy Spirit
Revives my soul again.

If you can not preach like Peter,
If you can not pray like Paul,
You can tell the love of Jesus,
And say He died for all.

title:
Woyi Nnesoa Nyinaa Wx Kalbre
'W'rqhow Ahyq B're Biara Ma
Burdens Are Lifted at Calvary
songEN:
'W'rqhow ahyq b're biara ma,
Koma nyinaa 'tx bčraw;
Kalbre na woyi nnesoa nyinaa
Yesu bqn yie ara.

Nnyeso
Woyi nnesoa nyinaa wx Kalbre
Kalbre hx, Kalbre hx;
Woyi nnesoa nyinaa wx Kalbre,
Yesu bqn yie ara.

Fa wo haw to Yesu so nnq,
Gyaw dwennwen ne suro;
Kalbre na woyi nnesoa nyinaa
Yesu bqn yie ara.

Xkra b'rqfo, 'Gyenkwa no hu
Yaw ne nusu biara;
Kalbre na woyi nnesoa nyinaa
Yesu bqn yie ara.
songTWI:
Days are filled with sorrow and care,
Hearts are lonely and drear;
Burdens are lifted at Calvary,
Jesus is very near.

Refrain
Burdens are lifted at Calvary,
Calvary, Calvary;
Burdens are lifted at Calvary,
Jesus is very near.

Cast your care on Jesus today,
Leave your worry and fear;
Burdens are lifted at Calvary,
Jesus is very near.

Troubled soul, the Savior can see
Every heartache and tear;
Burdens are lifted at Calvary,
Jesus is very near.

title:
Mo 'W'rqhowfo Mommra Nea
Come, Ye Disconsolate
songEN:
Mo 'w'rqhowfo mommra nea mowx biara;
Mommqkotow dom 'hengua no anim;
Momfa mo yaw koma no mmqka mo haw,
'W'rqhow bi nni fam ha a s'ro ntum' nsa.

Mwxb'rxfo angiye, akwantofo hann'
Wxn a wxsakra 'nidaso kronkron!
Okyigyinafo no ka no bxkxx sq;
'W'rqhow bi nni fam ha a soro ntum' nsa.

Hwq Nkwa 'Bodoo no, hwq nsu a qresen
Fi Nyame ahengua no mu fi s'ro,
Mommra 'dx ponto ase, b'rč a monim sq,
'W'rqhow bi nni fam ha a s'ro ntum' nsa.
songTWI:
Come, ye disconsolate, where'er ye languish.
Come to the mercy seat, fervently kneel.
Here bring your wounded hearts, here tell your anguish;
Earth has no sorrow that heaven cannot heal.

Joy of the desolate, light of the straying,
Hope of the penitent, fadeless and pure!
Here speaks the Comforter, tenderly saying,
"Earth has no sorrow that heaven cannot cure."

Here see the bread of life; waters flowing
Forth from the throne of God, pure from above.
Come to the feast of love; come, ever knowing
Earth has no sorrow but heaven can remove.

title:
Mpaebx B're Pā a
Sweet Hour of Prayer
songEN:
Mpaebx b're pa, mpaebx b're pā a
Qfrqm' fi wiase dadwen mu,
Sq memfa m'ahiade nyinaa
Mmra m'Agya 'hengua no anim!
'W'rqhow ne basamtu b're mu
Me kra nya 'hotx wx Wo mu;
Miguan' fi sxhwqfo no mf'rim
B'rč a wosan ba, mpaebx b're pa.

Mpaebx b're pa, mpaebx b're pa,
Wo ntaban bqsoa m'adesrq,
Akx Nokwafo a Ohy'ra
Xkra a xretwqn no nkyqn;
B'rč a Xse me sq menhwehwq
N'anim, minnye N'asqm nni no,
Mede me haw ny'naa bqma No,
Na matwqn wo, mpaebx b're pa.

Mpaebx b're pa, mpaebx b're pa!
Ma miinya w'aw'rqkyekye no,
Kosi sq mifi Pisga so
Behu me fie, matu akx;
Mede honam a qmp'rx da
Mqkx akxgye 'katua no;
B'rč a menam wim no mqteam sq
"Makra wo, O, mpaebx b're pa!"
songTWI:
Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
that calls me from a world of care,
and bids me at my Father's throne
make all my wants and wishes known.
In seasons of distress and grief,
my soul has often found relief,
and oft escaped the tempter's snare
by thy return, sweet hour of prayer!

Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
thy wings shall my petition bear
to him whose truth and faithfulness
engage the waiting soul to bless.
And since he bids me seek his face,
believe his word, and trust his grace,
I'll cast on him my every care,
and wait for thee, sweet hour of prayer!

Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
May I thy consolation share
Till from Mount Pisgah's lofty height
I view my Index and take my flight.
In my immortal flesh I'll rise
To size the everlasting prize.
And shout while passing through the air,
"Farewell, farewell, sweet hour of prayer!"

title:
O Yq Komm
Tiatia Brqoo
Tread Softly
songEN:
O, yq komm, O, yq komm,
Nne bi kasa brqoo;
Yq komm na tie, mā asqm
Biara nsom wo bo.

Nnyeso
Tiatia brqoo (ha) tiatia brqoo (ha)
Ow'ra no wx ha;
Tiatia brqoo (ha) tiatia brqoo (ha)
Xse yqmmqn No.

O, yq komm, O, yq komm,
Qha yq kronkron;
Afxr'muká a qka
Xdom asqm no.

O, yq komm, O, yq komm,
Bx yqn mpae no brqoo;
Yqka Eden hwq wx
Saa bere yi mu.

O, yq komm, O, yq komm,
Kan N'ahummxb'rx;
O, yq komm, O, yq komm,
Na twqn Aw'rade.
songTWI:
Be silent, be silent,
A whisper is heard;
Be silent, and listen,
Oh treasure each word.

Refrain
Tread softly, tread softly,
The Master is here;
Tread softly, tread softly,
He bids us draw near.

Be silent, be silent,
For holy this place,
This altar that echoes
The message of grace.

Be silent, be silent,
Breathe humbly our prayer;
A foretaste of Eden
This moment we share.

Be silent, be silent,
His mercy record;
Be silent, be silent,
And wait on the Lord.

title:
Aw'rade, Amansan Agya
Dear Lord and Father
songEN:
Aw'rade, amansan Agya
Fa yqn bxne kyq yqn;
Na fa adwen pa hyq yqn ma,
Ma yqmfa xbra kronn nsom Wo,
Mfa 'nidi nyi W'ayq.

Ma yqmfa 'hotoso pa sq
Wxn a wxtee 'W'rade
Frq no wx Siria po ho no;
Ma yqnyq sq wxn ara pq,
N-sxre nni W'akyi

'Homegye da wx Galilee
Mmepx atifi hx;
Nea Yesu koto ne Wo dii
Daa nkwa ho nkitaho kommyqm'
A efi dx mu no.

Tx Wo kommyq bosu pa no
Kosi yqn ko n'awiei;
Yi brq ne haw fi yqn kra mu,
Na yqmfi xbra pa mu nka
W'asomdwoe ahoxfq.

Home W'ayaressa d'ru no
Gu yqn apqde so;
Ma 'tenka nnyae, na honam nna;
Kasa fi 'gya ne mframa mu,
'Somdwoe nne ketewa.
songTWI:
Dear Lord and Father of mankind,
Forgive our foolish ways;
Reclothe us in our rightful mind,
In purer lives thy service find,
In deeper reverence, praise.

In simple trust like theirs who heard,
Beside the Syrian sea,
The gracious calling of the Lord,
Let us, like them, without a word,
Rise up and follow thee.

O sabbath rest by Galilee,
O calm of hills above,
Where Jesus knelt to share with thee
The silence of eternity,
Interpreted by love!

Drop thy still dews of quietness,
Till all our strivings cease;
Take from our souls the strain and stress,
And let our ordered lives confess
The beauty of thy peace.

Breathe through the heats of our desire
Thy coolness and thy balm;
Let sense be dumb, let flesh retire;
Speak through the earthquake, wind, and fire,
O still, small voice of calm.

title:
Aw'rade, Amansan Agya
Dear Lord and Father
songEN:
Aw'rade, amansan Agya
Fa yqn bxne kyq yqn;
Na fa adwen pa hyq yqn ma,
Ma yqmfa xbra kronn nsom Wo,
Mfa 'nidi nyi W'ayq.

Ma yqmfa 'hotoso pa sq
Wxn a wxtee 'W'rade
Frq no wx Siria po ho no;
Ma yqnyq sq wxn ara pq,
N-sxre nni W'akyi

'Homegye da wx Galilee
Mmepx atifi hx;
Nea Yesu koto ne Wo dii
Daa nkwa ho nkitaho kommyqm'
A efi dx mu no.

Tx Wo kommyq bosu pa no
Kosi yqn ko n'awiei;
Yi brq ne haw fi yqn kra mu,
Na yqmfi xbra pa mu nka
W'asomdwoe ahoxfq.

Home W'ayaressa d'ru no
Gu yqn apqde so;
Ma 'tenka nnyae, na honam nna;
Kasa fi 'gya ne mframa mu,
'Somdwoe nne ketewa.
songTWI:
Dear Lord and Father of mankind,
Forgive our foolish ways;
Reclothe us in our rightful mind,
In purer lives thy service find,
In deeper reverence, praise.

In simple trust like theirs who heard,
Beside the Syrian sea,
The gracious calling of the Lord,
Let us, like them, without a word,
Rise up and follow thee.

O sabbath rest by Galilee,
O calm of hills above,
Where Jesus knelt to share with thee
The silence of eternity,
Interpreted by love!

Drop thy still dews of quietness,
Till all our strivings cease;
Take from our souls the strain and stress,
And let our ordered lives confess
The beauty of thy peace.

Breathe through the heats of our desire
Thy coolness and thy balm;
Let sense be dumb, let flesh retire;
Speak through the earthquake, wind, and fire,
O still, small voice of calm.

title:
Agya, Di M'anim Daa Daa
Father, Lead Me Day by Day
songEN:
Agya, di m'anim daa daa,
Fa me fa Wo kwan pa so;
Ma menyq kronn, nni nkowar'
Na kyerq me nea menyq.

Ma me 'kokod'ru mmusum'
Ma minhu sq Wogye nkwa;
Fa me sie Wo nkyqn hx daa
Na ma mentra Wo dx mu.

Sq mihyia bxn' ho sxhwq a
Hyq me den ma minnyina;
Sq meyq ankonam a
Fa Wo tum' nsa wowa me.

Ma menyq papā a minim,
Nyq Wo dx ba wx fam ha;
Na da bi maba Wo fie
Abqyq Wo ba daapem.BR>

title:
Mihia Wo B're Nyinaa
I Need Thee Every Hour
songEN:
Mihia Wo b're nyinaa
Domfo Nyame!
Nne bi nte sq Wo dč a
Qma 'somdwoe.

Nnyeso
Mihia Wo, ao, mihia Wo!
B're nyinaa mihia Wo!
M'Agyenkwa, hyira me nnq,
Maba Wo hx.

Mihia Wo b're nyinaa,
Bqtra me nkyqn;
Sxhwq y'ra ne tumi
B're a Wobqn.

Mihia Wo b're nyinaa,
Dqw mu-oo, yaw mu-oo
Bra ntqm bqtra me nkyqm,
Na manyq kwa.

Mihia Wo b're nyinaa,
Ky'rq me Wo pq;
Ma Wo bxhyq pa no
Nwie pq me mu.

title:
MihiaW', Yesų a Wosom Bo
I Need Thee Precious Jesus
songEN:
MihiaW', Yesų a Wosom bo,
'Fisq meyq 'hiani;
Xhxho ne kwantuni,
Minni hwee wx fam ha.
Mihia W'aw'rqkyekye dx
Wx me kwan so daa na
Aky'rq m'akyinnye nan kwan,
Na ayq m'ahoxden.

Mihia Yesu koma no,
De ate adwen nka;
Aka me sxhwq biara
Ne m'aw'rqhow aky'rq;
Mihia Honhom Kronkron no
Ma Waky'rq nea meyq,
Aky'rq me Yesu nso yie,
De me akx Ne nkyqn.

MihiaW', Yesų a Wosom bo,
Qrenkyq, mehu Wo
Sq Wote W'agua so na
W'anounyam 'twa Wo ho;
Me ne Wo mma a Wode
Wo mogya atx wxn
De dqw bqto 'yeyi dwom
Ahwq W'anim daa daa.
songTWI:
I need Thee precious Jesus,
For I am very poor;
A stranger and a pilgrim,
I have no earthly store.
I need the love of Jesus
To cheer me on my way,
To guide my doubting foot steps,
To be my strength and stay.

I need the heart of Jesus
To feel each anxious care,
To tell my every trial,
And all my sorrows share.
I need the Holy Spirit
To teach me what I am,
To show me more of Jesus,
To point me to the Lamb.

I need Thee precious Jesus,
I hope to see Thee soon,
Encircled with the rainbow,
And seated on Thy throne.
There with Thy blood-bought children,
My joy shall ever be
To sing Thy ceaseless praises,
To gaze, my Lord, on Thee.

title:
'Sq Sq Meka M'amane Ky'rq Yesu
I Must Tell Jesus
songEN:
'Sq sq meka m'amane ky'rq Yesu,
Me nko merentum' nsoa 'desoa yi;
Me yaw mu Xde 'yamye bqboa me,
Daa Xdo na Xhwq Ne nk'rxfo.
Nnyeso
Mqkā aky'rq Yesu, Mqkā aky'rq Yesu,
Me
nko merentum' nsoa m'adesoa;
Mqkā aky'rq Yesu, Mqkā aky'rq Yesu,
Yesu tum' boa me, Yesu nkutoo.
'Sq sq meka me haw ny'naa ky'rq Yesu,
Xye Adamfo, mmxb'rxhun'fo;
Sq mesrq No a, Xbqgye me nkwa,
Na Wama me haw atwam' akx.
Wiase daadaa me, twe me kx bxnem',
Ao, me koma taa hwč ase bxnem';
Mqkā aky'rq Yesu, na Xbqboa me
Ama madi wiase so nkonim.
songTWI:
I must tell Jesus all of my trials;
I can not bear these burdens alone,
In my distress He kindly will help me,
He ever loves and cares for His own.
Refrain
I must tell 
Jesus! I must tell Jesus!
I can not bear these burdens alone;
I must tell Jesus! I must tell Jesus!
Jesus can help me, Jesus alone.
I must tell Jesus all of my troubles,
He is a kind, compassionate Friend;
If I but ask Him, He will deliver,
Makes of my troubles quickly an end.
O how the world to evil allures me!
O how my heart is tempted to sin!
I must tell Jesus, and He will tell me
Over the world the vict'ry to win.

title:
Agya Metrq Me Nsam Ky'rq Wo
Migye Di, Migye De Seesei
I Do Believe
songEN:
Agya metrq me nsam ky'rq Wo,
Minnim xboafo bi;
Sq Wotwe Wo ho fi me hō a,
Ao, 'hefa na mqkx?

Megye Wo dx Ba no di nnq,
Ma mente Wo tum' nka;
Yq m'ahiade nyinaa ma me,
Saa xgye b're yi mu.

Wo a gyidi fi Wo, mema
M'ani so kyerq Wo;
O, ma minnya akyqde a
Qma kra nkwa no bi.

Minim sq Woremma me nwu;
Kasa na menya nkwa;
Mqtwqn 'hoxden mu kosi sq
Menya Wo Honhom no.

Sq mihu W'anim a, me kra
B'rqfo ani bqgye!
Ma mente Wo nnč a qma nkwa
Nnya Wo fa'fri dom no.

Migye di, migye di seesei,
Sq Yesu wu maa me;
Ohwiee Ne mogya dehye no
De gyee me fii bxnem'
songTWI:
Father, I stretch my hands to Thee;
No other help I know;
If Thou withdraw Thyself from me,
Ah, wither shall I go?

On Thy dear Son I now believe,
O let me feel Thy power;
And all my varied wants relieve,
In this accepted hour.

Author of faith! To Thee I lift
My weary, longing eyes;
O let me now receive that gift;
My soul without it dies.

Surely Thou canst not let me die;
O speak, and I shall live;
And here I will unwearied lie,
Till Thou Thy Spirit give.

How would my fainting soul rejoice
Could I but see Thy face!
Now let me hear Thy quickening voice,
And taste Thy pardoning grace.

I do believe, I now believe
That Jesus died for me,
And that He shed His precious blood
From sin to set me free.

title:
Me Nko Meba Turo Mu Hx
In the Garden
songEN:
Me nko meba turo mu hx
B're a bosu da so wx nhw'ren so;
Na mete nne bi gyigye wx m'asom',
Qyq Nyame Ba no nne.

Nnyeso
Xne me nantew, Xne me kasa,
Xse me sq meyq Ne de,
'Nigye a me ne No nya wx hx no,
Obiara nnyaa bi saa da.

Xkasa na Ne nne dq nti,
Nnomaa nyinaa gyae dwonto yq komm,
Na dwom dqdq a Xde maa me no
Rewosow wx me komam'.

Me ne No bqtra turo nom'
Qmfa ho sq sum reduru me;
Na Xse memfa yaw nne no mu nkx,
Ne nne gu so refrq me.
songTWI:
I come to the garden alone,
While the dew is still on the roses;
And the voice I hear, falling on my ear,
The Son of God discloses.

Refrain
And He walks with me,and He talks with me,
And He tells me I am His own;
And the joy we share as we tarry there,
None other has ever known.

He speaks, and the sound of His voice
Is so sweet the birds hush their singing,
And the melody that He gave to me
Within my heart is ringing.

I'd stay in the garden with Him
Though the night around me be falling,
But He bids me go; through the voice of woe,
His voice to me is calling.

title:
Midii Kan Mesrqq Hann
At First I Prayed for Light
songEN:
Midii kan mesrqq hann,
Sqnea mehu kwan no;
Mede 'nigye ne 'hoxhare
Kxx daa 'dekyee no ho.

Afei mesrqq 'hoxden,
Sqnea mede nan a
Ase tim bqfa kwan no mu,
Akxfa s'ro fie no.

Afei mesrqq gyidi,
Na matwer' me Nyame;
Na matra N'asomdwoe no mu
Atamfo ny'naa naim.

Seesei mesrq xdx;
Nyame, nipa ho dx;
Xdx a enni huammx da,
Wx Ne nhyehyqe biaram'.

Hann, 'hoxden ne gyidi
Apue wx baabiara;
Nyame twqnee boasetx mu
Kosii mpaebxn' awiei.
songTWI:
At first I prayed for light:
Could I but see the way,
How gladly, swiftly would I walk
To everlasting day!

And next I prayed for strength:
That I might tread the road
With firm, unfaltering feet, and win
The heaven's serene abode.

And then I asked for faith:
Could I but trust my God,
I'd live infolded in His peace,
Though foes were all abroad.

But now I pray for love:
Deep love to God and man;
A living love that will not fail,
However dark His plan.

And light and strength and faith
Are opening everywhere!
God waited patiently until
I prayed the larger prayer.

title:
Yesu, Me Kra Dxfo Pa
Jesus, Lover of My Soul
songEN:
Yesu, me kra dxfo pa,
Ma memmra Wo koko mu;
B're a 'sorxkye rebx,
Na ahum nso retu yi,
O, m'Agyenkwa fa me sie,
Kosi sq 'bra 'hum betwam;
Di m'anim kx hintabea,
Na gye me kra awiei no.

Minni guankxbea biara,
Me kra mmxb'rxni dan Wo;
Ao, nnyaw me nko ara da,
So me mu kyekye me w'rq,
M'anidaso nyinaa ne Wo,
Me mmoa nyinaa fi Wo hx,
Fa Wo ntaban kqse no
Bra bqkata me so daa.

Kristo, Wone m'ade ny'naa,
M'ahiade ny'naa fi Wo mu;
Ma wxn a wxahwč ase so,
Ky'rq anifuraefo kwan.
Wo din tene, yq kronkron,
Me ho agu fi koraa;
Mensq, bxn' ahyq me ma,
Nokwar' ne dom ahyqW' ma.

Wo mu na xdom pii wx,
Nea qma me bxn' faf'ri;
Ma yaresa nsu nsen pii,
Sx me mu na tew me ho;
Wone yqn nkwa nsuti no,
Ma mennom nsu no bi kwa
Ma qnsen wx me komam',
Kosi mm'resanten ny'naa mu.

title:
Yesu, Me Kra Dxfo Pa
Jesus Lover of My Soul
songEN:
Yesu, me kra dxfo pa,
Ma memmra Wo koko mu;
B're a 'sorxkye rebx,
Na ahum nso retu yi,
O, m'Agyenkwa fa me sie,
Kosi sq 'bra 'hum betwam;
Di m'anim kx hintabea,
Na gye me kra awiei no.

Minni guankxbea biara,
Me kra mmxb'rxni dan Wo;
Ao, nnyaw me nko ara da,
So me mu kyekye me w'rq,
M'anidaso nyinaa ne Wo,
Me mmoa nyinaa fi Wo hx,
Fa Wo ntaban kqse no
Bra bqkata me so daa.

Kristo, Wone m'ade ny'naa,
M'ahiade ny'naa fi Wo mu;
Ma wxn a wxahwč ase so,
Ky'rq anifuraefo kwan.
Wo din tene, yq kronkron,
Me ho agu fi koraa;
Mensq, bxn' ahyq me ma,
Nokwar' ne dom ahyqW' ma.

Wo mu na xdom pii wx,
Nea qma me bxn' faf'ri;
Ma yaresa nsu nsen pii,
Sx me mu na tew me ho;
Wone yqn nkwa nsuti no,
Ma mennom nsu no bi kwa
Ma qnsen wx me komam',
Kosi mm'resanten ny'naa mu.

title:
Sxhwq Bere Mu No
In The Hour of Trial

Agya Ky'rq Me Nea Menka
Sq Yesu
Like Jesus
songEN:
Agya ky'rq me nea menka;
Ky'rq me sqnea mqbx mpae;
Ky'rq me b're nyinaa sqnea
Mqyq te sq Yesu.

Nnyeso
Ma menyq sq Yesu,
Ma menyq sq Yesu!
W'ra boa me na minnyin daa
Te sq Yesu ara.

B'rč nna resen yi, ky'rq me
Sqnea merennye 'kyinnye,
Ky'rq me sq, yq-kodu na
Qma wxsq Yesu.

Ky'rq me sqnea b're yq tia,
Ne sqnea mqyq 'dwuma;
Ky'rq me sq, 'dwumapa na
Qma wxsq Yesu.

Ma yqnyq baako sqnea
Agya ne Ba no te no;
Na sq midi nkonim a,
Mayq te sq Yesu.
songTWI:
Teach, me, Father, what to say;
Teach me, Father, how to pray;
Teach me all along the way
How to be like Jesus.

Refrain
I would be like Jesus,
I would be like Jesus!
Help me, Lord, to daily grow
More and more like Jesus!

Teach me as the days go by,
Teach me not to reason why,
Teach me that to do and die,
Is to be like Jesus.

Teach me that the time is short,
Teach me how to live and work,
Teach me that to never shirk
Is to be like Jesus.

Teach me how we may be one,
Like the Father and the Son;
And when all is overcome,
I will be like Jesus.

title:
Na Mete Sq Subura Ho Xbaa No
Hyq Me Kuruwa Ma
Fill My Cup, Lord
songEN:
Na mete sq subura ho xbaa no,
Mehwehwqq nneqma a qmmee;
Afei metee m'Agyenkwa nne sq:
"Sa M'abura a qnwe da no bi".

Nnyeso
Hyq me kuruwa ma, mema so
'W'ra, dwudwo me kra sukxm ano;
Soro aduan, yqn me kosi sq mqmee
Hyq me kuruwa ma, na yq me mua.

Mpempem wx wiase yi mu a wxrepq
'Sase yi so anigyede;
Nanso 'mu biara nn'ru 'gyapadč a
Minya no me Wura Yesu mu no.

Me mma, nneqma a wiase yi de ma mo,
Gya mo xkxm a entwam a,
Me W'ra no bqba abqgye mo,
Sq mokoto srq No 'hobrqasem'a.
songTWI:
Like the woman at the well I was seeking
For things that could not satisfy;
And then I heard my Savior speaking:
"Draw from My well that shall never run dry."

Refrain
Fill my cup, Lord, I lift it up, Lord!
Come and quench this thirsting of my soul;
Bread of heaven, feed me till I want no more—
Fill my cup, fill it up and make me whole!

There are millions in this world who are craving
The pleasure earthly things afford;
But none can match the wondrous treasure
That I fond in Jesus Christ my Lord.

So, my children, if the things this world gave you
Leave hungers that won't pass away,
My blessed Lord will come and save you,
If you kneel to Him and humbly pray:

title:
"Yebehu Yesu", 'Fisq Sunsuma Nyin
We Would See Jesus
songEN:
"Yebehu Yesu", 'fisq sunsuma nyin
Tware xbra kwan ketewa no mu,
Yebehu Yesu, ná ahyq yqn gyidi den
Xbra yi mu ko a etwa to nom'.

"Yebehu Yesu", yqn nkwagye Botan no
Faako a wxde dom gu yqn nan 'se;
N-kwa, owu ne mu anib're nyinaa
Rentumi ntwe yqn mfi N'anim hwq ho.

"Yebehu Yesu", akanea fof'ro a
Y'ani agye ho mfe pii no redum;
Bxne wiase yi my nhyira di huammx
Yerenni ho yaw mfa nsesa Wo da.

"Yebehu Yesu", eyi ne yqn 'hiade,
'Hoxden, 'nigye, xpq de 'dehu ba;
Yebehu Yesu, Wawu asxr' resrq
Sq Xreba bewie saa 'nadwo yi.

title:
Beae Bi Wx Hō a Home Pa Wx
Qbqn Nyame Komam'
Near to the Heart of God
songEN:
Beae bi wx hō a home pa wx
Qbqn Nyame komam';
Qhx na bxne ntumi nhaw,
Qbqn Nyame komam'.

Nnyeso
O, Yesu Gyefo hy'rafo
Wufi Nyame Komam';
Fa yqn a yqretwqn Wo'i,
Bqn Nyame koma mu.

Beae bi wx hō a xdqw pa wx
Qbqn Nyame komam'
Beae a yehyia yqn Agyenkwa,
Qbqn Nyame komam'.

Beae bi wx hō a 'hofadi wx,
Qbqn Nyame komam'.
Anigye ne 'somdwoe wx hx,
Qbqn Nyame komam'.
songTWI:
There is a place of quiet rest,
Near to the heart of God;
A place where sin cannot molest,
Near to the heart of God.

Refrain
O Jesus, blest Redeemer,
Sent from the heart of God,
Hold us who wait before thee
Near to the heart of God.

There is a place of comfort sweet,
Near to the heart of God;
A place where we our Savior meet,
Near to the heart of God.

There is place a place of full release,
Near to the heart of God;
A place where all is joy and peace,
Near to the heart of God.

title:
Daa Dx, Yenni Adepa Bi De Brq Wo
Eternal Love, We Have No Good
songEN:
Daa Dx, yenni adepa bi de brq Wo
'Depa bi nni hx a yqn nsa ayq,
Dwom pa bi nni hx a yqbqto aky'rqW'
Asqm anna adwempa bi nni hx.

Nanso yqaba; sq yqn gyidi hinhim a,
Xdx, ky'rq yqn kokoam mpaebx bea hx,
Sika 'duhuam ne afxrebukyia no,
Ne 'bxfo a xretwqn yqn hx no.
songTWI:
Eternal Love, we have no good to bring Thee,
No single good of all our hands have wrought,
No worthy music have we found to sing Thee,
No jewelled word, no quick up soaring thought.

And yet we come; and when our faith would falter
Show us, O Love, the quiet place of prayer,
The golden censer and the golden altar,
And the great angel waiting for us there.

title:
Adasamma Agya Dqqfo
O Gracious Father of Mankind
songEN:
Adasamma Agya dqqfo,
Yqn honhom mu yxnko;
'S'ro 'W'rade, yqn koma dxfo,
Yqn mpae f'ro ba Wo nkyqn;
Wontwqn nkosi sq yqbqsrq
Wo soro akyqde;
Yqn botae, yqn 'dwuma, yqn bra,
Yq mpae a Wodx pii.

Wuhu papa ne bxne a
Ahinta koma mu;
Adwen ne nhyehyqe biara a
Epue anaa empue.
Yi nkakae fi yqn mpaebx mu,
Yqn bra nnan mmra Wo nkyqn
Kosi sq yqbqyq 'dwuma
'Kyqdč a yebisa ho.

Yqn mu a Wote ne Wo pq
Ho adwen som yqn bo;
Sq yqbqte Wo nnč a yehia,
'Dx, otie ne kommyq.
Yqn pq renni Wo de no so,
Mmom qbqmem Wo dem';
Yqrensu wx s'ro pon akyi,
Mmom yqbqbx Wo bra.

Wode xdx hwehwq yqn sen
Sqnea yqhwehwq Wo;
Wo tumi sen fa apon mu
Te sq po as'rxkye.
Yqnhwehwq Wo aky'riky'ri bi,
Anaa sqnky'rqnne bi;
Eye pii sq yqbx m-pae,
Na yqyq Wo de kōraa.
songTWI:
O gracious Father of mankind,
Our spirits' unseen friend;
High heaven's Lord, our hearts' dear guest,
To Thee our prayers ascend.
Thou dost not wait till human speech
Thy gifts divine implore;
Our dreams, our aims, our work, our lives
Are prayers Thou lovest more.

Thou hearest these, the good and ill,
Deep buried in each breast;
The secret thought, the hidden plan,
Wrought out our unexpressed.
O cleanse our prayers from human dross,
Attune our lives to Thee,
Until we labor for those gifts
We ask on bended knee.

Our best is but Thyself in us,
Our highest thought Thy will;
To hear Thy voice we need but love,
And listen, and be still.
We would not bend Thy will to ours,
But blend our wills to Thine;
Not dreams, our aims, our work, our lives
Are prayers Thou lovest more.

Thou seekest us in love and truth
More than our minds seek Thee;
Through open gates Thy power flows in
Like flood tides from the sea.
No more we seek Thee from afar,
Nor ask Thee for a sign,
Content to pray in life and love
And toil, till all are Thine.

title:
Me Ne Wo Da So Wx Hx Adekyee B'rem
Still, Still With Thee
songTWI:
Still, still with Thee, when purple morning breaketh,
When the bird waketh, and the shadows flee;
Fairer than morning, lovelier than daylight,
Dawns the sweet consciousness, I am with Thee.

Alone with Thee, amid the mystic shadows,
The solemn hush of nature newly born;
Alone with Thee in breathless adoration,
In the calm dew and freshness of the morn.

Still, still with Thee! As to each newborn morning
A fresh and solemn splendor still is given,
So does this blessed consciousness, awaking,
Breathe each day nearness unto Thee and heaven.

So shall it be at last, in that bright morning,
When the soul waketh and life's shadows flee;
O in that hour, fairer than daylight dawning,
Shall rise the glorious thought, I am with Thee.

title:
Yxnko Bqn N'xte Sq Yesu
What a Friend We Have in Jesus
songEN:
Yxnko bqn n'xte sq Yesu,
Xsoa yqn bxne ne yaw;
Qyq sq yqde ny'naa
Kx Onyame hx mpaebom;
Ao, yqtaa sqe asomdwoe kwa,
Ao, yedi yaw a enhia;
Efisq yqmfa ade ny'naa
Nkx Onyame hx mpaebom'.

So yqmx nnyigye ne sxhwq?
Xhaw bi wx hx anna?
Yqrempa aba ara da,
Fa kx Nyam hx mpaebom;
Yqwx Yxnko nokwafo bė a
Obegyam yqn yqn yaw mu;
Yesu nim yqn mmerqwyq ny'naa
Fa kx Nyame hx mpaebom'.

Yqayq mm'rqw na yq kxn abu,
Dadwen ne haw gu yqn so?
Agyenkwa ne yqn guankxbea,
Fa kx Nyame hx mpaebom';
Wo mfqfo bu wo animtiā a
Fa kx Nyame hx mpaebom',
Obet'ru wo N'abasa so,
Wubenya abotxyam.
songTWI:
What a friend we have in Jesus,
All our sins and griefs to bear!
What a privilege to carry
Everything to God in prayer!
O what peace we often forfeit,
O what needless pain we bear,
All because we do not carry
Everything to God in prayer.

Have we trials and temptations?
Is there trouble anywhere?
We should never be discouraged;
Take it to the Lord in prayer.
Can we find a friend so faithful
Who will all our sorrows share?
Jesus knows our every weakness;
Take it to the Lord in prayer.

Are we weak and heavy laden,
Cumbered with a load of care?
Precious Savior, still our refuge;
Take it to the Lord in prayer.
Do thy friends despise, forsake thee?
Take it to the Lord in prayer!
In his arms he'll take and shield thee;
Thou wilt find a solace there.

title:
Hyq Da Tew Wo Ho Wo
Take Time to be Holy
songTWI:
Take time to be holy, speak oft with thy Lord;
Abide in him always, and feed on his word.
Make friends of God's children, help those who are weak,
Forgetting in nothing his blessing to seek.

Take time to be holy, the world rushes on;
Spend much time in secret with Jesus alone.
By looking to Jesus, like him thou shalt be;
Thy friends in thy conduct his likeness shall see.

Take time to be holy, let him be thy guide,
And run not before him, whatever betide.
In joy or in sorrow, still follow the Lord,
And, looking to Jesus, still trust in his word.

Take time to be holy, be calm in thy soul,
Each thought and each motive beneath his control.
Thus led by his spirit to fountains of love,
Thou soon shalt be fitted for service above.

title:
Mpaebx B're Pa No
Tis the Blessed Hour of Prayer
songEN:
Mpaebx b're pa no b're a yqn koma brq ase,
Na yebom hyia Yesu, yqn 'Gyenkwa ne yxnko;
Sq yqba Ne nkyqn gyidim' a yenya Ne banbx.
Xbrq aduru bqn ni! Sqnea hx yq dq fa.

Nnyeso
Mpaebx b're pa no, Mpaebx b're pa no;
Xbrq aduru bqn ni! Sqnea hx yq dq fa.

Mpaebx b're pa no, b're a Agyenkwa no twiw bqn,
Na Xde ayamhyehye betie Ne mma no;
Xka sq yqnto haw biara ngu Ne nan ase;
Xbrq aduru bqn ni! Sqnea hx yq dq fa.

Mpaebx b're pa no, b're a wxn a wxahyia sxhwq
Bqka wxn yaw aky'rq 'Gyenkwá a Xdx wxn no
Xde atenka koma yi haw biara fi hx;
Xbrq aduru bqn ni! Sqnea hx yq dq fa.

Mpaebx b're pa yim' no, yqtwer' No ā yqgye di
Sq yqn nsa bqka nhyira a yqhia nyinaa
'Hotxso pa yi mu no, yqn haw biara bqy'ra
Xbrq aduru bqn ni! Sqnea hx yq dq fa.
songTWI:
Tis the blessed hour of prayer,
When our hearts lowly bend,
And we gather to Jesus,
Our Savior and friend;
If we come to Him in faith,
His protection to share,
What a balm for the weary!
O how sweet to be there!

Refrain
Blessed hour of prayer,
Blessed hour of prayer,
What a balm for the weary!
O how sweet to be there!

Tis the blessed hour of prayer,
When the Savior draws near,
With a tender compassion
His children to hear;
When He tells us we may cast
At His feet evry care,
What a balm for the weary!
O how sweet to be there!

Tis the blessed hour of prayer,
When the tempted and tried
To the Savior who loves them
Their sorrow confide;
With a sympathizing heart
He removes evry care;
What a balm for the weary!
O how sweet to be there!

At the blessed hour of prayer,
Trusting Him, we believe
That the blessing were needing
Well surely receive;
In the fullness of this trust
We shall lose evry care;
What a balm for the weary!
O how sweet to be there!

title:
Me Kra Owia, O Agyenkwa
Sun of My Soul
songEN:
Me kra owia, O Agyenkwa,
Wobqn me a ade nsa me;
Mma 'sase so mununkum bi
Mfa Wo nhinta mfi W'akoā anim.

Sq nna boxu bxkxx no tx
Gu me so na metx nko a,
Ma minhu ne dq a qyq
Sq mqhome m'Agyenkwa mu.

Wo ne me ntra da mu nyinaa
'Fisq Wonka hō a minni nkwa;
Wo ne me ntra b'rč a sum red'ru
'Fisq Wonka hō a misųro 'wu.

Bra behy'ra me me sxre mu,
Ansa na manantew wiasem';
Kosi sq Wo dx po bun nom',
Mapue wx xsoro nohoa.
songTWI:
Sun of my soul, O Savior dear,
It is not night if Thou be near;
O may no earth-born cloud arise
To hide Thee from Thy servants eyes.

When the soft dews of kindly sleep
My wearied eyelids gently steep
Be my last thought, how sweet to rest
Forever on my Saviors breast.

Abide with me from morn till eve,
For without Thee I cannot live;
Abide with me when night is nigh,
For without Thee I dare not die.

Be near and bless me when I wake,
Ere through the world my way I take;
Till in the ocean of Thy love
I lose myself in heaven above.

title:
Kommyq Beae Bi Wx Hx
A Quiet Place
songEN:
Kommyq beae bi wx hx
Nea Nyame betumi
Adwundwo m'adwenhaw ano;
Nua ne nhw'ren katam' so
Me ne No wx kommyq beae hō a
Migyaw me haw aky'ri.
Sq qyq tų bi mu
Anaa bepx atifi;
Minya akokod'ru fof'ro
Mifi kommyq beae hā a,
Mede dx amapa siesie
Me ho hyia da fof'ro.
songTWI:
There is a quiet place,
Far from the rapid pace where
God can soothe my troubled mind.
Sheltered by tree and flow'r,
There in my quiet hour with Him
My cares are left behind.
Whether a garden small,
Or on a mountain tall,
New strength and courage there I find;
Then from this quiet place
I go prepared to face a new day
With love for all mankind.

title:
'W'ra Yesu, Dwen Me Ho
Lord Jesus, Think on Me
songEN:
'W'ra Yesu, dwen me ho
Na hoh' ro me bxne,
Gye me fi fam ha akxnnxm'
Na ma me mu nyq kronn.

'W'ra Yesu, dwen me ho,
Hyq haw ne mmusu so;
Ma menyq W'akoā a Wodx no,
Nnya Wo bxhyq home.

"W'ra Yesu, dwen me ho,
Mma memmfi kwan no so;
Sum ne ahohiahia mu no
Kyerq me s'ro kwan no.

"W'ra Yesu, dwen me ho,
Sqnea mqto dwom s'ro
Ama Agya, Honhom, ne Wo
Ayeyi ne dx nnwom.
songTWI:
Lord Jesus, think on me,
And purge away my sin;
From earth-born passions set me free,
And make me pure within.

Lord Jesus, think on me,
With care and woe opprest;
Let me Thy loving servant be,
And taste Thy promised rest.

Lord Jesus, think on me,
Nor let me go astray;
Through darkness and perplexity
Point Thou the heavenly way.

Lord Jesus, think on me,
That I may sing above
To Father, Spirit and to Thee,
The strains of praise and love.

title:
Mihia M'adofo Mpaebo No
I Need The Prayers
songEN:
Mihia m'adxfo mpaebx no
Menam xbra kwanfo so yi;
Sqnea mqyq nokwafo pa
Atra ase daa 'ma Yesu.

Nnyeso
Mepq sq me nnamfo bx mpae
De soa me kra brqfo kx s'ro
Na wxsrq ma me Nyame hx,
Mihia m'adxfo mpaebx no.

Mihia m'adxfo mpaebx no
Na aboa me sxhwq b're mu
De me kra brqfō akx Ne nkyqn
Na Wakora me Ne tumim'.

Mepq sq nnamfo bx mpae mam'
De soa me gyidi ntaban so,
Na mafa 'kwan hihiaa no so,
Yqn Agya 'nuonyam dom no mu.
songTWI:
I need the prayers of those I love,
While travling oer lifes rugged way,
That I may true and faithful be,
And live for Jesus every day.

Refrain
I want my friends to pray for me,
To bear my tempted soul above,
And intercede with God for me,
I need the prayers of those I love.

I need the prayers of those I love,
To help me in each trying hour,
To bear my tempted soul to Him,
That He may keep me by His power.

I want my friends to pray for me,
To hold me up on wings of faith,
That I may walk the narrow way,
Kept by our Fathers glorious grace.

title:
Yqn Nyame Ne Abankqse
A Mighty Fortress
songEN:
Yqn Nyame ne abankqse
Kyqm a enni huammx da;
Yqn boafo a yqwx ne No,
Adasamma nsuy'ri mu,
Yqn tamfo dedaw no
Hwehwq mmusu ara,
N'adwen ne tumi so,
N'abufuw ne nitan,
Obi nsq no 'sase so.

Yqn ankasa 'hoxden mu no,
Yqn ap'redi bqyq kwa,
Barima pa bi wx y'afa
Onyame na Xpaw No;
Wubisa Onniko
Xne Kristo Yesu,
Aw'rade Sabaot,
Mfesanten: Xsankra;
Na etwa sq Odi nim.

Ahonhom fi hyq wiase ma
Repq yqn amene a
Yqrensuro, Nyame ama
N'asqm nam yqn so di nim;
Sum hen' no fa 'bufuw,
Yqn ho rempo N'anim;
Yebegyina pintinn,
'Fisq ne sqe reba;
Asqm k'ro beyi n'ahwe.

Asqm a qtra 'sase so
Tum' biara no tim hx daa;
Honhom ne 'kyqde no wx yqn,
Nea Xwx y'afa no mu.
Ahode, abusua,
Ne nkwa tiawa yi nkx;
Wokum yqn honam a,
Nyame asqm tim hx daa,
N'ahenni tim hx daapem.
songTWI:
A mighty fortress is our God,
a bulwark never failing;
our helper he amid the flood
of mortal ills prevaling.
For still our ancient foe
doth seek to work us woe;
his craft and power are great,
and armed with cruel hate,
on earth is not his equal.

Did we in our own strength confide,
our striving would be losing,
were not the right man on our side,
the man of God's own choosing.
Dost ask who that may be?
Christ Jesus, it is he;
Lord Sabbaoth, his name,
from age to age the same,
and he must win the battle.

And though this world, with devils filled,
should threaten to undo us,
we will not fear, for God hath willed
his truth to triumph through us.
The Prince of Darkness grim,
we tremble not for him;
his rage we can endure,
for lo, his doom is sure;
one little word shall fell him.

That word above all earthly powers,
no thanks to them, abideth;
the Spirit and the gifts are ours,
thru him who with us sideth.
Let goods and kindred go,
this mortal life also;
the body they may kill;
God's truth abideth still;
his kingdom is forever.

title:
Me Ne Yesu Wu, Na Wxagyem' Atom
B're Biara Mu No
Moment by Moment
songEN:
Me en Yesu wu, na wxagyem' atom,
Me ne Yesu tra s'ro nkwa fof'ro mu,
Mehwq Yesu kosi 'nuonyam hy'rqn no
B're biara mu no, O 'W'ra, me wx Wo.

Nnyeso
B're biara mu no, Xkōra me Ne dxm',
B're biara mu no, mewx nkwa fi s'ro;
Mehwq Yesu kosi 'nuonyam hy'rqm no,
B're biara mu no, O 'W'ra, mewx Wo.

Sxhwq biara ntoo yqn a Onni hx',
Adesoa biara nni hx a Xnsoa;
'W'rqhowdi bi nni hx a Xnka ho,
B're biara mu no, mewx Ne banbx.

Koma yaw ne 'pinisi bi nni hx,
Na nusu ne yawdi bi nso nni hx;
Mmusu bi nni hx a ennu N'anim,
B're biara mu no, Xdwen Ne de ho.

Mmerqwyq bi nni hx a Xnte nka,
Yare bi nni hx a Xntumi nsa;
'W'rqhow ne dqw wx b're biara mu no,
Yesu m'Agyenkwa no ne me wx hx.
songTWI:
Dying with Jesus, by death reckoned mine,
Living with Jesus, a new life divine,
Looking to Jesus till glory doth shine,
Moment by moment, O Lord, I am Thine.

Refrain
Moment by moment I'm kept in His love;
Moment by moment I've life from above;
Looking to Jesus till glory doth shine;
Moment by moment, O Lord, I am Thine.

Never a trial that He is not there,
Never a burden that He doth not bear,
Never a sorrow that He doth not share,
Moment by moment I'm under His care.

Never a heartache, and never a groan,
Never a teardrop and never a moan;
Never a danger but there on the throne,
Moment by moment He thinks of His own.

Never a weakness that He doth not feel,
Never a sickness that He cannot heal;
Moment by moment, in woe or in weal,
Jesus, my Savior, abides with me still.

title:
Me Ne Yesu Bqkx Baabiara
Anywhere With Jesus
songEN:
Me ne Yesu bqkx baabiara dwoodwoo,
Baabiara a Obedi n'anim fam ha;
'Nigye nni baabi sq Xnka me ho a,
Yesu ke me ho a minsųro baabiara.

Nnyeso
Baabiara! Baabiara! Merensuro da;
Me ne Yesu bqkx baabiara dwoodwoo.

Me ne Yesu nam a menyq ankonam
Nnamfo ny'naa dim' huammx a, Xwx me ara;
Sq Xde me fa akwanfo so mpo a,
Nea Yesu wx biara yq ayeyi fie.

Yesu ka me ho a metumi ada,
Sq esum kabii nya twa me ho hyia a
Minim sq mqsxre a merenkyin bio.
Nea me ne Yesu wx yq anigye fie.

title:
Aw'rade 'Hotefo
How Firm a Foundation
songEN:
Aw'rade 'hotefo, monhwq fapem a
Wxato ama mo gyidi, N'asqm no mu;
Asqm bqn ara na Xnka nky'rq mo bio,
Mo a moaguan akohinta Yesu mu?

"Nsuro Me ne W'wx hx, mma wo koma ntu,
Mene wo Nyankopxn, na Maboa wo nso;
Mqhyq wo den aboa wo 'ma woagyina,
Me trenee nsa dennen no bqsx wo mu."

"Sq Mesoma wo sq fa nsubun mu a,
