God in Christ has come to stay,
We can see His pow'r today.

When a stranger's not a alone,
Where the Indexless find a Index,
Praise the love that Christ revealed,
Living, working in our world.

May His Spirit fill our praise,
Guide our thougths and change our ways.
God in Christ has come to stay,
We can see His power today.

There's a Spirit in the air,
Calling people everywhere;
Praise the love that Christ revealed:
Living, working in our world.

title:
B're a Wxmaa Kristo So No
When Christ Was Lifted From the Earth
songEN:
B're a wxmaa Kristo so no
Xtrqw Ne nsam xs'ro,
Amamm'rq ne awosu ny'naam'
De gyee xdx ho mmuae.

Ne dx kodu apuei nč atxe
Aky'riky'ri ne bqnkyqe,
Xfrq gye yqn sq Ne nnamfo,
Na Xdx yqn saa'ra.

Nea fekuw ne 'busua paapae
Yqn mu 'nimguasem no,
Xnhwq agyirae bi na mmom
Onipa ne edin.

Wodx me kwa nti ma minnya
'Hofadi Kristo mu,
Na mennye N'ankasa de no
Sqnea Xgyee me no.
songTWI:
When Christ was lifted from the earth
His arms stretched out above
Through every culture, every birth,
To draw an answering love.

Still east and west His love extends
And always, near or far,
He calls and claims us as His friends
And love us as we are.

Where generation, or race
Divides us to our shame
He sees not labels but a face,
A person and a name.

Thus freely loved, tho' fully known
May I in Christ be free
To welcome and accept
His own as Christ accepted me.

title:
Dqw a Qyq Sq Yqsom Ha
What Joy It Is to Worship Here
songEN:
Dqw a qyq sq yqsom ha,
Te nka sq yqwx fie;
Faako a Nyame wx kwan ma
Obiarā a xba hx!

Nanso nnipa baanu biara
Nyq pq nnipa nyinaam';
Na qsq sq yqyq nok'ro
De nya Ne dom no bi.
songTWI:
What joy it is to worship here,
And find ourselves at Index,
Where God, who uses every gift,
Has room for all who come!

Yet are no two of us alike
Of all the human race,
And we must seek a common ground
If we would share His grace.

title:
Kristom Nni Apuei Annà Atxe
In Christ There Is No East nor West
songEN:
Kristom nni apuei anaà atxe
'Tifi anaa 'nafo,
Na mmom 'dx ayxnkofa k'ro
Wiase afanan ny'naa.

Ne mu na koma ny'naa benya
Wxn nkitadohi pa;
Ne som ne hama kronkron a
Qka nnipa ny'naa bom.

'Nuanom 'gyidifo monka mmom
Sqnea mote biara;
Nea xsom m'Agya sq ba no,
Xyq me busuani.

Apuei ne atxe hyia Kristom,
'Tifi ne 'nafo nso;
Kristom 'kra ny'naa yq k'ro Ne mu,
Wiase afanan ny'naa.
songTWI:
In Christ there is no east nor west,
In Him no south or north;
But one great fellowship of love
Throughout the whole wide earth.

In Him shall true hearts everywhere
Their high communion find;
His service is the golden cord
Close binding all mankind.

Join hands, then, brothers of the faith,
Whate'er your race may be.
Who serves my Father as a son
Is surely kin to me.

In Christ now meet both east and west,
In Him meet south and north;
All Christly souls are one in Him
Throughout the whole wide earth.

title:
Aman Nyinaa W'ra
Lord of All Nations
songEN:
Aman nyinaa W'ra, ma me dom
Mfa nnx nnipa horow nyinaa;
Ma menhu xkra biara mu,
Adxfo a Woagye wxn nkwa.

'W'ra, bubu fasu a qde
Ntetewm'di bqba Wo mma mu,
Ma mempq me yxnko yiedi;
Ma Kristom dx no nka yqn mmom'.

'W'ra, fa me mfomso nyinaa kyq
'T'rimxden ne nsqnhun' nyinaa;
Ma menhu sq me bxn' biara
Bx m'Awurade 'sqnnuam' bio.

'W'ra, ma memfa W'akokod'ru
Nkasa brč a wxhyq afof'ro so;
Sq wxhyq me so bi saa a,
Ma menkae Wo, na memfa nkyq.

Ma Wo dx no nhyq me ma wx
Wo Honhom Kronkron no pq mu;
Na nea me nsa besom biara
Anya Wo soro tumi no.
songTWI:
Lord of all nations, grant me grace
To love all people, every race,
And in each person may I see
My kindred loved, redeemer by Thee.

Break down the wall that would divine
Thy children Lord, on every side.
My neighbor's good let me pursue;
Let Christian love bind warm and true.

Forgive me, Lord, where I have erred
By loveless act and thoughtless word.
Make me to see the wrong I do
Will crucify my Lord anew.

Give me Thy courage, Lord, to speak
Whenever strong oppress the weak.
Should I myself the victim be,
Help me forgive, rememb'ring Thee

With Thine own love may I be filled
And by Thy Holy Spirit willed,
That all I touch, where'er I be,
May be divinely touched by Thee.

title:
Honhom Kronkron, Dqqfo Pa
Holy Spirit, Gracious Guest
songEN:
Honhom Kronkron, Dqqfo pa,
Tie na ma yqn 'kyqde pa
A yqn koma bisa no:
Xs'ro dx kronkron.

Gyidė a etu mmepx
Fam anaa s'ro tqkrqma,
Nimdeq, nneqma ny'naa yq kwa,
Sq minni dx a.

Mema wohwie me mogya,
De m'ahode ma 'hiafō a,
Qyq kwa b'rč a minni dx:
Enti ma me 'dx.

'Dx yam ye wx boasetx,
'Dx yq kronn, qnnwen bone
'Dx ho yq den sen owu,
Enti ma yqn 'dx.

N-kxmhyq betwam akx,
Qbqy'ra wx da hann mu;
Xdx ne yqn bqtra daa:
Enti ma yqn 'dx.

Gyidi, 'nidaso ne dx
Na qka bom yq biako-
Na mmiqnsa yi nyinaa mu,
Nea qso ne 'dx.
songTWI:
Holy Spirit, gracious guest,
Hear and grant our heart's request
For that gift supreme and best
Holy heav'nly love.

Faith that mountains could remove,
Tongues of earth or heaven above,
Knowledge, all things,
Empty prove If I have no love.

Though I as a martyr bleed,
Give my goods the poor to feed,
All is vain if love I need:
Therefore give me love.

Love is kind and suffers long,
Love is pure and thinks no wrong;
Love than death ifself more strong:
Therefore give us love.

Prophecy will fade away,
Melting in the light of day;
Love will ever with us stay:
Therefore give us love.

Faith and hope and love we see
Joining hand in had agree—
But the greatest of the three,
And the best is love.

Holy spirit gracious guest,
Hear and grant our heart request
For that gift supreme and best
Holy heav'nly love.

title:
Yqne Nyame Nantew
Trust and Obey
songEN:
Yqne Nyame nantew N'asqm no hann mu a
N'anuonyam no hyerqn yqn kwan so;
Sq yqyq Ne pq a, Xne yqn bqtra daa,
Ne wxn a wobetie No nyinaa.

Nnyeso
Twer' No, tie No, Na 'hotx bi nni
Yesu mu sen sq Wobqtwer' No, na woatie No.

Esum bi rensxre, Munumkum bi rensi,
Mmom N'animtew bqpa na nyinaa;
Akyinnye ne ehu, Apini ne nusu,
Remma, sq yetwer' No tie No a.

Yqrensoa nneqma kwa, Yqn werq renhow kwa,
Na mmom Obetua yqn so ka pa;
Sq amane mu oo, Sq abufuw mu oo,
Yetie No a Obehyira yqn.

Na yqrentumi nnya Ne dx mu anika
Kosi sq yqbqgyae ne nyinaam';
Ne dom a Xkyerq, 'Nigye a Xde ma,
Yq wxn a wxtwer' No, tie No de.

Ayxnkofa pa mu, Yqbqtra N'anim hx,
Anaasq yqbqnantew Ne nkyqn;
Yqbqyq nea Xse, Na yqakx Ne soma;
Yerensuro, na yqbetie No.
songTWI:
When we walk with the Lord
in the light of his word,
what a glory he sheds on our way!
While we do his good will,
he abides with us still,
and with all who will trust and obey.

Refrain
Trust and obey, for there's no other way
to be happy in Jesus, but to trust and obey.

Not a burden we bear,
not a sorrow we share,
but our toil he doth richly repay;
not a grief or a loss,
not a frown or a cross,
but is blest if we trust and obey.

But we never can prove
the delights of his love
until all on the altar we lay;
for the favor he shows,
for the joy he bestows,
are for them who will trust and obey.

Then in fellowship sweet
we will sit at his feet,
or we'll walk by his side in the way;
what he says we will do,
where he sends we will go;
never fear, only trust and obey.

title:
Yqn 'Dwumayq nč Agodim'
In Our Work and In Our Play
songEN:
Yqn 'dwumayq nč agodim',
Yesu, Wone yqn ntra daa;
Ma yqmmx yqn ho mmxden
Sq yebedi Wo nokwar,
Na yqatum' ato dwom sq:
Yqyq Xhempxn no mma.

Ma yqmfa Wo tumi nnyae
Kokobxne at'rosqm,
'Dwemmxne, 't'rimxdensqm
Ne nneqmā a qnso W'ani,
Na yqatum' ato' dwom sq:
Yqyq Xhempxn no mma.

Yqyq Xhempo no mma;
Momma yenni no nokwar'
Na yqnsx N'ani daa ny'naa
Yqn 'dwumayq nč agodim'
Na yqatum' ato dwom sq:
Yqyq Xhempxn no mma.
songTWI:
In our work and in our play,
Jesus, ever with us stay;
May be always strive to be
True and faithful unto Thee.
Then we truthfully can sing,
We are children of the King.

May we in Thy strength subdue
Evil tempers, words untrue,
Thoughts impure, and deeds unkind,
All things hateful to Thy mind.
Then we truthfully can sing,
We are children of the King.

Children of the King are we!
May we loyal to Him be;
Try to please Him every day,
In our work and in our play.
Then we truthfully can sing,
We are children of the King.

title:
'Wqmfo, Ka Yqn 'Nadwosqm
Watchman, Tell Us of the Night
songEN:
'Wqmfo, ka yqn 'nadwosqm,
Ne bxhyq sqnky'rqnne no.
'Kwantuni, mmepx no so,
Hwq anuounyam ns'romma no;
'Wqmfo, so n'ahoxfq yi
Ka dqw anaa 'nidaso?
Yiw, xkwantuni, qde
Israel bxhyq da no ba.

'Wqmfo, ka yqn 'nadwosqm,
Ns'romma no kx s'ro ara.
'Kwantuni, nhyira ne hann,
'Somdwoe, nokwar' wx ne' kwanm'.
'Wqmfo, ne hann nkutoo
'Kwantuni, mfe yq ne de;
Hwq, qhy'rqn 'sase so ny'naa.

'Wqmfo, ka yqn 'nadwosqm,
Asq adekyee reben.
'Kwantuni, sum reguan kx,
'Kyinnye ne suro resa;
'Wqmfo, ma w'akyinkyin nnyae;
Yq ntqm kx wo home fie;
'Kwantuni, hwq, 'somdwoe Hen'
Onyame Ba no aba!
songTWI:
Watchman, tell of the night,
What its signs of promise are.
Traveler, o'er yon mountain's height,
See that glory beaming star.
Watchman, does its beauteous ray
Aught of joy or hope foretell?
Traveler, yes; its brings the day,
Promised day of Israel.

Watchman, tell us of the night,
Higher yet that star ascends.
Traveler, blessedness and light,
Peace and truth its course portends.
Watchman, will its beams alone
Gild the spot that gave them birth?
Traveler, ages are its own;
See, it bursts o'er all the earth.

Watchman, tell us of the night,
For the morning seems to dawn.
Traveler, darkness takes its flight,
Doubt and terror are withdrawn.
Watchman, let your wanderings cease,
Hasten to your quiet Index.
Traveler, lo, the Prince of Peace,
Lo, the Son of God is come!

title:
Mm'rč a Qte Sqq Yim', Wuhia
In Times Like These
songTWI:
In times like these you need a Savior,
In times like these you need an anchor;
Be very sure, be very sure
Your anchor holds and grips the solid Rock!

Refrain
This Rock is Jesus, Yes, He's the One,
This Rock is Jesus, The only One!
Be very sure, be very sure
Your anchor holds and grips the solid Rock!

In times like these you need the Bible,
In times like these O be not idle;
Be very sure, be very sure
Your anchor holds and grips the solid Rock!

In times like these I have a Savior,
In times like these I have an anchor;
I'm very sure, I'm very sure
My anchor holds and grips the solid Rock!

Last Refrain
This Rock is Jesus, Yes, He's the One,
This Rock is Jesus, The only One!
I'm very sure, I'm very sure
My anchor holds and grips the solid Rock!

title:
Ahenni No Ba, Dqn Nti Na Wotx Nko?
Heir of the Kingdom

Momma Kanea Biara Nhyerqn
Let Every Lamp Be Burning
songEN:
Momma kanea biara nhyerqn,
'Sum kabii dxn no rebqn'
Wiase 'nadwo sum kabii a
Edi 'W'ra no mmae n'anim.

Nnyeso
Qnde, me nuanom, munsiesie
Mo akanea nyamesurom';
Owura no mmae no rebqn,
Momma kanea biāra nhy'rqn.

Mpempem kx so totx nko na
Wxpow nkrasqm kqsen' de;
Yqde yqn gyidi no besi
Ne mmae ho bxhyq no so.

N'asqm ne nokwar', ky'rq yqn kwan,
Yqrentumi mfom kwan da;
Mmusu twa yqn ho hyia mpo a
Yqn de, wxrennyaw yqn da.

Momfa nnwuma pa mfra gyidi,
Mfa mmoa wiasefo nyinaa;
B're a gyidi kyeky're yqn no,
Setie de nhyira pii ba.
songTWI:
Let every lamp be burning bright,
The darkest hour is nearing;
The darkest hour of earth's long night,
Before the Lord's appearing.

Refrain
Then trim your lamps, my brethren dear,
Then trim your lamps with godly fear;
The Master's coming draweth near,
Let every lamp be burning.

Though thousands calmly slumber on,
The last great message spuring,
Wel'll rest our living faith upon
His promise of returning.

His word our lamp, His truth our guide,
We cannot be mistaken;
Though dangers rise on every side,
We shall not be forsaken.

Then let good works with faith appear,
To help the world atound us;
Obedience bring the blessing near
When faith has firmly bound us.

title:
Monhwehwq 'Tempxn No
Look for the Waymarks
songEN:
Monhwehwq 'tempxn no, brč a mokx no,
Monhwehwq 'tempxn no, sq etwam nk'ro nk'ro;
Awo ntoatoaso ne 'henni nnan nom'
Hefa na yqwx 'i? Monhwq 'kwan no bio.

Nnyeso
Monhwq' tempxn no, 'Diyifo no akwan no,
Awo ntoatoaso ne 'henni nnan nom'
Monhwq 'tempxn no- 'Diyifo no akwan no
Kwantun' reba n'awiei.

Asiria 'henni dii wiase so kan,
Afei Medo-Persia him wxn frankaa;
Brč a Helafo nso besoom' no akyi,
Romafo nso bae. Yqwx he nnq yi?

Yqwx dade ne dxte nan ase,
Qrenkyq, mm'rqwyq ne mpaapaem betwam;
'Nuonyam kqse bqn na yqbqhu bio?
Kristo ne Ne mmae, qne daa nkwa no.
songTWI:
Look for the waymarks as you journey on,
Look for the waymarks, passing one by one;
Down through the ages, past the kingdoms four—
Where are we standing? Look the waymarks o'er.

Refrain
Look for the waymarks, the great prophetic waymarks,
Down through the ages, past the kingdoms four.
Look for the waymarks, the great prophetic waymarks;
The journey's almost o'er.

First, the Assyrian kingdom ruled the world,
Then Medo-Persia's banners were unfurled;
And after Greece held universal sway,
Rome seized the scepter—Where are we today?

Down in the feet of iron and of clay,
Weak and divided, soon to pass away;
What will the next great, glorious drama be?
Christ and His coming, and eternity.

title:
Mo Awurade Nkoa
Ye Servants of the Lord
songEN:
Mo Awurade nkoa
'Biara ntwqn n'adwumam'
Nhyq Ne s'ro asqm no nso na
Xnwqn pon no ano.

Momma mo 'kanea nhy'rqn
Na gyaframa no nsx;
Mommx mo abxso N'anim;
Mompae Ne mmae no mu.

Monwqn, mo W'ra hyq mo,
Yegu so yi, Wabqn;
Monhwq Ne nsa sqnky'rqnne no,
Na ne ny'naa da adi.

Akoa pa no ne nea
Wobehu n' saa kwan so!
Ne W'ra de 'nigye behu no,
Ahyq no ahenkyqw.
songTWI:
Ye servants of the Lord,
Each in his office wait;
Observant of His heavenly word,
And watchful at his gate.

Let all your lamps be bright,
And trim the golden flame;
Gird up your loins as in His sight;
His coming thus proclaim.

Watch, 'tis your Lord's command,
And while we speak he's near;
Mark the first signal of His hand,
And ready all appear.

O happy servant, he,
In such a posture found!
He shall his Lord with rapture see,
And be with honor crowned.

title:
Monwqn, Mo 'Hotefo, Monnyan
Watch, Ye Saints
songEN:
Monwqn, mmo 'hotefo, monnyan;
Hwq! s'ro ahoxden rewosow;
Momma mo akanea nhyerqn
Na montwqn mo Wura mmae no.

Nnyeso
Xreba! Yesu reba!
Hwq Xreba wx 'nuonyam mu!
Yesu bedi hen' nkonim mu!
Xreba! Yesu reba!

Hwq! Agyenkwa no bxhyq no,
Bxne fafiri ne xdom,
Ntade fitaa 'nuonyam 'henkyqw;
Ka xgye 'sqmpa no kyerq.

Ahenni rehwehwe ase,
Tie! Ne teaseqnam rewosow;
Ka kyerq sq dom pii wx hx,
B'rč a wogu so hyqn t'robqnton'.

title:
Munni 'H'rusi, 'Gyidifo
Rejoice, Rejoice, Believers
songEN:
Munni 'h'rusi, 'gyidifo
Momfa mo akanea.
Adesae akx anim
Na 'sum kabii rebqn;
'Yef'rokun' no resxre
Qrenkyq Obepue
Monsxr', monwqn, mommx mpae
'Frq no bqba 'dasum.

Bepx so 'wqmfo, mompaem
Sq 'yef'rokun' abqn.
Munkohyia No wx kwan mu
Monto Haleluya;
Aponto no ad'ru so
Wxabuebue apon no;
Monsxr' mo anuonyam mma,
'Yef'rokun' no abqn.

'Hotefo a boasetxm'
Moasoa mo 'sqnnua ha
Bqtrā ase adi hen' daa
Brč a 'w'rqhow nni hx bio.
'Nuonyam ahengua no so,
Mubehu' Guammaan' de
Mo sika' henkyqw agu
N'anim nkonimdi mu.

Yesu, yqn 'nidaso ne
Hwehwqde, bra seesei;
'Wia a yqatwqn Wo akyq
Pue sum wiase yi so!
Yqma koma ne nsa so
Srq Wo sq, ma yenhu
Dā a 'sase benya nkwagyč a
Qde yqn ba Wo nkyqn.
songTWI:
Rejoice, rejoice, believers,
And let your lights appear:
The evening is advancing,
And darker night is near.
The Bridegroom is arising
And soon He draweth nigh:
Up, pray and watch and wrestle,
At midnight comes the cry.

The watchers on the mountain
Proclaim the Bridegroom near.
Go, meet Him as He cometh,
With hallelujahs clear.
The marriage feast is waiting,
The gates wide open stand;
Up, up, you heirs of glory,
The Bridegroom is at hand.

You saints who were in patience
Your cross and suff'rings bore,
Shall live and reign forever,
When sorrow is no more.
Upon the throne of glory
The Lamb you shall behold,
In triumph cast before Him
Your diadems of gold.

Our hope and expectation,
O Jesus, appear;
Arise, O sun so longed for,
O'er this benighted sphere!
With hearts and hands uplifted,
We plead, O Lord, to see
The day of earth's redemption
That brings us unto Thee.

title:
Wxama 'Gyidifo Nyinaa Bxhyq Pa
Munnyina Pintinn
Hold Fast Till I Come
songEN:
Wxama 'gyidifo nyinaa bxhyq pa-
"Hwq, Meba ntqm abqgye M'ankasa de,
Munnyina pintinn kosi sq Mqba;
Monneda sq binom; monwqn na montwqn".

Nnyeso
"Munnyina Pintim", Xs'ro bxhyq pa-
"Yiw, wxde ahenni no bqma mo.
"Mommra M'anigyem, montra M'agua so;
Ahenkyqw retwqn mo; munnyina pintinn".

Yqbqwqn b'rč a yqn 'kanea redqre;
Xba afof'ro nkyqn sq "wifo 'nadwo"
Yenim sq Wabqn, nso yqnnim da no;
Mmom fefqb're ky'rq sq 'huhub're abqn.

Yqn 'nidaso ni, egy'na N'asqm so-
Yqn W'ra Yesu anuounyam ahoyi no;
Bxhyq horow no nyinaa txfa ni:
"Hwq, Mereba ntqm so, munnyina pintinn".
songTWI:
Sweet promises is given to all who believe-
"Behold I come quickly, Mine own to receive;
Hold fast till I come; the danger is great;
Sleep not as do others; be watchful, and wait."

Refrain
"Hold fast till I come;" sweet promises of heaven-
"The kingdom restored, to you shall be given"
"Come, enter My joy, sit down on My throne;
Bright crowns are in waiting; hold fast till I come."

We'll "watch unto prayer" with lamps burning bright;
He comes to all others a "thief in the night."
We know He is near, but know not that day
As spring shows that summer is not far away.

Yes! This is our hope, 'tis built on His word-
The glorious appearing of Jesus, our Lord;
Of promises all, it stands as the sum:
"Behold I come quickly, hold fast till I come."

title:
Sion Fasu So Awqmfo
Watchmen, On The Walls of Zion
songEN:
Sion fasu so awqmfo,
Anadwo dxn bqn mu ni?
So anxpa ns'romma repue?
Ade bqkyq yqn seesei?
Mō adehu mu,
Hann bi hy'rqn wx mu anaa?

O, monkx so nka nkyerq yqn
So yqadu 'kwantun' awiei?
So yqrebqn fie hx anaa?
Yetumi hu 'sase no? Yehu ampa
Sq ahenni no abqn?

Hann repue na ade rekye,
Momma yqnteqteqm' kqse;
Yehu 'dekyee ns'romma repue
Hyqnhyqn wx ewim nohoa!
Munnė 'h'rusi;
Na mo nkwagye no abqn.

Yqahu 'kwanky'rqdč a qky'rq sq
Ampa yqabqn 'sase no;
Anim ara na yqrekx,
Qrenkyq yebedu fie; Momma mo nne
So nto 'h'rusi dwom kronkron.
songTWI:
Watchmen, on the walls of Zion,
What O tell us, of the night?
Is the daystar now arising?
Will the morn soon greet our sight?
O'er your vision Shine there now some rays of light?
O'er your vision Shine there now some rays of light?

Tell, O tell us, are the landmarks
On our voyage all passed by?
Are we nearing now the haven?
Can we e'en the land descry?
Do we truly See the heavenly kingdom nigh?
Do we truly See the heavenly kingdom nigh?

Light is beaming, day is coming!
Let us sound aloud the cry;
We behold the daystar rising
Pure and bright in yonder sky!
Saints, be joyful; Your redemption draweth nigh;
Saints, be joyful; Your redemption draweth nigh.

We have found the chart and compass,
And are sure the land is near;
Onward, onward we are hasting,
Soon the haven will appear;
Let your voices Sound aloud your holy cheer;
Let your voices Sound aloud your holy cheer.

title:
Onua, Di Nokware, Yesu Reba Ntqm
O Brother, Be Faithful
songEN:
Onua, di nokware, Yesu reba ntqm,
Xno na yqatwqn no akyq;
Qrenkyq yqbqhyqn yqn 'nuonyam fie nom',
Ato nkonimdifo dwom no,
Onua, di nokware, dqn nti na yenni
Nokware mma Nea Waky'rq dx
A enni kabea te sqq na Owui de
Gyee yqn a yqyq Ne de no?

Onua, di nokware, sika kuro a
Wxasiesie ama hy'rafo no,
Retwqn sq qbqda adi N'ahoxfem';
Agye w' akx wo home mu
Onua, di nokware, yqrenkx so ntra
Ahohia mu bio wx fam ha;
Awerqhow 'nadwo sum no retwam kx
Yqrebqn 'nuonyam 'dekyee no.

Onua, di nokware, q'nkyq Obesian,
Abxde Hen' Twieduampxn no,
B're a abxfo mpemem no di N'akyi
Kura nkonimdi berqw no,
Onua, di nokware, q'nkyq wobqte
Sq w'Agyenkwa no reka sq
"Mo, akoa nokwafo, woanya 'bodin sq
Wobqhyqn wo W'ra anigyem.

Onua, di nokware na mmeresanten
Bqka wo nnq 'nokwar'di no
B're a dqw ne s'rew bqpopa wo nusu,
Na wxahyq wo ahenkyqw no.
Onua, di nokware, bxhyq no bqba,
Nea qretwqn nokwafo no;
Wo ne wxn a wxagye wxn no bedi hen;
Na wo ne Yesu atra daa.
songTWI:
O brother, be faithful! Soon Jesus will come,
For whom we have waited so long;
O, soon we shall enter our glorious Index,
And join in the conqueror's song.
O brother, be faithful! For why should we prove
Unfaithful to Him who hath shown
Such deep, such unbounded and infinite love—
Who died to redeem us His own.

O brother, be faithful! The city of gold,
Prepared for the good and the blest,
Is waiting its portals of pearl to unfold,
And welcome thee in to thy rest.
Then, brother, prove faithful! Not long shall we stay
in weariness here, and forlorn,
Time's dark night of sorrow is wearing away,
We haste to the glorious morn.

O brother, be faithful! He soon will descend,
Creation's omnipotent King,
While legions of angels His chariot attend,
And palm wreaths, of victory bring.
O brother, be faithful! And soon shalt thou hear
Thy Savior pronounce the glad word,
Well done, faithful servant, thy title is clear,
To enter the joy of thy Lord.

O brother, be faithful! Eternity's years
Shall tell for thy faithfulness now,
When bright smiles of gladness shall scatter thy tears,
A coronet gleam on thy brow.
O brother, be faithful! The promise is sure
That waits for the faithful and tried;
To reign wit h the ransomed, immortal and pure,
And ever with Jesus abide.

title:
Kristoni, Nnye W'aIndex
Christian, Seek Not Repose

Yennim B're Ko No a Owura No Reba
We Know Not the Hour
songEN:
Yennim b're ko no a Owura no reba,
Nanso nsqnky'rqnne nyinaa kyerq sq b're a
Xbqba no abqn - anigye bxhyq ni!
Nanso yennim b're ko.

Nnyeso
Xbqba, momma yqnnwqn nyq 'hoboa,
Xbqba, haleluya, haleluya!
Xbqba N'Agya anuonyam mununkum no mu.
Nanso yennim b're ko.

Hann wx hx ma mmadwemmā a wxhwehwq nkwagye;
Nokware wx 'W'rade adiyi nwoma nom'
Nkxmhyq no mu biara ky'rq awiei kqse no,
Nanso yennim b're ko.

Yqde yqn 'kanea no bqwqn abx mpae na
Yqayq 'dwuma atwqn kosi 'Wura no mmae.
Yqbqte sqnky'rqnne biarā ase ato dwom,
Nanso yennim b're ko.

title:
Me Kra, Yq Ahweyie!
My Soul, Be on Thy Guard
songEN:
Me kra, yq ahweyie!
'Tamfo mpemdu sxre,
Bxne ahorow hyq wo so
Retwe wo fi xs'ro.

O wqn, ko na bx mpae!
Nnyae xko no mu da;
Si wo bo yq no fof'ro daa,
Na srq mmoa fi xs'ro.

Nnwen sq nkonim aba,
Mfa w'akode ngu hx;
W'adwuma kqse no rensa,
Gye sq woanya 'henkyqw.
songTWI:
My soul, be on thy guard!
Ten thousand foes arise;
The hosts of sin are pressing hard
To draw thee from the skies.

O watch, and fight, and pray!
The battle ne'er give o'er;
Renew it boldly every day,
And help divine implore.

Ne'er think the victory won,
Nor lay thine armor down;
Thy arduous task will not be done
Till thou obtain the crown.

title:
B're Bi Ha Ma Nipa Ne 'Man
Once to Every Man and Nation
songEN:
B're bi ba ma nipa ne 'man
Sq wxbqyq nsusui bi
Fa nokwar' anaa atorx,
Papa anaa bxne ho
Nyame Mesaia fof'ro
Ma 'hotx anaa 'hohia;
Na nea wxbqpaw, hann anaa
Esum no bqtra hx daa.

Eye sq yqpaw nokware
B'rč a yenya ne haw no bi
Ansa na yqanya ne mfaso;
Na trenee mu wx nhyira;
Qno na 'kokod'rufo paw
B'rč a ahufo gyina nkyqn
Kosi sq qdxm a wxpow
Gyidi no bqsan aba.

Yqde mogyadansefo hann
Toa W'anammxn no, Kristo;
Yqsoa 'sqnnua kx Kalbre daa,
'Sqnnuā a qnnan n'akyi nky'rq;
Mm're a de nnwuma fof'ro ba ma
Kan nnepa dan tetesqm;
Qsq wxn a wobekura
Nokwar' mu sq sxkx anim.

Ewom, bxne nya nkxso de,
Nanso nokwar' n'egyina;
Ne kyqfa bqyq 'sqnnua ma
Bxne atra agua so;
Nanso qyq saa 'sennua no
Na ekura daakye mu,
Nyame fi s'ro hwq Ne mma so
Wx esum kabii no mu.
songTWI:
Once to every man and nation
Comes the moment to decide,
In the strife of truth with falsehood,
For the good or evil side;
Some great cause, God's new Messiah,
Offering each the bloom or blight,
And the choice goes by forever
'Twixt that darkness and that light.

Then to side with truth is noble
When we share her wretched crust,
Ere her cause bring fame and profit,
And 'tis prosperous to be just;
Then it is the brave man chooses,
While the coward stands aside,
Till the multitude make virtue
Of the faith they had denied.

By the light of burning martyrs,
Christ, Thy bleeding feet we track,
Toiling up new Calvaries ever
With the cross that turns not back;
New occasions teach new duties,
Time makes ancient good uncouth;
They must upward still and onward,
Who would keep abreast of truth.

Though the cause of evil prosper,
Yet 'tis truth alone is strong;
Though her portion be the scaffold,
And upon the throne be wrong;
Yet the scaffold sways the future,
And, behind the dim unknown,
Standeth God within the shadow,
Keeping watch above His own.

title:
Anuonyam Ne Dom Nyame, Hwie
God of Grace and God of Glory
songEN:
Anuonyma ne dom Nyame hwie
Wo tumi gu Wo mma so;
Ma W'asafo nsa nka bxhyqn'
Na ma ennyin sq nhwiren;
Ma yqn nyansa ne aboxd'ru
Na qmmoa yqn dxn yi mu.

'Tamfo atwa yqn ho ahyia
Wxredi Kristo ho fqw;
Gye yqn koma fi 'hu mu na
Ennya gyidi ne nkamfo;
Ma yqn nyansa ne aboxd'ru
Na qmmoa yqn dxn yi mu.

Yi akosqm fi Wo mma mu;
Di yqn ahantan ny'naa so.
Ma y'ani nwu sq yqbqpq
'Honyade sen xkra no;
Ma yqn nyansa ne aboxd'ru
Na qmmoa yqn dxn yi mu.

Fa yqn nan si nea hx k'rxn na
Sx yqn bra mu ma yqmfa
Kristo nyq yqn akode wx
Yqn ahofadi ko nom';
Ma yqn nyansa ne aboxd'ru
Na qmmoa yqn dxn yi mu.
songTWI:
God of grace and God of glory,
On Thy people pour Thy power;
Now fulfill Thy church's story,
Bring her bud to glorious flower.
Grant us wisdom, grant us courage,
For the facing of this hour.

Lo, the hosts of evil round us
Scorn Thy Christ, assail His ways;
From the fears that long have bound us
Free our hearts to faith and praise.
Grant us wisdom, grant us courage,
For the facing of this hour.

Cure Thy children's wearing madness,
Bend our pride to Thy control;
Shame our wanton, selfish gladness
Rich in goods and poor in soul.
Grant us wisdom, grant us courage,
Lest we miss Thy kingdom's goal.

Set our feet on lofty places,
Gird our lives that they may be
Armored with all Christ-like graces
In the fight to set all free.
Grant us wisdom, grant us courage,
That we fail not man nor Thee.

title:
Mo, Kristo Nsraafo a Mowx
Gyidi Ne Tumi No
Faith Is the Victory
songEN:
Mo, Kristo nsraafo a mowx
Hann mmepx so, monsxr';
Momfa 'nimia nko ansa na
'Sum akata ewim.
Momma yqnka yqn 'hoxden mmom'
Ne tamfon' nko dennen;
Yenim sq gyidi ne tum' a
Edi wiase so nim.

Nnyeso
Gyidi ne tumi no,
Gyidi ne tumi no,
O, anuonyam tumi a
Edi wiase so nim.

Yehu tamfon' baabiara sq
Wahyq n'akotade;
Mumfi 'nihaw ntamadan mu
Nnantew nkx akono.
Monhyq nkwagye dadekyqw na
Nokwar' nkyeky're mo ho;
'Sase bqwosow yqn nan'se
Na yqn nteam agyigye.

Nea odi tamfon' so nim no
Benya' tade fitaa.
Obqte sq wxabx ne din
S'ro abxfo anim.
Afei yqde xdx koma
Befi hann mmepxn' so
Ako adi esum no so,
Wx Yesu din no mu.
songTWI:
Encamped along the hills of light,
Ye Christians soldiers, rise,
And press the battle ere the night
Shall veil the glowing skies.
Against the foe in vales below
Let all our strength be hurled;
Faith is the victory, we know,
That overcomes the world.

Refrain
Faith is the victory! Faith is the victory!
O, glorious victory, That overcomes the world.

On every hand the foe we find
Drawn up in dread array;
Let tents of ease be left behind,
And onward to the fray;
Salvation's helmet on each head,
With truth all girt about,
The earth shall tremble 'neath our tread,
And echo with our shout.

To him that overcomes the foe,
White raiment shall be giv'n;
Before the angels he shall know
His name confessed in heav'n.
Then onward from the hills of light,
Our hearts with love aflame,
We'll vanquish all the hosts of night,
In Jesus' conquering name.

title:
So Meyq 'Sqnnuan' Ho Sraani
Am I a Soldier of the Cross
songEN:
So meyq 'sqnnuan' ho sraani,
'Guammaa no 'kyidini?
Misųro sq mqyq N'adwuma
Anaa mqbx Ne din?

So wxmfa me nkx ewim wx
Ahotx pa mu, b'rč a
Binom de wxn mogya reko
Hwehwq akyqde no?

So tamfo bi nni hx ma me?
Merensiw haw n' ano?
So bxn' wiase 'i yq yxnko a
Qde m'kx Nyame nkyqn?

'Sq sq meko na madi hen';
'W'ra, ma me kokod'ru;
Mqfa xbrq ne yaw no mu
B'rč a W'asqm ka me ho.

'Hotefo bewu ko nom' de,
Nanso wobedi nim;
Wxde gyidi aniwa no
Hu nkonimdi aky'ri.

Sq saa da kqse no du na
W'asraafo no ny'naa de
Nkonimdi ntade hy'rqn wim a,
'Nuonyam bqyq wxn de.
songTWI:
Am I a soldier of the cross,
A follower of the Lamb,
And shall I fear to own his cause,
Rr blush to speak his name?

Must I be carried to the skies
On flowery beds of ease,
While others fought to win the prize,
And sailed through bloody seas?

Are there no foes for me to face?
Must I not stem the flood?
Is this vile world a friend to grace,
To help me on to God?

Sure I must fight, if I would reign;
Increase my courage, Lord.
I'll bear the toil, endure the pain,
Supported by thy word.

Thy saints in all this glorious war
Shall conquer though they die;
They see the triumph from afar,
By faith they bring it nigh.

When that illustrious day shall rise,
And all thy armies shine
In robes of victory through the skies,
The glory shall be thine.

title:
O Kristoni, Ow'ra No Hyq Wo Sqq Nyan
'Kodod'ru Mu
Stand Like the Brave
songEN:
O Kristoni, Ow'ra no hyq wo sqq nyan,
Fa wo dadekyqw, w'akokyqm ne nkrantq,
Kohyia xdaadaafo kqse no, nsuro;
Gyina tamfo no anim 'kokod'ru mu.

Nnyeso
'Kokod'ru mu, 'kokod'ru mu;
Gyina 'tamfon' anim 'kokod'ru mu.

Fa 'hoxden yq wo Wura no adwuma,
Fa 'hwqyie ne mmxdenbx ko kodu 'wiei,
Kx nea Xbqky'rq wo no kokod'ru mu;
Gyina 'tamfo no anim kokod'ru mu.

Kx w'anim, nnye kyim na wo sahen' abqn,
Okura dom ne 'w'rqkyekye de ma wo;
Ne dx no bqsen sare so sq nsuten,
Gyina 'tamfo no anim kokod'ru mu.

title:
Me Kra, Nyan, Bx Mmxden Biara
Awake, My Soul!
songEN:
Me kra, nyan bx mmxden biara,
Kx w'anim hoxden so'
S'ro mm'rikatu hia mmxdenbx
Ne 'henkyqw a qnsqe.

Qyq Nyame nne a nkwa wom'
Na efi s'ro frq wo;
Ne nsa na qde 'katua no
Ky'rq 'nidaso 'niwa.

Adansefo mununkum no
Ani tua nea woyq;
Ma wo w'rq mfi 'nammxn dedaw,
Na kx w'anim ara.

Agyenkwa pa, Woadi yqn kan
Yqn mm'rika no mfiase;
Yqde yqn nkonimdi bo no
Begu Wo nan ase.
songTWI:
Awake, my soul! Stretch every nerve,
And press with vigor on;
A heavenly race demands thy zeal,
And an immortal crown.

'Tis God's all animating voice
That calls thee from on high;
'Tis He whose hand presents the prize
To thine aspiring eye.

A cloud of witnesses around
Hold thee in full survey;
Forget the stepds already trod,
And onward urge thy way.

Blest Savoir, introduced by Thee,
Our race have we begun;
And, crowned with victory, at Thy feet
We'll lay our trophies down.

title:
Kristo Nsraafo, Monkx
Onward, Christian Soldiers!
songTWI:
Onward, Christian soldiers, marching as to war,
With the cross of Jesus going on before.
Christ, the royal Master, leads against the foe;
Forward into battle see his banners go!

Refrain
Onward, Christian soldiers, marching as to war,
With the cross of Jesus going on before.

Like a mighty army moves the church of God;
Brothers, we are treading where the saints have trod.
We are not divided, all one body we,
One in hope and doctrine, one in charity.

Crowns and thrones my perish, kingdoms rise and wane,
But the church of Jesus constant will remain.
Gates of hell can never 'gainst that church prevail;
We have Christ's own promise, and that cannot fail.

Onward then, ye people, join our happy throng,
Blend with ours your voices in the triumph song.
Glory, laud, and honor unto Christ the King,
This through countless ages men and angels sing.

title:
Fa W'adoxden No Ko Ko Pa
Fight the Good Fight

Monhyqn Akobqn! Hwq
Sound the Battle Cry
songEN:
Monhyqn akobqn! hwq, 'tamfon' abqn,
Momma frankaa so mma 'W'rade;
Monhyq akode, munnyina pintinn;
Momfa mo kwan no mfa N'asqm so.

Nnyeso
Munyan, nsraafo! muntwa franka n'ho nhyia,
Nsiesie mo ho, mfa asqm no nkx;
Monkx anim, monteqm sq, hosana!
Kristo ne Sahen' wx dxm yi so.

Yqkx 'hoxden mu, yehyia 'tamfo no,
Yenim sq yqn dxm bedi nim;
'Kokyqm ne frankaa hyerqn hann no mu,
Yqko ko pa yi, yqrenni ntwo.

Yqn Agya Nyame, yqfrq Wo a, tie;
Boa yqn nyinaa 'ra, Wo dom nti
Sq yewie ko no, di mu nkonim a,
Hyq yqn nkonim kyqw wx W'anim hx.
songTWI:
Sound the battle cry, See! the foe is nigh;
Raise the standard high For the Lord;
Gird your armor on, Stand firm, every one,
Rest your cause upon His holy word.

Refrain
Rouse, then soldiers! rally round the banner!
Ready, steady, pass the word along;
Onward, forward, shout aloud hosanna!
Christ is Captain of the mighty throng.

Strong to meet the foe, Marching on we go,
While our cause we know Must prevail;
Shield and banner bring, Gleaming in the light,
Battling for the right, We ne'er can fail.

O Thou God of all, Hear us when we call,
Help us, one and all, By Thy grace;
When the battle's done, And the victory won,
May we wear the crown Before Thy face.

title:
Monsxr' Nyame Mmanin
Rise Up, O Men of God
songEN:
Monsxr' Nyame mmanin
Na 'hemman no rekyq;
Momfa 'nuadx 'dekyee no mmra,
Na bxne 'nadwo nnyae.

Momma mmaa ny'naa nsxre,
Ntow nneqma hun' ny'naa ngu;
Momfa koma, 'hoxden nč adwen
Nsom ahen' mu Hen' no.

Monsxr, mo mmabun no,
Asafon' retwqn mo;
N'ahoxden sua ma 'dwuma no,
Monsxr' nyq no kqse.

Momma 'sqnnua no so
Munni Kristo akyi;
Onipa Ba no asuafo,
Monsxr' Nyame Asafo.
songTWI:
Rise up, O men of God!
His kingdom tarries long.
Bring in the day of brotherhood
And end the night of wrong.

Let women all rise up!
Have done with lesser things.
Give heart and mind and soul and strength
To serve the King of kings.

Rise up, O men of God!
The church for you doth wait,
her strength unequal to her task;
Rise up, and make her great!

Lift high the cross of Christ!
Tread where his feet have trod.
Disciples of the Son of Man,
Rise up, O church of God!

title:
Kristo Nsraafo Monsxr'!
Soldiers of Christ, Arise
songEN:
Kristo nsraafo' monsxr'!
Monhyq mo akode!
Monyq den tum' a Nyame nam
Ne Ba no so ma nom',
Asafo Yehowa Ahoxden kqse no;
Nea xtwer' Yesu 'hoxden no,
Xsen nkonimdifo.

Momfa N'ahoxden no
Nnyina Ne tumi mu;
Momfa Nyame akode no
Nhyehyq mma mo ko no;
Sq moyq ne ny'naa wie,
Na 'p'rep're no twam a,
Monam Kristo so adi nim,
Na moawie pqyq nso.

Monkx so 'hoxden mu;
Momp're, monko, mmx mpae;
Montiatia esum tumi so
Na munni nkonim no.
Ma Honhom no nteqm mfa
'Sraafo nom' sq: "Mommra!"
Kosi sq 'W'ra Kristo bqfa
Nkonimfo akx fie.
songTWI:
Soldiers of Christ, arise,
And put your armor on,
Strong in the strength which God supplies
Through His eternal Son;
Strong in the Lord of hosts,
And in His might power,
Who in the strength of Jesus trusts
Is more than conqueror.

Stand, then, in His great might,
With all His strength endued;
Butr take, to arm you for the fight,
The panoply of God;
That, having all things done,
And all your conflicts passed,
You may o'ercome thro' Christ alone,
And stand entire at last.

From strength to strength go on;
Wrestle, and fight, and pray;
Tread all the powers of darkness down,
And win the well-fought day;
Still let the Spirit cry,
In all His soldiers "Come!"
Till Christ the Lord who reigns on high
Shall take the conquerors Index.

title:
Yqte Ase, Yqte Nkwa Mu
We Are Living, We Are Dwelling
songEN:
Yqte ase, yqte nkwa mu,
Bere a qyq hu mu,
Mm'rq mu bere a asetra
Ayq dadwen kqse yi.
Tie, amanaman resxre,
Gog ne Magog kx sqe mu;
Tie, dqn ni? Abxde nyinaa
Si apini kx n'awiei?

Kristoni, boa wo ho kxko,
Hyqw' ho den kx akonim;
Hyq nkwagye dadekyqw no na
Fa 'sqmpa kyqm no kura;
Fa asomdwoe nkatabo no,
Kura honhom mu nkrantq;
Kx w'anim akokod'ru mu
Wx Yehowa 'hoxden mu.

Na ahonhommxne hen' no,
Wiase daadaafo kqsen',
Nea b're bi otuu Yesu a
Wxahy'ra No no so sa no,
De ahoxden nwanwaso ba
'Fisq ne b're rebā awiei
Ama wxde ahenni no
Ama asomdwoe Hen' no.

'Kristoni sxr', ko xko no;
Ko kodu nkonimdi mu;
Kosi sq wo Sahen' teqm sq
"'W'rade akoa, mo ne yx"
Nea odi nokwar' na xtram'
Kosi awiei no nkutoo,
Benya bxhyq atra ase
Ahenni no mu daapem.
songTWI:
We are living, we are dwelling,
In a grand and awful time,
In an age on ages telling—
To be living is sublime.
Hark! The waking up of nations,
Gog and Magog to the fray;
Hark! What soundeth? Is creation
Groaning for her latter day?

Christian, rouse and arm for conflict,
Nerve thee for the battlefield;
Bear the helmet of salvation,
And the mighty gospel shield;
Let the breastplate, peace, be on thee,
Take the Spirit's sword in hand;
Boldly, fearlessly, go forth then,
In Jehovah's strength to stand.

And the prince of evil spirits,
Great deceiver of the world!
He who at the blessed Jesus
Once his deadly weapons hurled,
Cometh with unwonted power,
Knowing that his reign will cease
When the kingdom shall be given
To the might Prince of Peace.

Christian, rouse! fight in this warfare,
Cease not till the victory's won;
Till your Captain loud proclaimeth,
"Servant of the Lord, well done!"
He, alone, who thus is faithful,
Who abideth to the end,
Hath the promise, in the kingdom
An eternity to spend.

title:
Monsxr' Nnyina Mma Yesu!
Stand Up, Stand Up for Jesus
songEN:
Monsxr' nnyina mma Yesu!
Asqnnua ho nsraafo;
Momma Ne frankaa no so,
Qnsq sq qyera;
'Fi nim mu kx nkonim mu,
Obedi N' dxm anim
Kosi sq 'tamfo agu,
Na Kristo ne 'Wura.

Monsxr' nnyina mma Yesu!
Munti t'robqnto nne;
Monkx ko kqsen' anim
N'anuonyam da yi mu.
Mo mmarima, monsom No,
Nko ntia 'tamfo dxm pii
Nnya kokod'ru amanem',
Momfa ahoxden nko.

Monsxr' nnyina mma Yesu!
N'ahoxden no mu nko;
'Honam bedi mo huammx
Muntwer' mo ankasa.
Monhyq 'sqmpa akode,
Monwqn wx mpaebx mu;
Xsom mų oo, amane mų oo,
Monnan mō akyi nky'rq da.

Monsxr' nnyina mma Yesu!
Xko no renkyq pii,
Qnnq xko gyegyeegye,
Xkyena nkonim no
Nea odi mu nkonim no
Benya nkwa abot'ri,
Na xne 'nuonyam Hen' no
Bedi ahen' daa daa.
songTWI:
Stand up, stand up for Jesus,
Ye soldiers of the cross;
Lift high his royal banner,
Yt must not suffer loss.
From victory unto victory
His army shall he lead,
Till every foe is vanquished,
And Christ is Lord indeed.

Stand up, stand up for Jesus,
The trumpet call obey;
Forth to the mighty conflict,
In this His glorious day.
Ye that are His now serve Him
Against unnumbered foes;
Let courage rise with danger,
And strength to strength oppose.

Stand up, stand up for Jesus,
Stand in his strength alone;
The arm of flesh will fail you,
Ye dare not trust your own.
Put on the gospel armor,
And watching unto prayer;
Where duty calls, or danger,
Be never wanting there.

Stand up, stand up for Jesus,
The strife will not be long;
This day the noise of battle,
The next the victor's song.
To him that overcometh,
A crown of life shall be;
He with the King of Glory
Shall reign eternally.

title:
Di Yqn Anim, Daapem Hen
Lead On, O King Eternal
songEN:
Di yqn anim, daapem hen',
Xsa b're no adu;
Wo ntamadan ne yqn fie
Fi nnq akonim hx;
Yqn ahoboa mm're nyinaam',
Wo dom ahyq yqn den'
Enti daapem Hen', yqma
Yqn ako dwom so nnq.

Di yqn anim, daapem Hen'
Kosi bxn' ko awiei;
Kronkronyq de dqw bqka
Asomdwoe Amen no,
'Fisq 'nyq afoa anaa
Twene nnyigyei bi so,
'Hummxb'rx ne dex nnwuma
N'qde s'ro 'henni ba.

Di yqn anim, daapem Hen'
Yedi W'akyi, yensųro,
'Fisq Wuyi W'anim a,
'Nigye pue sq 'nxpa.
W'asqnnua no wx yqn so,
Yqnantew ne hann mu;
'Henkyqw retwqn nkonimdi
Nyame di yqn anim.
songTWI:
Lead on, O King eternal,
The day of march has come;
Henceforth in fields of conquest
Thy tents shall be our Index.
Through days of preparation
Thy grace has made us strong;
And now, O King eternal,
We lift our battle song.

Lead on, O King eternal,
Till sin's fierce war shall cease,
And holiness shall whisper
The sweet amen of peace.
For not with swords loud clashing,
Nor roll of stirring drums;
With deeds of love and mercy
The heavenly kingdom comes.

Lead on, O King eternal,
We follow, not with fears,
For gladness breaks like morning
Where'er thy face appears.
Thy cross is lifted o'er us,
We journey in its light;
The crown awaits the conquest;
Lead on, O God of might.

title:
Migyina Yordan Agya Hx
On Jordan's Stormy Banks
songEN:
Migyina Yordan agya hx,
Na meto m'ani hwq
Kanaan 'nigye asase no
Nea m'agyapade wx.

Nnyeso
Merekx bxhyq 'sase so,
Merekx bxhyq 'sase so,
O, hena ne me bqkx hx?
Merekx bxhyq 'sase so.

Nsase pataa no akyi na
Dā a qnsa da no hy'rqn;
Hx na Kristo di hen' daa daa,
Na Xpam sum fi hx.

Medu 'nigye bea hx da bqn,
Na manya daa nhyira?
Mehu m'Agya anim da bqn
Ahom' N'ahemman nom'?

Anigye ahyq me kra ma
Merentumi ntra ha;
Yordan 's'rxkye bx me ho mpō a
Minsųro, mqkx anim.
songTWI:
On Jordan's stormy banks I stand,
And cast a wishful eye
To Canaan's fair and happy land,
Where my possessions lie.

Refrain
I am bound for the promised land,
I am bound for the promised land;
O who will come and go with me?
I am bound for the promised land.

O'er all those wide extended plain
Shines one eternal day;
There, Christ, the Sun, for ever reigns,
And scatters night away.

When shall I reach that happy place,
And be forever blest?
When shall I see my Father's face,
And in His kingdom rest?

Filled with delight, my raptured soul
Would here no longer stay;
Though Jordan's waves around me roll,
Fearless I'd launch away.

title:
Agya Dqqfo, BxW' Mma Ho Ban
Gracious Father, Guard Thy Children
songEN:
Agya Dqqfo, bxW' mma ho ban
Fi xtamfo no sqe mu'
'W'ra, gye wxn fi asehwe mu,
Sum ne sxhwq dxn yi mu!
Wobqsx Wo nk'rxfo ahwq,
Etwa sq yqfa sxhwqm'
Nanso W'asqm hy'rqn yqn kwan so
Na yqn w'rq hyq Nyame mu.

Xtwqn b're mu na yqwx yi,
Qrenkyq yebehu No,
B're a yqn aw'rqhow atwam,
Akxgye yqn akatua;
'W'ra kōra yqn fi fam nkekae ho
Kosi W'ahoyi no mu,
Ma Wo Honhom no nhyq yqn den
Kosi sqW' frankaa behim.

Ahotefo no de dqw na
Ebehu Wo frankaa no.
B're a 'W'ra a yqatwqn No no
Bqma nkonimdi nteam no;
Yqanya ahofadi afi
Wiase porxe, bxn' ne yaw,
Satan mfiri horow nyinaa,
Ne 'wu sqe ahenni nom'.
songTWI:
Gracious Father, guard Thy children
From the foe's destructive power;
Save, O save them, Lord, from falling
In this dark and trying hour.
Thou wilt surely prove Thy people,
All our graces must be tried;
But Thy word illumes our pathway,
And in God we still confide.

We are in the time of waiting;
Soon we shall behold our Lord,
Wafted far away from sorrow,
To receive our rich reward.
Keep us, Lord, till Thine appearing,
Pure, unspotted from the world;
Let Thy Holy Spirit cheer us
Till Thy banner is unfurled.

With what joyful exultation
Shall the saints Thy banner see,
When the Lord for whom we've waited
Shall proclaim the jubilee!
Freedom from this world's pollutions;
Freedom from all sin and pain;
Freedom from the wiles of Satan,
And from death's destructive reign.

title:
Mommra 'Hotefo, Munnsuro 'Dwuma
Come, Come, Ye Saints
songEN:
Mommra 'hotefo, munnsuro 'dwuma,
Momfa dqw nkx mō anim;
Ewon sq xkwan no mu yq yaw de,
Mubenya xdom pii;
Yqwx 'W'rade teasefo bi a
Xky'rq yqn kwan 'hotoso mu,
Mo koma de dqw bqka sq;
Ne ny'naa ye! Ne ny'naa ye.

Yebenya hom' a Nyame asiesie,
B're a Xbqfrq yqn;
Nea obi ntumi mma mmeyi yqn hu'.
Obedi yqn so hen',
Yqde 'dwonto bqhyq hx ma
Ayi Nyame yqn Hen' ayq:
O, yqbqto dwom 'nigyem' sq:
Ne ny'naa ye! Ne ny'naa ye!
songTWI:
Come, come, ye saints, no toil nor labor fear;
But with joy wend your way.
Though hard to you the journey may appear,
Grace shall be as your day.
We will have a living lord to guide,
And we can trust Him to provide;
Do this, and joy your hearts will swell:
All is well! All is well!

We'll find the rest which God for us prepared,
When at last He will call;
Where none will come to hurt or make afraid,
He will reign over all.
We will make the air with music ring,
Shout praise to God our Lord and King:
O how we'll make the chorus swell:
All is well! All is well!

title:
M'agyenkwa, Medi Wo Akyi
I Will Follow Thee
songEN:
M'Agyenkwa, medi Wo akyi,
Nea me bra besi biara;
Nea Wokx biara mqkx bi,
Yiw, 'Wura, medi W'akyi.

Nnyeso
M'Agyenkwa, medi Wo akyi
Wuhwiee Wo mogya maa me;
'Nti sq nnipa nyinaa pa Wō a,
Wo dom nti medi W'akyi.

Sq kwan nom' nye na nsxe wx mu,
Qyq po a kwan nnam' a,
Woadi m'anim kan afa so,
'Nti dqw mu medi W'akyi.

Sq mihyia xhaw ne yaw na
Sq wxsx me hwq mpo a,
Mekae sq wxsxx Wo hwqe bi,
'Nti mede dqw di W'akyi.

Sq Wode me fa yaw mu na
Ohia tu me gu mpo a,
Wo nso Wudii kan dii yaw bi,
'Nti medi W'akyi ara.

Wode me fa Yordan bun' mu,
Ma awxw kyen me mpo a,
Wo na Wudii kan faa po so,
'Nti medi W'akyi ara.
songTWI:
I will follow Thee, my Savior,
Wheresoe'er my lot may be.
Where thou goest I will follow;
Yes, my Lord, I'll follow Thee.

Refrain
I will follow Thee, my Saviour,
Thou didst shed Thy blood for me;
And though all men should forsake Thee;
By Thy grace I'll follow Thee.

Though the road be rough and thorny,
Trackless as the foaming sea,
Thou hast trod this way before me,
And I'll gladly follow Thee.

Though I meet with tribulations,
Sorely tempted though I be;
I remember Thou wast tempted,
And rejoice to follow Thee.

Though Thou leadest me through affliction,
Poor, forsaken though I be;
Thou wast destitute, afflicted,
And I only follow Thee.

Though to Jordan's rolling billows,
Cold and deep, Thou leadest me,
Thou hast crossed the waves before me,
And I still will follow Thee.

title:
Mepq Sq Yesu Nem' Nantew
I Want Jesus to Walk With Me
songEN:
Mepq sq Yesu nem' nantew,
Mepq sq Yesu nem' nantew,
M'abrabx akwantu yi mu,
Mepq sq Yesu nem' nantew.

Me sxhwq mu, 'W'ra nem' nnantew,
Me sxhwq mu, 'W'ra nem' nnantew,
Sq nkwa sunsuma resa a,
Me sxhwq mu, 'W'ra nem' nnantew.

M'aw'rqhow mu, 'W'ra, nem' nnantew
M'aw'rqhow mu, 'W'ra, nem' nnantew
B're a me koma di yaw no,
M'aw'rqhow mu, 'W'ra, nem' nnantew.
songTWI:
I want Jesus to walk with me.
I want Jesus to walk with me.
All along my pilgrim journey,
I want Jesus to walk with me.

In my trials Lord, walk with me.
In my trials Lord, walk with me.
When the shades of life are falling,
I want Jesus to walk with me.

In my sorrows, Lord, walk with me.
In my sorrows, Lord, walk with me.
When my heart within is aching,
I want Jesus to walk with me.

title:
Meretu Kwan Soro Kwan So
Higher Ground
songEN:
Meretu kwan soro kwan so;
Da biara mef'ro kx anim,
Masi so rqkx 'i, mesrq sq:
"Nyame, fa me nan si nea 'k'rxn"

Nnyeso
'Wura mam' so, ma minnyina,
Gyidim' soro koko no so;
Nea 'hx k'rxn sen nea mahu yi
'Wura, fa me nan si nea 'k'rxn.

Me koma mpq sq qtra ha,
Nea akyinnye ne suro wx,
Ewom binom tra mu saa de,
Nea mesrq ne nea qhx k'rxn.

Mepq sq metra xsoro,
Satan agyan gu me so de;
Nso gyidim' mete nne dqdq
Ahotefo dwom wx nea 'k'rxn.

Mepq sq meforo soro,
Na m'ani hu anuonyam no;
Mesrq kosi sq mehu s'ro,
"Nyame di m'anim kx nea 'k'rxn"
songTWI:
I'm pressing on the upward way,
New heights I'm gaining every day;
Still praying as I onward bound,
"Lord, plant my feet on higher ground."

Refrain
Lord, lift me up, and I shall stand
By faith, on heaven's table land;
A higher plane than I have found;
Lord, plant my feet on higher ground.

My heart has no desire to stay
Where doubts arise and fears dismay;
Though some may dwell where these abound,
My prayer, my aim is higher ground.

I want to live above the world,
Though Satan's darts at me hurled;
For faith has caught the joyful sound,
The song of saints on higher ground.

I want to scale the utmost height,
And catch a gleam of glory bright;
But still I'll pray till heaven I've found,
"Lord, lead me on to higher ground."

title:
Momma Yqnto Anigye Dwom Wo
Qrenkyq Koraa Na Yqadu Fie
In a Little While We're Going Index
songEN:
Momma yqnto anigye dwom wx kwan no so,
Qrenkyq koraa na yqadu fie,
Efisq adesae bqdan daa adekyee;
Qrenkyq koraa na yqadu fie.

Nnyeso
Qrenkyq koraa, qrenkyq koraa
Yebetwa 'sorxkye no; Yqbqsan ahyiam
B're a 'humtu yi betwam;
Qrenkyq koraa na yqadu fie.

Yqbqyq 'dwuma biara a yqn nsa besom',
Qrenkyq koraa na yqadu fie,
Nyame dom bqma yqn ahoxden fof'ro daa;
Qrenkyq koraa na yqadu fie.

Yebesiesie 'kwan ama 'kwantufo brqfo,
Qrenkyq koraa na yqadu fie;
Koma a dx wom ny'naa mfa dqw nhyq wiase ma!
Qrenkyq koraa na yqadu fie.

'Home wx aky'ri nohoa, dadwen bi nni hx,
Qrenkyq koraa na yqadu fie,
Obi renkyi nusu saa kuro hyqhyqn nom'
Qrenkyq koraa na yqadu fie.
songTWI:
Let us sing a song that will cheer us by the way,
In a little while we're going Index;
For the night will end in the everlasting day,
In a little while we're going Index.

Refrain
In a little while, In a little while,
We shall cross the billow's foam;
We shall meet at last, When the stormy winds are past,
In a little while we're going Index.

We will do the work that our hands may find to do,
In a little while we're going Index;
And the grace of God will our daily strength renew,
In a little while we're going Index.

We will smooth the path for some weary, way-worn feet,
In a little while we're going Index;
And may loving hearts spread around an influence sweet!
In a little while we're going Index.

There's a rest beyond, there's relief from every care,
In a little while we're going Index;
And no tears shall fall in that city bright and fair,
In a little while we're going Index.

title:
Yqref'ro Yakob Atwere
Jacob's Ladder
songEN:
Yqref'ro Yakob atwere,
Yqref'ro Yakob atwere;
Yqref'ro Yakob atwere,
'Sqnnua ho nsraafo.

Anammxn biara kx soro,
Anammxn biara kx soro;
Anammxn biara kx soro
'Sqnnua ho nsraafo.

Bxn'yqfo, so wodx Yesu?
Bxn'yqfo, so wodx Yesu?
Bxn'yqfo, so wodx Yesu?
'Sqnnua ho nsraafo.

Qnde dqn nti na wonsom No?
Qnde dqn nti na wonsom No?
Qnde dqn nti na wonsom No?
'Sqnnua ho nsraafo.
songTWI:
We are climbing Jacob's ladder.
We are climbing Jacob's ladder.
We are climbing Jacob's ladder,
Soldiers of the cross.

Every round goes higher, higher.
Every round goes higher, higher.
Every round goes higher, higher,
Soldiers of the cross.

Sinner, do you love my Jesus?
Sinner, do you love my Jesus?
Sinner, do you love my Jesus?
Soldiers of the cross.

If you love Him, why not serve Him?
If you love Him, why not serve Him?
If you love Him, why not serve Him?
Soldiers of the cross.

title:
Yakob Akwantu Mu Da K'ro Bi B're a
As Jacob With Travel Was Weary
songEN:
Yakob akwantu mu da k'ro bi b're a
Xde 'bo yqq sumii daa so 'nadwo no,
Ohuu atw're tenten bi adehu mu,
Sq ne nan si fam na ne ti wx ewim.

Nnyeso
Haleluya nka Yesu a Owuu duan' so,
Sq Wama mmxb'rxhun 'atwer' so ama me;
Sq Wama mmxb'rxhun 'atwer' so ama me;

Mo a mopq nyinaa, mommra mma yqmf'ro,
Na Yakob abxfo da so bx ho ban;
Monkae sq gyidim' 'nammxn biarā a yetu n',
Odiyifo bi adi kan afa so.

Sq yqdu homebea hx a yqbqte
'Nigyesqm sq, "mommra ha, mō a wxahy'ra mo,
Hann nsase ni, na 'nigye afie nso ni,"
O, hena remf'ro atwer' a qte sqq?
songTWI:
As Jacob with travel was weary one day,
At night on a stone for a pillow he lay;
He saw in a vision a ladder so high
That its foot was on earth and its top in the sky.

Refrain
Alleluia to Jesus who died on the tree,
And has raised up a ladder of mercy for me,
And has raised up a ladder of mercy for me.

Come let us ascend! All may climb it who will;
For the angels of Jacob are guarding it still:
And remember each step that by faith we passo'er,
Some prophet or martyr has trod it before.

And when we arrive at the haven of rest
We shall hear the glad words, "Come up hither, ye blest,
Here are regions of light, here are mansions of bliss."
O who would not climb such a ladder as this?

title:
O'nigye Akwantufo
O Happy Band of Pilgrims
songEN:
O 'nigye akwantufo
Momfa Yesu yxnko;
Monnantew nkx Yesu a
Xyq mo Ti no nkyqn!

'Nigye ne mo sq mosom
Afof'ro sq Yesu;
'Nigye ne mo sq mudi
Mmuada nso sq Yesu!

Sxhwq pii na qto mo,
Muhyia 'w'rqhowdi ne
Nnyigye pii a owu nko
Na etum' siw ano.

Qyq Ne nhene pa a
Qsom bo xs'ro no;
Qnyq hwee sq atwer' a
Efi fam kx s'ro no.

O 'nigye akwantufo,
Monhwq s'ro, faako a
Saa 'hohia ketewa yi
Ma mo nkonimbo no.
songTWI:
O happy band of pilgrims,
If onward ye will tread
With Jesus as your fellow,
To Jesus as your Head!

O happy if ye labor
As Jesus did for men;
O happy if ye hunger
As Jesus hungered then!

The trials that beset you,
The sorrows ye endure,
The manifold temptations
That death alone can cure,

What are they but His jewels
Of right celestial worth?
What are they but the ladder
Set up to heaven on earth?

O happy band of pilgrims,
Look upward to the skies,
Where such a light affliction
Shall win you such a prize!

title:
Me Kra, Trqw Wo Ntaban Mu
Rise, My Soul, and Stretch Thy Wings

Sq Xbra No Duru Sum
When on Life a Darkness Falls
songEN:
Sq xbra no duru sum,
Bosu nwininwin' tx,
Na kwan so sqnky'rqnne y'ra
Ma huammxdi hyq mā a,
Fi W'asqnnuan' so bqn yqn,
'Wom yqtč xpow nka de,
Kōra yqn 'nadwo huhu yim'
Kosi sq ade bqkye.

Sq mmabun b're mu bxhyq
De yaw kqse brq yqn,
Na yqn 'honim bu yqn fx a,
Kristo rempo yqn da;
'Somdwoe a wiase ntum' mma,
Da biara fof'royq,
Ne ahohia mu yxnko
Akwanky'rq nyinaa mu.

Momfa 'sqmpa n' so mmehyia
Damfo ne 'Wura no,
Mummue nkwa ne 'somdwoe 'pon
Ne mpomma 'somdwoe mu;
Wxn a wxhwehwq No no,
Wxbqyq N'abusua;
Kristo, yqn kwan ne yqn fie,
Yqn fapem k'ro pq no.
songTWI:
When on life a darkness falls,
When the mist flows chilling,
Paths and sign posts lost in doubt,
Loveless, unfulfilling,
Reach us, Jesus, from Your cross,
Though we feel forsaken;
Keep us through the aching night
Till new dawns awaken.

When the dreams and vows of youth
Painfully accuse us,
Stab our conscience, steal our worth,
Christ will not refuse us:
Peace the world cannot provide,
Daily resurrection,
Strong companion at our side
For each new direction.

Come and meet Him, Friend and lord,
Thro' the gospel story:
Open door to life and peace,
Window into glory.
All who seek Him, soon are found,
Made His close relation:
Christ our pathway, Christ our Index,
Christ our sure foundation.

title:
Me Koma To Dwom Sq Mekae Sq Fam Ha
Until Then
songEN:
Me koma to dwom sq mekae sq fam ha
Dadwen no yq atrapxe bė a qwx
Xkwan a qkx xsoro no mu a,
Saa 'haw wiase 'i nyq mefi ankasa.

Nnyeso
Nanso me koma bqkx so ato dwom,
Mqkx so de 'nigye atoa so
Kosi da a m'aniwa behu kųro no
Na Nyame afrqm' akx fie no.

Asase so nneqma bqhwere wxn bo,
Wxde dii dwuma b're tiawa bi mu;
'Sase so nneqmā a qma koma popo n'
Yqkae a qbqyq anigye nko.
songTWI:
My heart can sing when I pause to remember
A heartache here is but a stepping stone
Along a trail that's winding always upward,
This troubled world is not my final Index.

Refrain
But until then my heart will go on singing,
Until then with joy I'll carry on
Until the day my eyes behold the city,
Until the day God calls me Index.

The things of earth will dim and lose their value
If we recall they're borrowed for a while;
And things of earth that cause the heart to tremble,
Remembered there will only bring a smile.

title:
Sq Yqn Ny'naa Du S'ro Hx a
Monto Yesu Anwanwa Dx
When We All Get to Heaven
songEN:
Monto Yesu anwanwa dx
'Hummxb'rx ne dom ho dwom,
Obesiesie trabea 'ma yqn
Wx adan fqfq no mu.

Nnyeso
Sq yqn ny'naa du s'ro hx a,
Qbqyq ahurusi da kqse!
Yqn ny'naa hu Yesu a,
Yqbqteam ato nkonim dwom.

B'rč a yqnam sq 'kwantufo yi,
Mununkum bqkata wim;
Nanso sq 'kwantu no sa a
Sunsuma bi nni hx bio.

Qnde momma yenni nokwar'
Nsom wx ahotosom 'daa,
Sq yehu No 'nuonyam mu a,
Yqn brq nyinaa to betwa.

Nkonimbo no da yqn anim!
Yebehu N'ahoxfq no;
Qnkyq, wobebue apon no,
Yqbenantew sika so.
songTWI:
Sing the wondrous love of Jesus,
Sing His mercy and His grace.
In the mansions bright and blessed
Hell prepare for us a place.

Refrain
When we all get to heaven,
What a day of rejoicing that will be!
When we all see Jesus,
Well sing and shout the victory!

While we walk the pilgrim pathway,
Clouds will overspread the sky;
But when traveling days are over,
Not a shadow, not a sigh.

Let us then be true and faithful,
Trusting, serving every day;
Just one glimpse of Him in glory
Will the toils of life repay.

Onward to the prize before us!
Soon His beauty well behold;
Soon the pearly gates will open;
We shall tread the streets of gold.

title:
Kristofo Ny'naa, Mommra Mmqyq
Come, All Christians, Be Committed
songEN:
Kristofo ny'naa, mommra mmqyq
Aw'rade adwuma no,
Munsiesie mo bra yie mma No,
Momma mo koma nyq k'ro.
Momfa dqw mmra N'abangua so,
Bxhyq kronkron fof'royem;
Monsan mfi bxn' ne yawdi ho,
Na wxmma mo nkwa fof'ro.

Momfa mo b're, talente mma,
Qyq Nyame akyqde;
Qsq sq Kristofo de yq
'Dwuma ka Ne dx hō asqm.
Mommra mmqsom Agyenkwa no,
Momfa akyqde ny'naa mmra;
Munnya Ne dom mo adwumam',
Momfa dqw nto N'ayeyi.

'Sq sq obiara dx ne nua,
Qyq Nyame ahyqde;
Afof'ro mmxbrxhun' no da
Ne nkwagye nhyehyqe adi.
Xdx Ne s'ro dx no ama
Esian Ne mmxbrxhun' nti,
Wxma bxn' fafri 'sqnnuan' so,
Dqw ne 'somdwoe yq wo de.

Mo a mogye Kristo di ny'naa,
Mommra 'yeyi ne nkamfom';
Monsom No ahodwira mu,
Mubenya xdom ne dx.
Ne dom nti monhyq No 'nuonyam,
Ne Honhom nč Asqm no nti,
Munsi 'sqmpa 'basqm no so
Mma 'dasamma nte Ne din.
songTWI:
Come, all Christians, be committed
To the service of the lord;
Make your lives for him more fitted,
Tune your hearts with one accord.
Come into His courts with gladness,
Each his sacred vows renew,
Turn away from sin and sadness,
Be transformed with life anew.

Of your time and talents give ye,
They are gifts from God above;
To be used by Christians freely
To proclaim His wondrous love.
Come again to serve the Savior,
Tithes and off'rings with you bring.
In your work, with Him find favor,
And with joy His praises sing.

God's command to love each other
Is required of every one;
Showing mercy to one another
Mirrors His redemptive plan.
In compassion He has given
Of His love that is divine;
On the cross sins were forgiven;
Joy and peace are fully thine.

Come in praise and adoration,
All who in Christ's name believe;
Worship Him with consecration,
Grace and love you will receive.
For His grace give Him the glory,
For the Spirit and the Word,
And repeat the gospel story
Till mankind His name has heard.

title:
Nnepa Ny'naa W'ra, Yqde
Lord of All Good
songEN:
Nnepa ny'naa W'ra, yqde y'akyqde brqW'
Fa yq adwuma sqnea Wo pq te;
Qbqyq xdx nkaede ne bxhyq,
Sq fa yqn nkwa nyinaa yq nea Wopq.

Yqde y'adwen maW' sq enhu W'akwan,
Na nne, nsa, ne 'niwa nyq W'adwuma;
Koma mfa W'ankasa dx gya nnqre,
Na yqn ahoxden ny'naa nhyq Wo 'nuonyam.

Agya a 'debx ny'naa ky'rq W'ayamye,
Kristō a N'afxrebx nti yqtč ase,
Honhom a xbra wie mudi Wo mu
Yqde yqn komam' aseda ma Mo.

title:
Nyame a W'adxe Nni Awiei
God, Whose Giving Knows No Ending
songEN:
Nyame a W'adxe nni awiei,
Wo dan mu wx nnepa pii;
'Bxde nwanwa, Yesu nyansa,
'Boxden 'sqnnua, owų apon.
Akyqde W'ra, yqba Wo hx,
Yqde yqn ho maW' yeyim'
Aseda dwom bqkx so daa,
Yqn nkwa Mafo ne Domfo.

Nimdeq ne b're wx yqn, b're a
Yqbqn Kristo botae no;
Yqn nyinaa wx ahofadi,
Mmusua bom, 'safo yq k'ro.
Di yqn daa daa adwuma so,
Na yqanyq amma yqn ho;
Yqwx talqnte, yq yqn nkoa,
Ma yqmfata Wo som no.

'Gyapade nso, Woama yqn bi,
Wo dom na qde ma yqn;
Yqde boa fie ne abusua,
De trqw W' Asqmpa no mu.
Bue yqn nsam ma afoforo,
B'rč a yetie Kristo frq no;
Yqnam 'yaresa ne nky'rqky'rq
Ne xdx so bqsom Wo.
songTWI:
God, whose giving knows no ending,
From Your rich and endless store:
Nature's wonder, Jesus' wisdom,
Costly cross, grave's shattered door.
Gifted by You, we turn to You,
Off'ring up ourselves in praise:
Thankful song shall rise forever,
Gracious donor of our days.

Skills and time are ours for pressing
Toward the goals of Christ, Your Son:
All at peace in health and freedom,
Races joined, the church made one.
Now direct our daily labor,
Lest we strive for self alone:
Born with talents, make us servants
Fit to answer at Your throne.

Treasure, too, You have entrusted,
Gain through pow'rs Your grace conferred:
Ours to use for Index and kindred,
And to spread the Gospel Word.
Open wide our hands in sharing,
As we heed Christ's ageless call.
Healing, teaching, and reclaiming,
Serving You by loving all.

title:
Onyame Ba, Daa Agyenkwa
Son of God, Eternal Savior
songEN:
Onyame Ba, daa agyenkwa,
Nkwa, nokwar' ne dom suti,
Asqm a qbqyqq honam,
Wō a W'awo tew nnipa ho.
Yqn Tė a Wudi hen' 'nuonyam mu
Wo mma bqsrq Wo daa sq
Fa W' dx ne tema hyq yqn ma,
Sa yqn mfomso na boa yqn.

Ka yqn nyinaa bom biakoyq mu,
W'asafokuw kronkron nom',
Mm'rqwyqfo ne ahoxdenfo
Mmofra ne mpanyimfo ny'naa.
So yedi hia anaa 'w'rqhow?
Ma yqn ny'naa nsoa nnesoa yi,
So akra binom abotow?
'W'ra ky'rq yqn ma yqmmoa wxn.

Sqnea Wotra maa 'fof'ro no,
'W'ra, ma yqn nso yqntra bi,
Wode W'akyqde ama kwa
Ma W'asomfo nso nyq saa.
Sika ne dwetq yq Wo de,
'Sase ne pom' nneqma ny'naa;
Yqyq ahwqfo a Wode
S'ro nnepa ahyq yqn nsa.

Kristo, bra bedi hen' yqn mu,
Xdx ne Asomdwoe Hen';
Pam ap'rep're ne akxnnx
Na ma mpaapaemu to ntwa.
Fa Wo boasetx nnwuma no,
Ne yaw a Wudii no so,
Dwudwo yqn wiase 'nigye ne
Pqsqm'kominyā ano.

Onyame Ba, daa Agyenkwa,
Nkwa, nokwar' ne dom nsuti;
Asqm a qbqyqq honam,
Wō a W'awo tew nnipa ho.
Wo mpaebx ne W'apqde sq
Wo nk'rxfo bqyq k'ro nti,
Ma yqn anidaso mmra mu;
Wo pq nyq hx wx fam ha.
songTWI:
Son of God, eternal Savior,
Source of life and truth and grace,
Work made flesh, whose birth among us
Hallows all our human race,
You our head, who throned in glory,
For Your own will ever plead:
Fill us with Your love and pity,
Heal our wrongs, and help our need.

Bind us all as one together
In Your church's sacred fold,
Weak and healthy, poor and wealthy,
Sad and joyful, young and old.
Is there want or pain or sorrow?
Make us all the burden share.
Are there spirits crushed and broken?
Teach us, Lord, to soothe their care.

As You, Lord, have lived for others,
So may we for others live.
Freely have Your gifts been granted;
Freely may Your servants give.
Yours the gold and Yours the silver,
Yours the wealth of land and sea;
We but stewards of Your bounty
Held in solemn trust will be.

Come, O Christ, and reign among us,
King of love and Prince of Peace;
Hush the storm of strife and passion,
Bid its cruel discords cease.
By Your patient years of toiling,
By Your silent hours of pain,
Quench our fevered thirst of pleasure,
Stem our selfish greed of gain.

Son of God, eternal Savior,
Source of life and truth and grace,
Word made flesh, whose birth among us
Hallows all our human race:
By Your praying, by Your willing
That Your people should be one,
Grant, oh, grant our hope's fruition:
Here on earth Your will be done.

title:
Nyansafo De Wxn Nimdeq
The Wise May Bring Their Learning
songEN:
Nyansafo de wxn nimdeq
Adefo, wxn sika,
'Binom de wxn kqseyq
Ebi nso wxn 'hoxden;
Yqn nso de yqn 'gyapade,
Rebqma Xhen' no,
Yenni sika ne nimdeq-
Dqn na yqde bqba?

Yqde koma bqdx No,
Na yqato N'ayeyi;
Akra nkumaa de xdwo
Bqnantew N'akwan so.
'Yinom bqyq 'gyapadč a
Yqde ma Xhen' no,
'Yi ne 'kyqde a 'bofra
Biara betum' ama.

Yqbqyq nnwuma nkumaā a
Yqyq da biara no,
Yqbqsx N'ani wx fie,
'Suabea ne agodim';
'Yinom yq 'gyapade pā a
Yqde brq Xhen' no.
'Kyqde bi nkwati 'yinom,
Nso mmofra de bqba.
songTWI:
Wise may bring their learning,
The rich may bring their wealth,
And some may bring their greatness,
And some their strength and health:
We too would bring our treasures
To offer to the King,
We have no wealth or learning—
What shall we children bring?

We'll bring Him hearts that love Him,
We'll bring Him thankful praise,
And young souls meekly striving
To follow in His ways:
And these be the treasures
We offer to the King,
And these are gifts that ever
The poorest child may bring.

We'll bring the little duties
We have to do each day;
We'll try our best to please Him
At Index, at school, at play:
And better are these treasures
To offer to the King
Than richest gift without them:
Yet these a child may bring.

title:
A Seda Hyq Me Koma Ma
A Diligent and Grateful Heart
songEN:
A seda hyq me koma ma
Sq mento W'ayeyi;
Wo dx ne W'adxe fi mfiase
Ahy'ra me besi nnq.

Meda W'ase me talqnte
Ne ntoso du som ho;
'Fisq xma de 'nigye ba,
B'rč a qboa afof'ro.

Meda W'ase, 'hwqfo som a
Qma meyq adxe;
Qma mede boasetx boa
Wo mma wxn ahohiam'.

O 'W'ra, Wo frq no nti mede
Nea mewx ny'naa ma Wo;
Boa ma mentrqw xfrq no mu
Ahobrqase pa mu.
songTWI:
A diligent and grateful heart
Prompts me to sing Thy praise.
Thy love and mercies from the start
Have blessed me all my days.

I thank Thee for the means to serve
With talents and with tithes,
For sharing brings the utmost joy
When lifting other lives.

My thanks I give you for stewardship
To minister through deeds,
To serve and share with patient care
Thy people in their needs.

O Lord, I dedicate my all
In this response to Thee.
Help me to magnify this call
In deep humility.

title:
Sare a Qyq Fq Ne Nnua Akqse
For Beauty Of Meadows
songEN:
Sare a qyq fq ne nnua akqse,
Nhwiren a 'wx kwae mu, 'po mu mmoadoma,
Nea Wobx de maa yqn sq yqnkyq ny'naa nti,
Yeyi W'ayq 'Bxadeq, Kamfo W' Nhwqso pa.

Yqyq 'hwqsofo ma Wo nsam nnepa ne
Abxde a yetie W'ahyqde no nti,
Yqdan fi yqn adesqe suban ho na
Yqka yqn huammxdi ne yqn akodi.

Ky'rq yqn bio ma yqnyq akuafo 'somdwoem';
Wode abxdem' nneqma ny'naa afqm yqn;
Yqbqtew Wo din ho nea yqyq ny'naa mu
Agye yqn frq no so ne W' ayq 'dwuma
songTWI:
For beauty of meadows, for grandeur of trees,
For flowers of woodlands, for creatures of seas,
For all You created and gave us to share,
We praise You, Creator, extolling your care.

As stewards of beauty received at Your hand,
As creatures who hear Your most urgent command,
We turn from our wasteful destruction of life,
Confessing our failures, confessing our strife.

Teach us once again to be gardeners in peace;
All nature around us is ours but on lease;
Your name we would hallow in all that we do,
Fulfilling our calling, creating with You.

title:
Nyame Nam Dx So De 'Sase Yi Fqm Yqn
God in His Love for Us
songEN:
Nyame nam dx so de 'sase yi fqm yqn,
Xmaa no botae wx b're ne beae mu;
Adebx mu ade ketewaa bi de,
Nanso qno ne adasa atrae.

Aseda nka Nyame wx emu nnepa
Ne nkwa a ekura yqn mu no ho,
Yqkyq no yie a, qso obiara so,
Ahonya a emu nni hwehwqbea.

Akodi fi tete asqe so nnxbae;
Nhyqso fi tete amia asase,
Yefi tete asqe nea 'hia ma binom,
Ahwie bxne agu nkwa nsuti hx.

'Sase yq 'W'rade dea, Xde ama yqn,
Sq ahwqfo a yqnnx mmx ho ban;
Aw'rade pa, yi yqn fi ne sqe ny'naa ho,
Kosi wiase a enni awiei nom'!
songTWI:
God in His love for us lent us this planet,
Gave it a purpose in time and in space:
Small as a spark from the fire of creation,
Cradle of life and the Index of our race.

Thanks be to God for its bounty and beauty,
Life that sustains us in body and mind:
Plenty for all, if we learn how to share it,
Riches undreamed of to fathom and find.

Long have our human wars ruined its harvest;
Long has earth bowed to the terror of forced;
Long have we wasted what others have need of,
Poisoned the fountain of life at its source.

Earth is the Lord's: it is ours to enjoy it,
Ours, as His stewards, to farm and defend.
From its pollution, misuse, and destruction,
Good Lord, deliver us, world without end!

title:
Yqde Adwen a Qyq Nnam
We Praise Thee With Our Minds
songEN:
Yqde adwen a qyq nnam
Yi W'ayq, dwen W'adwen;
Honhom Kronkron, fa Wo dom bra,
Ky'rq yqn nea Kristo ky'rqe.
Yqn adesuam', ma yemmisa
S'ro nyansā a qba ma
'Hoxdenfo ne 'hobrqasefō a
Wobisa wx gyidim'.

Yede nipaduā a qyq den
Yi W'ayq, yq Wo pq;
Honhom no asxrefie a
Yefi mu yi W'ayq.
Yqde yqn ho nyinaa ma Wo
Sq afxrebxde;
'Fisq Wo nko na Woatua yqn
Nkwagye ka ama yqn.

Yqde koma a qyq kronn
Yi W'ayq, hu W'akwan;
Na yqma yqn nne so to dwom
De yi W'ayq daa daa.
Koma a nkamfo ahyq ma
Bqsom Wo daapem de,
Yqde y'adwen ne nipadua
Yi Wo ayq seesei.
songTWI:
We praise Thee with our minds, O Lord,
Kept sharp think Thy thought;
Come, Holy Ghost with grace outpoured,
To teach what Christ hath taught.
In all our learning may we seek
That wisdom from above
Which comes to all: the brave, the meek,
Who ask in faith and love.

We praise Thee thro' our bodies, Lord,
Kept strong to do Thy will;
Thy Spirit's temples, which afford
A means to praise Thee still.
We give ourselves, a sacrifice,
To live as unto Thee;
For Thou alone hast paid the price
To bring salvation free.

We praise Thee in our hearts, O king,
Kept pure to know Thy ways;
And raise to Thee a hymn to sing
Eternally Thy praise.
Altho adoring hearts will bow
As age on ages roll;
We praise Thee in our beings now,
Mind, body, heart, and soul.

title:
Agya a Wuhwie 'Kyqde Pii
Father, Who on Us Do Shower
songEN:
Agya a Wuhwie 'kyqde pii
Fi W'akorae gu yqn so no,
Ma Wo nk'rxfo tum' a yqde
'Kyqde n' bqyq nnwuma pa.

Ma yqn 'homegyem' 'nigye pa,
Dqw mu 'nidahx na yqmfa
Fam ha nnepa nni dwuma wx
Nipadua ne honhom pa m'.

Yi nea qde animguase
Ba aman ny'naa mu no fi hx;
Brq sxhwq tumi ny'naa ase,
Na ma W'atamfo nso nguan.

Agya a Wohwehwq huu yqn,
Nyame Bā a Wo dx kyeky're yqn;
Honhom a Wo ne yqn wx hx
Nyame Baasak'ro, tie yqn.
songTWI:
Father, who on us do shower
Gifts of plenty form Your dower,
To Your people give the power
All Your gifts to use aright.

Give pure happiness in leisure
Temperance in every pleasure,
Wholesome use of earthly treasure
Bodies clean and spirits bright.

Lift from this and every nation
All that brings us degradation;
Quell the forces of temptation;
Put Your enemies to flight.

Father, You who sought and found us,
Son of God, whose love has bound us,
Holy Spirit, in us, round us,
Hear us, Godhead infinite.

title:
Nyame a Wo Pq Yq Nkwa Ma
O God, Whose Will Is Life and Good
songEN:
Nyame a Wo pq yq nkwa ma
Adasamma nyinaa;
Ka Wo nkoā a wxne owu di
Ap'rep're nyinaa bom.

Hyq wxn nsa ne wxn koma den
Ma wxmpam nyarewa;
Wxmfa W'ayar'sa tum' nko ntia
Niapduam' nyarewa.

Wxnam ayaresa so yi
Kristo mmxb'rxhun' ne
'Duyqfo kqsen' adwen ky'rq
Ma 'Gyenkwa no din so.

Fa Wo pq no si wxn anim
Ma womfi komam mfa
Wxn nimdeq mma Wo na wxnsa
'Manehun'fo yare.
songTWI:
O God, whose will is life and good
For all of mortal breath:
Unite in bonds of servanthood
All those who strive with death.

Make strong their hands and hearts and wills
To drive disease afar,
To strive against the body's ills
And wage Your healing war.

By healing of the sick and blind,
Christ's mercy they proclaim,
Make known the great physician's mind,
Affirm the Savior's name.

Before them set Your gracious will,
That they, with heart and soul,
To You may consecrate their skill
And make the sufferer whole.

title:
Yqn Agyanom Nyame a WoTumi Nsa
God of Our Fathers
songTWI:
God of our fathers, whose almighty hand
Leads forth in beauty all the starry band
Of shining world insplendor through the skies,
Our grateful songs before Thy throne arise.

Thy love divine hath led us in the past,
In this free land by Thee our lots is cast;
Be Thou our ruler, guardian, guide, and stay,
Thy word our law, Thy paths our chosen way.

From war's alarms, from deadly pestilence,
Be Thy strong arm our ever sure defense;
Thy true religion in our hearts increase,
Thy bounteous goodness nourish us in peace.

Refresh Thy people on their toilsome way,
Lead us from night to never-ending day;
Fill all our lives with love and grace divine,
And glory, laud, and praise be ever Thine.

title:
Ma Aman Nyinaa Nkoto Din
To The Name That Brings Salvation
songEN:
Ma aman nyinaa nkoto din
A qde nkwagye ba no,
Sq wxbx din mu Din yi a,
Ma wxnkoto ayeyim',
Ma wxmmx mpae nsrq fof'royq
Mma Kristom nneqma nyinaa.

Odi hen' daa kqseyq mu,
Awo ntoatoaso biaram',
Ma amanaman ahemfo
Nto wxn nitan ngu seesei
Wxmfa 'hobrqase ne 'nidi
Nyq nok'ro Nyame dx mu.

'W'ra, yqsrq ma 'mansodifo,
Ma wonnya Wo nkyqn banbx
Mfi tumidi a qmfra ne
Adiufudepq hun' mu;
Ma wonhu 'hobrwasem' nokwar'
Na wommu atqntrenee.
songTWI:
To the name that brings salvation
Let the nations bow the head;
Let them kneel in adoration
When this name of names is said;
Let them pray for restoration
Of all things in Christ the head.

He through every generation
Rules in endless majesty;
May the kings of every nation
Now foreswear their enmity,
And with humble veneration
In the love of God agree.

Lord, we pray for upright rulers:
Guard them surely in their need
From the vanity of power
And the emptiness of greed;
Let them see the truth of lowness,
And on justice let them feed.

title:
M'aniwa Ahu Aw'rade
Mine Eyes Have Seen the Glory
songEN:
M'aniwa ahu Aw'rade
Mmae no ho anuonyam no;
Xretiatia nsakyiamoa so
Nea wxasie 'bufuw boben';
Wagyaa Ne nkrantq nnamnam no,
Aprannaa huhu no mu;
Ne nokwar' nam rekx.

Nnyeso
'Nuonyam, 'nuonyam, Haleluya!
'Nuonyam, 'nuonyam, Haleluya!
'Nuonyam, 'nuonyam, Haleluya!
Ne nokwar' nam rekx.

Wahyqn 'robqnto a emu
Nni akyirisan biara;
Xresxne koma ny'naa so,
N'atemmu agua n' anim;
O, me kra yq ntqm tie No na
Me nan nso nni ah'rusi!
Yqn Nyame nam rekx.

Sukookoo ahoxfq mu na
Wxwoo Kristo pō agya hx,
Na anuonyam a qsakra
Yqn tebea wx Ne kokom;
Sq Ne wu tew nnipa ho no
Momma yqn bra nnye nnipa!
B'rč a Nyame nam rekx.
songTWI:
Mine eyes have seen the glory
Of the coming of the Lord;
He is trampling out the vintage
Where the grapes of wrath are stored;
He has loosed the fateful lightning
Of His terrible swift sword;
His truth is marching on.

Refrain
Glory! Glory! Halelujah!
Glory! Glory! Halelujah!
Glory! Glory! Halelujah!
His truth is marching on.

He has sounded forth the trumpet
That shall never call retreat;
He is sifting out the hearts
Of men before His judgment seat;
O be swift, my soul, to answer Him;
Be jubilant, my feet!
Our God is marching on.

In the beauty of the lilies
Christ was born across the sea,
With the glory in His bosom
That transfigures you and me;
As He died to make men holy,
Let us live to make men free!
While God is marching on.

title:
Me Man, Mede Me Dx Som
I Vow to Thee, My Country
songEN:
Me man, mede me dx som a ewie mudi na
Qtra asase so nneqma nyinaa hyq wo bx;
'Dx a qhwehwq ntease na egyina sxhwqm',
Nea qde n'ade a qsom bo bx afxre;
'Dx a entumi nhinhim 'dx a enni huammx,
'Dx a qbx afxre a suro biara nnim.

'Man fof'ro bi nso wx hx x mate ho asqm,
Qsom bo pii ma wxn a wonim na wxdx no;
Yqrentumi nhu n'asraafo ne Ne Hen' no de,
N'aban yq nokware koma, qhoahoa ne ho
Yawdim', yqn mu biara bx mpae daa ma ne nkxso,
Na n'akwan ny'naa yq xdwo ne asomdwoe nkutoo.
songTWI:
I vow to thee, my country,
all earthly things above,
Entire the whole and perfect,
the service of my love:
The love that asks the reason,
The love that stands the test,
That lays upon the altar
The dearest and the best;
The love that never falters,
The love that pays the price,
The love that makes undaunted
The final sacrifice.

And there's another country,
I've heard long ago,
Most dear to them that love her,
Most great to them that know;
We may not count her armies,
We may not see her King;
Her fortress is a faithful heart,
Her pride is suffering;
And one by one and fervently
We pray for her increase,
And her ways are ways of gentleness
And all her paths are peace.

title:
'W'ra Yqrebx Mpae Ma Nnipā a
Lord, While for All Mankind
songEN:
'W'ra yqrebx mpae ma nnipā a
Wxwx baabiara yi;
O tie yqn, yqn asase nti
'Sase a yqdx no.

Bx yqn mpoano ho ban na ma
Yqn ahye so 'somdwoe;
Ma yqn nkuro nnya nkxso na
Yqn nnxbae nso nnxxso.

Fa xdx kronkron ka yqn bom
Nimdeq mu ne Wo mu;
Na ma yqn nkoko ne abon
Nto ahofadi nnwom.

Aman nyinaa Wura, yqde
Yqn man yi hyq Wo nsa;
Yq ne guankxbea, 'nidaso,
Ne ne daa daa yxnko.
songTWI:
Lord, while for all mankind we pray,
Of every clime and coast,
O hear us from our native land,
The land we love the most.

O guard our shores form every foe;
With peace our borders bless;
With prosperous times our cities crown,
Our fields with plenteousness.

Unite us in the sacred love
Of knowledge, truth, and Thee,
And let our hills and valleys shout
The songs of liberty.

Lord of the nations, thus to Thee
Our country we commend;
Be Thou her refuge and her trust,
Her everlasting friend.

title:
Agya a Wo Din Ma
Our Father, by Whose Name
songEN:
Agya a Wo din ma
Yqte baatanyq ase,
Wo a Wode dx yq
'Busua biara Wo de;
Hyira 'wofo nyinaa na fa
Xdx wqn Wo nkurxfo no
Wx wxn atrae sq Xwqmfo.

Kristo, Woyqq 'bofra
Wx asase so ha, Wo a Wufi komā a
Qyq kronn mu nyinii;
Hyira yqn mmofra baabiara,
Sqnea wxn ny'naa behu W'anim
Na wxanyin Wo ho nimdeq mu.

Honhom a Woka yqn
Koma bom biakoyqm',
Na Woma yehu 'dx Wx ahofadi mu;
Saa 'dx no nyin wx yqn komam'
Sqnea ofie biara nam so
Bqyq asomdwoe trabea pa.
songTWI:
Our Father, by whose name,
All fatherhood is known,
Who dost in love proclaim
Each family Thine own,
Bless Thou all parents, guarding well,
With constant love as sentinel,
The Indexs in which Thy people dwell.

O Christ, Thyself a child
Within an earthly Index,
With heart still undefiled,
Thou didst to manhood come;
Our children bless, in every place,
That they may all behold Thy face,
And knowing Thee may grow in grace.

O Spirit, who dost bind
Our hearts in unity,
Who teaches us to find
The love from self set free,
In all our hearts such love increase,
That every Index, by this release,
May be dwelling place of peace.

title:
'Nigye Ne Fič a Qgye Wo Tom
Happy the Index That Welcomes You
songEN:
'Nigye ne fič a qgye Wo tom, 'W'ra Yesu,
Adamfo nokwafo ne yxnko pa;
Nea koma ne 'aniwa de dqw hyia Wo,
Na wxde ahop're yq W'apqde.

'Nigye ne fič a awarefo tra bom na
Wxde adwenk'ro gye Wo dx no di
Dx ne yaw mu, nkxso ne ahohia mu
Tebea ny'naam', wxda Wo banbx adi.

'Nigye ne fič a wxde mmofra brq Wo wx
Mpaebx mu, O mmofra Yxnko dxfo!
Faakō a wxtra Wo nan ase yq setie
Ma W'asqm da W' ase Wo banbx ho.
songTWI:
Happy the Index that welcomes You, Lord Jesus,
Truest of friends, most honored of all,
Where hearts and eyes are bright wit h joy to greet You,
Your lightest wishes eager to fulfill.

Happy the Index where man and wife together
Are of one mind believing in Your love:
Through love and pain, prosperity and hardship,
Through good and evil days Your care they prove.

Happy the Index, O loving Friend of children,
Where they are giv'n to you with hands of prayer,
Where at Your feet they early learn to listen
To Your own Words, and thank You for your care

title:
'Dx Wx Fie
A Hotew Wx Baabiara
Love at Index
songEN:
A hotew wx baabiara,
B'rč a xdx wx fie;
Xdqw wx nne biara mu,
B'rč a xdx wx fie.
Xmee ne 'somdwoe wx hx,
Xserew wx baabiara,
Qbere nso sen bxkxx,
B'rč a xdx wx fie.

Nnyeso
'Dx wx fie, 'dx wx fie,
Qbere nso sen bxkxx,
B'rč a xdx wx fie.

Xserew pa wx soro,
B'rč a xdx wx fie;
Xdx hyq 'sase so ma,
B'rč a xdx wx fie.
Asuten to dwom dqdq,
Ewim nso hyerqn fqfq,
Obi serew soro hx,
B'rč a xdx wx fie.

Yesu, ma menyq Wo de,
Na xdx wx fie;
Ma W'afxre nyq me de,
Na xdx wx fie.
Na daa mahome dwoodwoo,
Na bxne bi anhaw me,
W'ahummxb'rx nhyira nom',
B'rč a xdx wx fie.
songTWI:
There is beauty all around,
When there's love at Index;
There is joy in every sound,
When there's love at Index.
Peace and plenty here abide,
Smiling fair on every side;
Time doth softly, sweetly glide,
When there's love at Index.

Refrain
Love at Index, love at Index;
Time doth softly, sweetly glide,
When there's love at Index.

Kindly heaven smiles above,
When there's love at Index;
All the earth is fill'd with love,
When there's love at Index.
Sweeter sings the brooklet by,
Brighter beams the azure sky;
O, there's One who smiles on high
When there's love at Index.

Jesus, make me wholly Thine,
Then there's love at Index;
May Thy sacrifice be mine,
Then there's love at Index.
Safely from all harm I'll rest,
With no sinful care distress'd,
Thro' Thy tender mercy blessed,
When there's love at Index.

title:
Me Nyame, Ky'rq Wxn Kwan
Bra Wo Nkyqn Hx
Lead Me to Calvary
songEN:
Me Nyame, ky'rq wxn kwan
Bra Wo nkyqn hx,
Mma dxfo a Wode Wxn ama me;
O, fa Wo s'ro dx no

Nyeso
Ky'rq wxn kwan bra Wo nkyqn;
Me Nyame, ky'rq wxn kwan
Bra Wo nkyqn hx.

Wiase yq akxnnx Ne 'nigye a,
Mma nnaadaa af'ri nntwe
Wxn nnkx 'yeram',
Gye wxn fi sxhwqm' na

Nkokoaa sqq nti, Kristo
Bqyqq 'kokoaa; Na bxne wiase yim',
Wanyq bxne; Ne nti mebx mpae sq,

Me gyidi sua mpo a, Minim yie sq,
Wobqgye 'kyqde a Qsom bo yi.
Fa wxn koma yi na
songTWI:
King of my life, I crown Thee now,
Thine shall the glory be;
Lest I forget Thy thorn-crowned brow,
Lead me to Calvary.

Refrain
Lest I forget Gethsemane;
Lest I forget Thine agony;
Lest I forget Thy love for me,
Lead me to Calvary.

Show me the tomb where Thou wast laid,
Tenderly mourned and wept;
Angels in robes of light arrayed
Guarded Thee whilst Thou slept.

Let me like Mary, thru the gloom,
Come with a gift to Thee;
Show to me now the empty tomb,
Lead me to Calvary.

May I be willing, Lord, to bear
Daily my cross for Thee;
Even Thy cup of grief to share,
Thou hast borne all for me.

title:
'W'ra, Fa 'Somdwoe, 'Dx Ne
Lord, Bless Our Indexs
songEN:
'W'ra, fa 'somdwoe, 'dx ne
